La socia Balbina continúa con su negocio de agricultura, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, a la vez la socia sigue dedicándose  a su negocio de crianza de animales menores, la socia continua criando a sus animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes entre otros.
Los socios en general  se sienten agradecidos  por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Balbina belongs to the communal bank 7 DE JUNIO PALMAREAL. This bank is located in the province of La Convención in the city of Cusco. Balbina has an agricultural business, and she is very responsible and diligent. Currently, she also makes a living through her business raising young animals. She raises small animals in order to sell them later to customers who request them from her. Through the work she does, she is able to support her family.

Balbina is requesting a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and more. The members in general are grateful for the loan to be granted, and they promise to fulfill the loan payments as established.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and more.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a 40-year-old, married woman from Carles, Iloilo.

Two years ago, this woman started her business with the help of her husband. They own a bakery shop in front of their sari-sari store (general store) that sells a variety of goods. They work every day running this business to provide for the needs of their family.

But the profits that they earn from their sales aren't enough. They want to improve their ways of living, so as to have enough money to buy daily needs such as food, personal care products, and some household expenses . They even need money for their children’s school payments. They have three dependent children who still are in need of their support.

That is why she is requesting a bigger amount of loan to buy ingredients in making bread such as flour, sugar and margarine. She also needs to buy a variety of goods such as chips, candies, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink, and juice.

Rose's only goal in life is to send her children to school so they have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, margarine, chips, candies, biscuits, canned goods, noodles, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, powdered milk, powdered chocolate drink, and juice.

loans.name: Sopiah

texts.en:
Good day, lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Sopiah, who is a 36-year-old married woman with two sons. Sopiah has been selling clothes for nine years, and her husband has been a greengrocer for seven years.

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation facilities at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Sopiah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation facilities at their home, improving access to sanitation and clean water for their family

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en:
Benjamin is in his mid 20s and is married with one kid who is still small. He has been running a business of selling home utensils for one and a half years now.

This will be Benjamin's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to increase his business stock. He dreams of owning a big shop for selling his products.

Benjamin will be accountable for paying back his loan.

loans.use: to increase stock of home utensils to meet his customers' requirements.

loans.name: Jenalyn

texts.en:
Jenalyn is a 33-year-old woman. She is single and lives with her parents. She has a retail store serving several customers; she sells assorted groceries and beverages to generate income.

Jenalyn has been five years in this field. Jenalyn is working hard every day in order to provide income for her siblings and to show customers her responsibility and reliability to serve.

Jenalyn requested this loan to purchase canned goods, soft drinks and grains for sale in her store. She is aiming to develop her business and increase her profits so that she may open a bigger place and continue assisting her siblings with the additional income.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Musa has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With the help of this loan, Musa can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

 As a Babban Gona member, Musa will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Musa is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mirian

texts.es:
Mirian es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, proviene de una familia humilde de padres agricultores, Ella está trabajando y a la vez estudia enfermería, ya que quiere ser una buena profesional que ayude a las demás personas.
Comenta que le gusta mucho lo que esta estudiando, y está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder cumplir su anhelo de ser una profesional.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y así seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Mirian comes from a modest background in Carapeguá.  Her parents are small farmers.  She is working her way through nursing school and hopes to make a career helping people.  She says that she likes school and is working hard to fulfill her dream.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to pay university-related costs.  The investment will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay university-related costs.

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es:
Camilo es una persona que se esfuerza mucho para poder salir adelante, el comenta que su familia es muy humilde pero trabajadora, él está estudiando la carrera de comercio exterior, y por medio de sus estudios quiere salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Él pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder ser alguien en la vida y seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Camilo's family doesn't have a lot but they have always worked hard.  He, too, works hard and is studying for a degree in international business.  He hopes his hard work will pay off and that he will be able to help his family get ahead in the world.  He is applying for a loan that he will use to pay university-related costs.  The investment will allow him to continue his studies.  He is grateful, he says, for your help and the chance to be someone in life.

loans.use: to pay university-related costs.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
Jose está continuando con sus estudios en la carrera de Derecho, el esta poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder ser un profesional útil, no solo a si mismo, sino también a los demás. Es una persona muy sacrificada que quiere ser alguien en la vida. Comenta que su anterior préstamo lo uso en pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente la cuota de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir sus anhelos.
texts.en:
Jose is continuing with his law degree. He is putting his utmost into becoming a professional who is useful to others as well as himself. He is a very selfless person who wants to be someone in life. He says that he used his previous loan to pay the university fees for his degree and that it was very helpful.

Now he is requesting another loan in order to pay more university fees so that he can continue to pursue his dreams.

loans.use: to pay university fees

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco es una persona que se sacrifica mucho para poder cumplir con sus metas y anhelos de ser un buen profesional. Él está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, y por medio de sus estudios quiere poder ayudar a su familia.
Una vez que termine su carrera quiere seguir estudiando y capacitándose para poder crecer.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma solventar ese gasto que tiene. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en: Francisco has sacrificed a lot for the university degree that he hopes to get.  He is studying accounting and expects to be able to help his family once he starts earning a living.  He hopes too that he can continue building his skills after he finishes his course work.  Francisco is applying for a loan that he will use to pay his tuition.  He is grateful, he says, for the opportunity that your loans provide.

loans.use: to pay university-related costs.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y es por medio de sus estudios que quiere poder ayudar a sus seres queridos y a su familia.
Su meta es poder seguir estudiando una vez terminada su carrera y abrirse camino al mundo laboral. Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el gasto de su tesis y de esa forma poder cubrir ese gasto que tiene, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida a través de sus estudios.
texts.en: Rocio is from the city of Ybycuí and is working on a nursing degree.  She hopes she can earn a living soon so that she can start helping her family.  Her immediate goal is to finish her degree and find paid work.  She is applying for a loan that she will use to pay expenses related to her thesis.  She is grateful, she says, for your help and this chance to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay expenses related to her thesis.

loans.name: Perpetuo Socorro Group

texts.es:
El grupo Perpetuo Socorro está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, para poder conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder luchar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, una mujer muy sacrificada que se dedica a hacer comidas ella misma en su casa, comenta que tiene muy buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las delicias que vende, y a través de este trabajo tiene los medios para procurarse una vida digna y sin necesidades.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para hacer sus comidas, como ser verduras, carnes, condimentos, pollo y otros, y de esa forma cumplir con sus clientes y seguir luchando en su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group “Perpetuo Socorro” is on its ninth loan cycle. They are all doing the poverty elimination survey in order to ascertain each member’s situation of life so that they can fight to improve their living conditions.

One of the members is Maria. She is a very selfless woman who makes a living by preparing food at home. She says that she has a very good clientele who always buy from her and that this work gives her the means to have a decent life and not live in want.

Maria is requesting this loan so she can buy ingredients for making her food, such as vegetables, meat, condiments, and chicken. In this way, she can meet the demand from her clients and continue to forge ahead with her work.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for making food, such as vegetables, meat, condiments, and chicken

loans.name: Nidia

texts.es:
Nidia continua con sus estudios para poder ser profesora en trabajo y tecnología, es una persona que se sacrifica mucho por sus metas y objetivos, comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda para poder seguir con sus estudios.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Nidia is working on a teaching degree and hopes to teach career- and technical education-related subjects.  She has sacrificed a lot to fulfill her goals, she says, and used a past loan to pay other university-related expenses.  She is applying for a new loan now that she will also use for university-related expenses.  The investment will allow her to continue her studies.

loans.use: to pay university-related costs.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
His name is Edward, 46 years old, from the province of Gen. Trias, Cavite, Philippines. Separated from his wife, he has two children whom he sends to elementary school. He put up a water refilling station to support himself and his children.

Due to a high demand for cleaner water, a water refilling station business became one of the most promising and profitable businesses today.

His water station has been his main source of income for three years already and is doing well. He serves the needs of his community and its neighboring communities. To sustain and pay for the repair and service of his water refilling station he is requesting funds in the amount of PHP 20,000. He is thankful to Kiva and its supporters for their valued help to small businessmen like him. He trusts you would consider his request.

Edward aims to acquire his own place for his water station and continue to support his kids. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for the repair and service of his water refilling station.

loans.name: Yau

texts.en:
Yau is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yau has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Yau would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, in order to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Yau can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Yau will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Yau is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family, and he looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jihad

texts.en:
Jihad is a 22-year-old man from Al-yamoun in Jenin City, which is located on the West Bank. He wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.

So, Jihad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar system for heating water for the family home. By taking this loan, Jihad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas). Jihad’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking and also washing clothes and dishes.

Jihad appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a solar system for heating water for the family home.

loans.name: Tindpaosgo Hommes Koubri Ps Group

texts.fr:
Mr ISSOUFOU  est  le responsable du groupe TINDPAOSGO HOMMES KOUBRI PS. Il est marié et père de 02 enfants. Le plus âgé a 04 ans et le moins âgé a 03 mois. Aucun enfant ne  va à l’école  et il a 05 personnes en charges.
Mr fait du jardinage depuis plus de 15 ans. Il s’approvisionne dans les villages environnants.
Avec l’argent octroyé, il compte s’acheter 07sacs d’engrais,  02  boîtes de graine de choux et 01 carton  d’herbicide.
Il veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour renforcer son activité. Il ambitionne acheter une parcelle.
texts.en:
Mr. Issoufou is in charge of the Tindpaosgo Hommes Koubri Ps group. He is married and the father of two children between the ages of three months and four years. Neither of his children goes to school and he has five dependents.

He has been gardening for 15 years. He buys his supplies in neighboring villages. With the money he receives, he wants to buy seven bags of fertilizer, two boxes of cabbage seeds, and one box of herbicide.

He would like to use the profits from the loan to bolster his business. He would like to buy a parcel of land.

loans.use: buy seven bags of fertilizer, two boxes of cabbage seeds, and one box of herbicide.

loans.name: Arif Mehmood Awan

texts.en:
Arif is a 42-year-old man living with his family in the area of Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Arif has been running a stationery shop for 15 years. He buys several stationery items from the market in bulk and sells them in his shop. He tries to bring the best quality of the stationery as much as possible. Arif is an expert in satisfying his customers' needs and tries to bring the inventory according to the needs of his customers. This is why he is very dedicated towards his business because after keen selection of goods he brings the inventory required.

Arif wants to buy more inventory but he does not have enough savings to make this purchase possible. Therefore, Arif has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan so that he can buy the proposed inventory. This can enable an increase in income.

loans.use: to run his stationery shop.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh is a 21-year-old single man from Zarqaa city. He tried to work in addition to his studying but he could not find a suitable job. Now he is a student in the university majoring in geography. He wants to complete his studies and find a good job.

Saleh has eight siblings, which causes financial problems for his family, and his father cannot cover the education fees in addition to the household expenses.

Therefore Saleh applied for an education loan to help him pay the university fees for this semester, and it will help him to buy the books which he needs.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees, and will help him to buy the books which he needs.

loans.name: Pierrette

texts.fr: 24 ans, Pierrette est mariée et son mari n'a pas de travail stable ni fixe. Le couple a un enfant. Pour gagner sa vie et aider son époux à entretenir sa petite famille, elle décidait d'exercer une activité génératrice de revenu. Elle vend des fruits et légumes il y a maintenant un an. Elle voudrait tant développer et améliorer cette activité. Et elle voudrait aussi que son mari trouve et exerce une activité fixe et stable.
texts.en:
Pierrette is 24 years old and married. Her husband doesn't have a steady, regular job. The couple has one child.

In order to earn a living and help her husband raise their family, she began working. She has been selling fruits and vegetables for a year.

She would like to improve her business. She would also like her husband to have a steady, regular job.

loans.use: buy tomatoes, onions, papayas, carrots, and dried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy hats, earrings, rings, necklaces, etc.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is in her mid 40's and is married with no children.  She has been running a poultry business for five years now.  She works from 7:00am to 8:00pm daily and is able to make a decent monthly profit.

This will be Mary's 1st loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She will use this loan to buy chicks and chicken feed.  She dreams of expanding her business.

She will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks and chicken feed.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 35-year-old, and is a married man from Jabalia city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.
 
So, Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar heating system to heat water for the family house. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to decrease the electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).  Ahmad’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.

loans.use: to buy a solar heating system to heat water for the family house

loans.name: Yakubu

texts.en:
Yakubu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. He is anticipating a good harvest this season, Yakubu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tones of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

 Before joining Babban Gona, Yakubu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. 

With the help of this loan, Yakubu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Yakubu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 


Yakubu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education.

loans.use: To buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices only at harvest time

loans.name: Pean Group

texts.en:
Edinah is a 39-year-old hardworking married woman with three schoolgoing children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She grows and sells coffee to earn a living, as well as selling bananas (matooke) and mats to increase her earnings.

Edinah has a vision of educating her children and developing herself but her main setbacks are bad weather and price changes for coffee. She is requesting a loan to buy more coffee to sell. Edinah is a member of PEAN, a group in which members save and guarantee each other to access loans. This is a group that focuses on the economic development of fellow members.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to sell.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is a widow, and a mother of five children. She operates a hardware shop and also owns rentals to supplement her incomes. She is a very hard working woman, but faced with a challenge of limited capital to fully stock her hardware shop and be inline to satisfy her customers' demands. Rebecca, would love to add plumbing materials in her shop to sell having discovered a readily available market, but at the moment she has no money to do so. She thus requests credit to buy plumbing materials to sell.

loans.use: to buy plumbing materials to sell.

loans.name: Nafiu

texts.en:
Nafiu is a maize farmer from Tudun Dinya village. As a Babban Gona member, Nafiu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Nafiu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs. 

Nafiu will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay its sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize - up to 37% higher than the market price. Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Nafiu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/ha, Nafiu hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Ika

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Ika, who is a 42-year-old married woman with four sons. Ika has been selling foods for breakfast for 18 years. 

She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,600,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build toilets and water outlets at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build these things but Ika will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: this loan will be used to build toilets and water outlets at her home to improve sanitation for her family.

loans.name: Akmal

texts.en:
Akmal was born in 1993 and is a clever young man. He is single and lives with his parents and brother. Akmal is a student at the National University of Tajikistan. He studies well and usually gets excellent and good marks. He often goes to the library to read. 

Akmal dreams of specialising in something in the future and with this aim he studies well. Akmal’s mother works in a local hospital and his father works as a builder. Akmal is asking for a loan of 7,500 Somoni to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Edna is a sari-sari (variety shop) store owner. She is from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married with four children; they are 21, 19, 15 and 6 years old. Her husband is a tricycle driver. Edna and her husband work together to earn a living. In the future, she wants to improve her business. As for now, she is requesting a loan to buy grocery items such as drinks, sugar, spices, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, toiletries, candies, biscuits, chips, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and milk in order to increase her sales and profitability.

loans.use: to buy drinks, sugar, spices, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, noodles, toiletries, candies, biscuits, chips, coffee, powdered chocolate drink and milk to sell

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
One year ago, 44-year-old Gina successfully started her own business. She is a running a sari-sari store (general store) business where she sells variety of goods in the small community of Tubigon, Bohol. 

Gina wishes to improve the sustainability of her business. She also wants to give her children better lives by sending them to school. Gina is the mother of three children. Her oldest child is 18 years old while the youngest child is 13 years old. 

She is requesting a loan for additional capital to buy grocery items such as soft drink, chips, bread, biscuits, eggs, spices, noodles, cooking oil, canned goods, sugar, coffee, toiletries, powdered milk and chocolate drinks.

loans.use: to buy soft drink, chips, bread, biscuits, eggs, spices and other items to sell.

loans.name: Sabah

texts.en:
Sabah is a widowed woman with one daughter, Rawan, who is appearing in the photo instead of Sabah, because she is a conservative woman.
Sabah is a single mother wants to provide a good life for her daughter, she is working hard to give her a good life. 
Rawan is a student in university majoring in internet technology, she wants to graduate and find a good job with a good salary to help her mother and to take care of her.
Sabah feels that her daughter will be someone important in the future; and she cannot wait to see her in the graduation gown, and because of the financial difficulties that Sabah has faced, she asked for an education loan to pay Rawan`s semester fees and to buy her textbooks.

loans.use: to pay her daughter, Rawan`s, semester fees and to buy her textbooks.

loans.name: Nagitaben And Group

texts.en:
Nagitaben is a 49-year-old entrepreneur from the Dahod district of Gujarat. She runs a petty shop business and earns a monthly income of Rs. 5000. She now seeks a loan to expand her business so she can stock her shop better. She plans to purchase items such as sugar, margarine, oil and so on, in bulk. For that, she needs financial assistance. 

Nagitaben leads a group of five women. Kamlaben, Vesatiben, Manishaben and Jithariben are the other members of the group. They joined Nagitaben to apply for a group loan to expand their respective businesses. The loan will help these women contribute more to their household income. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, margarine and oil to expand her shop.

loans.name: Tinaben And Group

texts.en:
37-year-old Tinaben is an ambitious woman who hails from the Dahod district in Gujarat. Her household comprises five members including her.

Tinaben runs a business selling vegetables and has been earning Rs. 5000 every month. She started the business to provide better for her family. She now wants to expand her business because she believes that the expansion will help her earn a greater profit. She expects an increase of Rs. 2000 on a monthly basis. To expand her business, she needs to purchase a wider variety of vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes and so on, and increase the quantity of the purchase as well. For that, she seeks a loan. 

Tinaben leads a group of five women who, just like her, are engaged in similar businesses. They have come together to apply for a group loan. The loan will help them expand their respective businesses and lead a more comfortable life. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables like tomatoes, potatoes and onions to expand her vegetable selling business.

loans.name: Basema

texts.en:
Basema is 52 years old and lives in Zarqaa. She is a married woman without children. Basema wants to help her husband with the household expenses; therefore, she decided to use her talent in arranging flowers to sell them. She is happy with doing her work; she fills her time and she feels that she is productive woman.

Basema wants to expand her work and increase her incomes; because of that, she applied for a loan to buy plastics sheets for making decorative flowers to sell.

In the future, she wishes to become the supplier of flowers in the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to buy plastics sheets for making decorative flowers to sell.

loans.name: Smart

texts.en:
Smart is a farmer. He also owns a salon for side income. He is married with children. His greatest desire is to expand his farm.

Smart badly wants to buy pesticides, it being a heavy rainy season that's making his crops prone to pests and diseases, but the money at hand is too little to meet his need. He is requesting a loan facility to buy pesticides, so that his crops are not eaten up by pests.

loans.use: to buy pesticides.

loans.name: Silver

texts.en:
Silver is a goat trader living in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is 32 years old and married with no children. He also does crop farming and sells the surplus to supplement his income. 

Silver dreams of exploring all the available markets for goats and expanding his business to other places. He is a hardworking man whose efforts are hindered by not having the money to buy goats in large numbers. Silver will use the loan facility to buy goats to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats to sell.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old, single man from Deir Al balah city, which is located in the Gaza Strip, next to the Refugee Camp with the same name. He works as an employee in the public sector, where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs, but he wants to make his family more comfortable and improve their standard of living.
 
So, Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN, which will enable him to buy a solar heating system to heat water for the family house. By taking this loan, Ahmad will be able to decrease their electricity expenses, while using a cleaner form of energy (rather than gas).  Ahmad’s family will have an easier time heating water for showers, cooking, and also washing clothes and dishes.

loans.use: to buy a solar heating system to heat water for the family house.

loans.name: Basem

texts.en:
Basem, 45, lives in Irbid. He is a caring father of two children, and has big aspirations in life to educate his children with the best education. Basem is retired from the army with a low pension; therefore, he opened his own business which is a grocery located in his home.

Now his biggest priority is to develop his business, so he is requesting a new loan to buy grocery merchandise such as candy, soft drinks, rice, and sugar to increase his income.

With this investment, he hopes to better satisfy his clients' needs and expand his store.

loans.use: to buy grocery merchandise such as candy, soft drinks, rice, and sugar to increase his income.

loans.name: Tasmi

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Tasmi, who is a 54-year-old widow with two daughters and one son. Tasmi has been selling breakfast to customers for twenty three years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7.200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build a sanitary facility at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.  Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources but Tasmi will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all her lenders.

loans.use: This loan will be used to build a sanitary facility at their home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for their family.

loans.name: Sani

texts.en:
Sani is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Sani is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer. 

Traditionally, Sani would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Sani will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a later date in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize - up to 37% more than the harvest price. 

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/ha, Sani now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar is a 22-year-old, Jordanian student in university majoring in civil engineering. He lives with his parents in a southern city of Jordan, Irbid. He is very tender and cares a lot about all of his family members. Today, he is eager to take a loan from Kiva to pay his university educational fees. He said that he is very happy with the loan that will allow him to pursue his education.

loans.use: to pay his university educational fees.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 22-year-old man who opened a barber shop more than four years ago. He is very smart and hardworking, and he uses his time well to learn more professional skills. He wants to be self-sufficient and be able to help his parents with the household expenses.  

Ahmad requested a loan to purchase barber shop materials including shampoos and skincare products. He believes that his family could have a better life in the future, and he dreams of completing his education.

loans.use: to purchase barber shop materials including shampoos and skincare products.

loans.name: Kokilaben And Group

texts.en:
Kokilaben is an ambitious entrepreneur from Gujarat who leads a group of five women. She is only 21 years of age and successfully runs a grocery business. She currently earns an income of INR 2,500 every month from her business.

Kokilaben is happy with her business, as the items in her grocery shop are in high demand. She believes that she can double her income if she expands her grocery store by purchasing more items such as tea, oil, flour, etc. The increased income from the expansion will help her lead a more comfortable life. The only thing stopping her from expanding her business is the shortage of funds. Her savings are not sufficient to make the bulk purchase. She thus seeks a loan.

The other women in the group also hail from Gujarat and just like Kokilaben run businesses to make ends meet. They too need a loan to expand their respective businesses. The loan will not only help them expand their businesses but will also fulfill their wish of securing their families' future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of oil, rice, etc., to expand her grocery business.

loans.name: Uramilaben And Group

texts.en: Uramilaben leads a group of 5 women from the Dahod district of Gujarat. She is 25 years old and lives with her family of 6 members in a village in Dahod. She runs a grocery business to supplement the income her husband earns. She sells items such as sugar, tea, oil, etc. These daily essential items are in demand in her village and she believes that if she increases the stock, she will be able to make a better profit. She expects an increase of Rs. 2000 every month. As her savings would not suffice to purchase the additional items, she needs a loan. The loan will help her purchase stock in bulk and earn better profit from her business. The rest of the members in the group are also engaged in businesses of their own and need a loan to expand their respective businesses. They are grateful to their lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tea,oil, and other items to expand her grocery business

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abubakar has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abubakar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, Abubakar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Abubakar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000/ha. Abubakar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the lives of his children and family, and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Awurade Beye Group

texts.en:
These three ladies are part of the group called Awurade Beye (God will provide) which is found in Chorkor, in the greater-Accra region of Ghana. They sell bags, underwear, wax-prints, and soft drinks.

Mercy is the group representative who sells soft drinks. She has been in this business for 13 years. A 41-year-old single parent, she has two children who are both in high school. She works so hard to take care of her home and her children. She has an elementary school education, and she lives with her children at her family house.

Mercy, together with her colleagues, will need a total amount of GHS 5,700 to expand their businesses. Mercy will use her share to buy more soft drinks which she will sell to her customers at her residence.

This is Mercy's fifth loan cycle with ID-Ghana. She has repaid all previous loans successfully, and promises to repay this loan without any trouble.

loans.use: to buy more soft drinks which she will sell to her customers at her residence.

loans.name: Maisah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Maisah, who is a 55-year-old married woman with one son. Maisah has been selling tofu crust for ten years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,700,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at her home, which will improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Maisah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family.

loans.name: Amneh

texts.en:
For two years, Amneh has been running a small business with help from her husband, making and selling "maftool" that is used in one of the Jordanian dishes.

She lives in Irbid which is one of the cities that has been economically affected by the Syrian crisis.

Amneh is a 39-year-old woman. She dreams of improving her business to support the needs of her children and give them a better education. She dreams of succeeding in her business, in order to prepare and save money for the future, so she started making big quantities of maftool to sell the near grocery stores. Now she has opened her small independent shop that needs a lot of decoration and goods to turn it into a mini market, but for now she is selling food that she makes, and has added selling basic detergents to housewives in the neighborhood.

To continue her business, she wants to get a loan to buy food such as meat, spices, and cooking oil to sell, and to use the loan to buy more cleaning materials to sell so she can increase her income and improve the standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy food such as meat, spices, and cooking oil to sell, and to buy more cleaning materials.

loans.name: Husni

texts.en:
Husni is a 44-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and five kids in a simple house. Husni works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is his family's only source of income. He would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Husni took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Husni will be able to provide clean water. especially for his kids.

Husni appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Zaki

texts.en:
Zaki is a 35-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and three kids in a simple house. Zaki works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the family's only source of income. He would like to improve his family's living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Zaki took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Zaki will be able to provide clean water, especially for his kids.

Zaki appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Babangida

texts.en:
Babangida is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Babangida has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Babangida would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Babangida will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Babangida is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a better house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Adah

texts.en:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP UMKM’s clients, Adah, who is a 61-year-old. Adah has been selling food and snacks for three years. She has asked for a loan of IDR 7,200,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build sanitation at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Adah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.

loans.use: to build sanitation at her home to improve access to sanitation and clean water for her family.

loans.name: Muhammad

texts.en:
Muhammad is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Muhammad has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tones of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Muhammad would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With the help of this loan, he can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Muhammad will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Muhammad is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sanoat

texts.en: Sanoat was born in 1960. She is married and has four children, who are all adults. Five years ago, she began her business dealings because her family needed a financial source. During these five years, Sanoat has run this business. She has a food market shop where she sells a variety of food items such as sausages, sugar, flour items, meat items, eggs, milk products, etc. Sanoat periodically renews the assortment of goods because business struggle is big in her town. She is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy food items for widening the assortment of goods in her shop. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy food items for widening the assortment of goods.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is an ambitious, 37-year-old young lady from the Chebunyo location, which is a luxuriant maize producing region in Rift valley province of Kenya. Margaret is very passionate, hardworking, and eager to learn and take on new challenges. These qualities have propelled her to become one of the most respected farmers in her village.

She sells milk, poultry and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Margaret is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities in which she involves herself, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. She is so keen and close with her cows that she has named them, which makes Margaret very proud and she feels fulfilled.

Margaret is seeking an education loan to pay school fees for her child. She believes that the knowledge and skills her child will get from school will help her child in the future, because her child will have a brighter future. Donate $25 towards this loan and empower a child’s life.

loans.use: to pay tuition fees for her child.

loans.name: Muazzama

texts.ru:
Эта Муаззама. Ей 32 года. Муаззама всю жизнь посвятила семье - детям, мужу. Ее муж уехал на заработки в Россию, а ее дети остались с ней. Дети повзрослели и уже ходят в школу. У Муаззамы остается больше времени для себя. И она решила осуществить свою давнюю мечту. Муаззама всегда хотела иметь не большой продуктовый магазин, где сама будет работать. Она представляет, что будет каждый день встречаться с новыми людьми и помогать им с выбором. 
  Большой шаг в свою мечту она уже поставила - нашла помещение и поставщиков продукции. Теперь ей нужно купить товар и поставить полки для этого она просит поддержки. Муазаама не сомневается, что ей смогут помочь и заранее благодарит за помощь.
texts.en:
Muazzama is 32 years old and she has devoted her entire life to her family: her children and her husband.  Her husband has left the country to find work in Russia, so she is now alone with her children.  She has a lot of time on her hands and she has decided to make one of her very old dreams come true.  Muazzama has always wanted to have a small grocery shop where she would be working, meeting new people every day and helping her customers make the best choices.

Muazzama has already taken the first step toward achieving her dream: she has found a shop and located suppliers.  She now needs to buy merchandise and to put some shelves up, and for this, she needs your support.  She is confident that she will receive your help and she thanks you in advance for your support.

loans.use: to open a grocery shop.

loans.name: Adelina

texts.en:
Adelina is a 67 years old, married and have five children to provide. To earn for living she engaged in a rice production business with the help of her husband who is a farmer also. Through this business it helps a lot in their family for their daily needs and their children's education. Adelina decided to take a loan to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm so that her rice farm be more productive and have a good harvest that will generate more income.

Adelina plan for the future to save money from her business to sustain the education needs of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a married man who has 2 children to provide. To earn a profit, he was rendering transportation services to his local community members. Since then, he has actively driven and sent passengers to designated areas safely. It allows him to earn PHP 10,000 a month, considering other sources of irregular income, too. Recently, he borrowed a loan to buy tires and finance the costs to renew licenses and registration. The availability of this fund is a channel to facilitate operations immediately. With this loan,Joseph is expecting to pursue his job with a motor vehicle in good running condition to provide satisfactory service to customers. He hopes to sustain the family's daily needs and improve further service capacity.has been in the business for many years he has been in transportation services.

loans.use: to  buy tires and finance the costs to renew licenses and registration.

loans.name: Ca Hong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hong, 42 years old, is the Kinh ethnic majority woman. She is living with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family lives mainly based on her husband’s meager salary and their pig breeding job. However, the income from salary and current breeding is just enough to cover the basic living expense of the family. She wants to expand the breeding but she does not have enough money to do it. Therefore, she wants to take a loan to invest in raising pigs.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in pig breeding more effective with high productivity. Then, when selling the coming pig herd, it will bring her family a considerable profit. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in raising pigs.

loans.name: Abdu

texts.en:
Abdu is maize farmer from Waziri Dinya village. As a member of Babban Gona, Abdu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Abdu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Abdu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Abdu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Orlanda

texts.en: Orlanda has been involving in business activities since a few years ago, she started with her own working capital. And now she is requesting a loan of $ 1000.00 to improve her business. She has come to age of 47, but she still keep the spirit to run her business. She has a small kiosk in front of her house and she taking a loan from Tuba Rai Metin, because she wants to open her business a bigger store in the future, so she will use this loan to buy additional supplies to keep in her kiosk including card gambling, hand body, soaps, biscuits, noodles, toothpaste and other things to sell.

loans.use: to buy card gambling, hand body, soaps, biscuits, noodles, toothpaste and other things to sell.

loans.name: Tukur

texts.en:
Tukur is maize farmer from Waziri Dinya village. As a member of Babban Gona, Tukur is excited about the opportunity to have acesss to a trained agronomist and superior inputs. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Tukur would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.


With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Tukur can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Tukur is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to to become a better farmer .

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Nigora

texts.en:
Nigora is a repeated client of IMON. She has used previous loans for developing business because she has own business deal. Nigora’s business is animal husbandry. She has been busy with this business more than 6 years. Nigora’s husband helps her with managing business. Nigora and her husband work hard to earn for living.

She is ill now and she must go to doctor but she has no money. Kiva lenders are the only ones who can help her. So, she is asking for a loan of 5000 Somoni to buy medicines for her treatment and she awaits your support.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her treatment.

loans.name: Juvy

texts.en:
Juvy is from Carles, Iloilo. She and her husband are engaged in a fishing business. They have been doing this for seven years. Aside from fishing, Juvy is also engaged in buying and selling RTW (ready to wear) such as slippers, sandals, shirts and etc.

Juvy and her husband work hard together to raise their two young children. The oldest child is four years old while the youngest child is two years old.

Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets to improve their catch. 38 years old Juvy wishes to uplift their livelihood and have better means of living.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Shazia

texts.en:
Shazia is 41 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. With her two sons, her children are doing study. Her husband has been running his own business of clothes selling for 1 year. Her husband needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes.

Therefore Shazia is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. So that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk for his business. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
Shazia is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his clothing business.

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en:
Tahira is 39 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is a mother of 5 children. Her husband has been running a grocery store for past 1 year. Tahira's husband wants to purchase different kinds of commodities e.g rice, sugar, tea bags, milks, fruits or vegetable items and other consumer items for his business purpose. But due to financial constraints her husband is not in suitable position to buy all above these products.

Therefore Tahira has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her husband to buy all these commodities and also helpful for him to earn maximum profitable income to manage his house hold and business.
Tahira is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: her husband wanted to increase his grocery business

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 28 year old motorcycle transporter at Voi Kenya. He is a father of one child and the spouse is a tailor, for the past three years he has been in this business doing well.

This is his second loan from VisionFund Kenya to finance his business, he will use the loan to service his motorcycle and the anticipated profit to repay his loan and add Africa print clothes in his tailoring shop. He hopes to own successful businesses in future .

loans.use: to service his motorcycle

loans.name: Pacifier Group

texts.en:
Eva is the featured borrower of Pacifier group she joined with the other group members to hold hands and acquire a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, because they have always been close friends since they arrived to work as housekeepers seeking a better living.

Eva is the lady at the far left side of the picture, she is a 34-year-old married mother of four children whom she will invest her loan in paying for her children school tuition fees.
As for the other group members, Pinky is a mother of three and her loan share will be also sent to the Philippines to pay for her children. She is the lady at the far right side of the picture.
While Marylene is the lady at the center of the picture.

loans.use: to pay for her children school tuition fees in the Philippines

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is 39 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. Her business is farming. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of four thousand Kenya shillings. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds.  She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to have a well up family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds.

loans.name: Shawqi

texts.en:
Shawqi is a 37-years-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and three kids in a simple house. Shawqi works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to improve the family living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Shawqi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Shawqi will be able to provide clean water especially for his kids.
Shawqi appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Nuhi

texts.en:
Nuhi wants to thank all of the lenders for his previous loan to purchase construction tools, including a machine. With the loan he has been able to work more efficiently and with higher quality services for his clients. He is very satisfied with his income, business and the loan process. He is traveling to other cities for work and misses his family, but is working hard to give them a better life and future. 

At this time he is requesting another loan for his business. He would like to purchase scaffolding so that he can work on taller buildings and increase his services and income. He appreciates the continued support from the lenders and the opportunity for both loans.

loans.use: to purchase scaffolding so that he can work on taller buildings and increase his services and income

loans.name: Winfred

texts.en:
Winfred is 41 years old. She is a single mother and blessed with two children. Her business is poultry keeping. She has been in the business for five years. She earns a monthly income of sixty thousand Kenya shillings.

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy chicken feed. She will use the profits from expanded business to increase her savings as well as pay school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable and educate her children to tertiary level.

loans.use: to buy chicken feed.

loans.name: Halide

texts.en: Halide has three adult children and is a professional translator, employed with a company for her daily main job and freelancing, on her own outside of the work hours. She keeps herself very business and is always working. At this time she is requesting a loan to purchase some equipment for her translating business and office at home. Her husband works for an electrical company, but with low salary and she will need the assistance of the lenders to help her get started. She is very optimistic that she will be able to earn more through her business than from her normal salary.

loans.use: to purchase some equipment for her translating business and office at home

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is a maize farmer from Gwani village. As a Babban Gona member, Thomas is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Thomas would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at it’s lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thomas will use this loan to store the maize he harvests, enabling him to delay it’s sale until a later period in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Thomas no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Thomas hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to move into a better home with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Sambatra Gaspard

texts.fr: 55 ans, Gaspard est brocanteur- ferrailleur comme sa femme. Le couple tient chacun un point de vente dans deux villes différents.  Le prêt va lui permettre d' acheter des ferrailles et d'autres objets usagés ou d'occasion supplémentaires pour compléter les achalandages. Ce mariage est le deuxième pour chacun. Chacun des deux époux a déjà eu lors de leur chaque premier mariage un enfant donc deux au total et ensemble le couple a un autre enfant. Au total  le couple a trois enfants à charges. L'objectif est de développer l'activité et devenir quincailler.
texts.en:
55-year old Gaspard earns a living through selling second-hand goods and scrap iron, as does his wife. Each member of this couple has their own selling premises in two different towns. This loan will allow Gaspard to purchase more scrap iron and other used or second-hand goods so he can replenish his stock.

This is the second marriage for both members of this couple. Each of them had one child from their previous marriages, so two children altogether, and they have had one child together since then. They have a total of three children living in their care. Gaspard's goal is to further develop his business and to become an ironmonger.

loans.use: to purchase scrap iron.

loans.name: Joséphine

texts.fr:
Joséphine vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit. Elle a pu acheter différentes sortes de marchandises (ustensiles de cuisines) supplémentaires, par conséquent, le fonds de roulement a augmenté un peu ainsi que le chiffre d'affaire. Or, elle n'a pas encore atteint son objectif, c'est pourquoi, elle voudrait encore continuer à avancer, elle demande un autre crédit pour pouvoir  encore développer l'activité, renforcer le capital.
Actuellement, elle continue et s'efforce d'épargner davantage pour pouvoir réaliser son rêve de construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Joséphine would like to thank you very much for this loan. She has been able to purchase different sorts of extra merchandise (kitchen utensils). As a result, her working capital has increased, as well as her turnover.

But she has not yet met her goal. It is for this reason that she would like to make further progress by requesting another loan to develop her business and bolster her capital. She is currently doing her best and putting away more money into savings in order to realize her dream of building her own home.

loans.use: to buy stainless steel kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Benkounda I Group

texts.fr:
Sékou est un cultivateur malien âgé de 45 ans, tenant la corne du bœuf en main. Marié à (02) femmes, père (08) enfants âgée de (01 an 06 moi à 15 ans). Dont 04 de ses enfants son scolarisés 03 garçons et 01 fille. Il est très apprécié dans sa communauté pour son courage dans le travail et sa bonne moralité. Recalé du diplôme d’étude fondamental (D E F). Ses femmes fond le petit commerce comme gombo huile de karité la tomate et le poulet. Il a 15 ans, d’expérience l’élevage bovin.  Il a emprunté pour l’achat de 02 bœufs au lieu de 01 bœuf au paravent. IL  a un bénéfice prévisionnel  mensuel d’environ 75 000 FCFA qui peut varier en fonction de la période, dont ses bénéfices lui permettent de subvenir à ses besoins notamment la scolarisation, la santé, les habiles et chaussures de ses enfants et le financement de son champ. Il s’approvisionne dans les marchés de sa localité et vend ses marchandises aux marchés environnants en espèces. Les obstacles auxquels heurte son activité est la perte de vie des bovins  dans les épidémies, la baisse des prix sur le marché et hausse des prix de l’aliment bétail.
Il souhaiterait dans l’avenir acquérir beaucoup de bœufs  et vaches pour élever et amélioré son habitat.
texts.en:
Sékou is a 45-year-old farmer from Mali, who is holding the cow by a rope in the photo. He is married to two women and is a father to eight children aged between one-and-a-half and 15 years old. Four of his children, three boys and one girl, are currently receiving an education.

Sékou is held in high regard in the community for his hard work and his good morals. As a youth, he failed to attain his School Foundation Degree (Diplôme d’étude fondamental, "DEF"). His wives earn money through small-scale retail ventures, selling okra, Shea oil, tomatoes and chicken.

Sékou has 15 years of experience in raising cattle. He has previously taken out a loan so he could purchase two cows instead of just the one. He earns an estimated monthly profit of around 75,000 FCFA. This figure varies depending on the time of year. This money allows him to meet his family's needs, notably his children's school fees, health costs and clothing, as well as the financing of his plot of land.

He purchase livestock from the local markets and resells his raised cattle in the surrounding area. A few of the obstacles which hinder this activity include his livestock dying from illnesses, falling market prices and the rising cost of cattle feed. In the future, he hopes to acquire many more cattle to raise so he can make improvements to his home.

loans.use: to purchase cows in order to raise them then resell them.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en:
Irina is a small entrepreneur from Voznesenovka. She owns a grocery store selling all the basics from loaves of bread to different kinds of ice cream. Irina has a solid experience working in this sphere of business for awhile. Irina is 37 and married with two young children.
Irina needs to fix the floors in her store and to renew some things in the interior of the facility. She is requesting additional 20, 000 Grivnyas to implement this project in the nearest future.

loans.use: to fix the floors in her store and to renew some things in the interior of the facility

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
Adel is a 55-year-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and five kids in a simple house. Adel works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to improve the family living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Adel took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Adel will be able to provide clean water especially for his kids. Adel appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.en:
Nikolai is a businessman from Zaporozhye. He works at a big local market selling men's casual and athletic footwear. He owns 3 vending locations. Two hired employees work for him at the moment. Nikolai is married with two sons. 
Nikolai is seeking 70,000 Grivnyas to purchase winter boots to meet his clients' demand this season. He is determined to grow his business and increase his clientele, seeking to serve his customers better as he provides for his family of four securing their stable future.

loans.use: to purchase winter boots to meet his clients' demand this season

loans.name: Kashif Ali

texts.en:
Kashif  is a hardworking man in Rawalpindi, Pakistan who has spent the last ten years in the auto spare parts industry providing services to people in his community. He is a 29-year-old married man with two children. Both of his children are in school and his eldest son helps him run the business. 

Kasha  supports his family through his spare auto parts business, as it is his main source of income. Kashif  is requesting a Kiva loan so that he can expand his business by buying the inventories required by his customers. He is excited about expanding his business as this will help him to increase the number of customers and earn more profits. The anticipated increase in profits will be used to buy a small piece of land. 

Kashif's dream is to keep expanding his business so that his children can have a stable future and in the near future, take over the business. He would like to thank the Kiva lenders for their support and help in educating his children.

loans.use: To maintain his spare auto parts business

loans.name: Shihab Al-Deen

texts.en: Shihab AL-Deen is a 20-year-old, single man from Hebron. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Shihab has an internet cafe for internet and printing serves in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the west bank is bad because of latest conflict. Shihab took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy new computers for his internet cafe. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy new computers for his internet cafe.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil 53 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and 2 children in Batumi district. Archil is unemployed and decided to start his own business in order to generate income and cover everyday costs. 
The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 1,100 GEL. With the received credit he will start trading wood and will generate income. This will give him a chance to improve the living conditions of his family. Archil awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trading wood in order to generate income and improve the living conditions of his family

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 27-year-old, single man from Khan Younis, Gaza Strip, which is both a city and a refugee camp. He lives with his family in a small, old house where he is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. 

Ahmad has a grocery store in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the Gaza Strip is bad because of latest conflict. Ahmad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy a new goods and inventory to sell at his stall. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy a new goods and inventory to sell at his stall

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel deals in agriculture and livestock, specifically piggery and cattle. He is married. Being a rainy season, his crops are facing a problem of pests and loss of soil fertility due to soil erosion and floods. Emmanuel is dreaming of having big harvests at the end of the season which will assist him in terracing his farm. He is requesting for money to buy pesticides and fertilizers to save his crops so that he is able to get better yields .

loans.use: to buy pestcides and fertilizers

loans.name: Terimberemunyarwandakazi Group

texts.en:
Immaculee is a 45-year-old widow and mother of two children. She works hard to support her family and to provide them with a better life. She is the person who has a stike in her hands.

For the past ten years, Immaculate has sold different children's clothes. Every morning Immaculee opens her shop at 7 am and works tirelessly until her daily supply is sold.

With this loan, Immaculate hopes to expand by purchasing more and different children's clothes for sale. With the profits earned from this loan, Immaculee hopes to pay the school fees for her children, as well as provide her family with clothes and household items. She also wants to renovate her own house.

In the long-term, she hopes to expand her business to other areas of the city, as well as provide other type of clothes not only for children to her clients.

loans.use: to purchase different children's clothes for sale.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 23-year-old, single man from Hebron. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Ahmad has a grocery store in the city. It is a good business and provides him with a good income, but the economic situation in the West Bank is bad because of latest conflict. Ahmad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy new goods and inventory to sell at his store. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to get married.

loans.use: to buy new goods and inventory to sell at his store.

loans.name: Katerina

texts.en:
Katerina is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. She works at the biggest local marketplace selling assorted women's footwear. Katerina owns two vending locations at this market. She works at one of them and a hired employee works at another one.

Katerina is married and has a 7-year-old son.

Katerina needs 60,000 Grivnyas to purchase seasonal merchandise and restock her inventory of winter footwear. With temperatures going down Ukrainian shoppers come looking for durable warm footwear, which is why Katerina wants to have a nice selection of items to offer to her potential customers.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise and restock her inventory of winter footwear.

loans.name: Natalya

texts.en:
Natalya is from Melitopol. She owns a small toy store located next to the central marketplace. Natalya has had good experience working in this sphere of enterprise and has developed a sustainable venture.

Natalya is 45. She is married and has a 23-year-old daughter.

Natalya is planning to invest 20,000 Grivnyas from Kiva in diversification of her merchandise. She is hoping to buy new toy items and bicycles at affordable prices for further retail sale.

loans.use: to buy new toy items and bicycles at affordable prices.

loans.name: United For Transforming Rural Areas Group

texts.en:
Shallot is a member of United for Transforming Rural Areas Group. She is 29 years old, married with 2 children and a resident of Houma Uganda. She is charged with the responsibility of providing them with all the basic needs and all attend school. 

She is a very hard-working lady who sells sugar, salt, and cooking oil among other items on a retail basis and works 12 hours a day. In order to supplement her income she practices farming, predominantly growing cassava and beans. She intends to educate her children and develop her business more ,only to be challenged by inflation. Shallot is requesting a loan facility to buy more stock items like sugar, salt and soap for sell.

loans.use: to buy more stock items like sugar, salt and soap to sell

loans.name: Okyesu Nyame Group

texts.en:
The determination and dedication of the hard working members of the Okyesu name group, located in choker at the greater Accra region of Ghana, have been a victim of financial crises which makes it difficult for them to meet their business standard.

Thanks to Andrews, who has been a motivator of the group and a dealer in Electrical parts together with his friends, they seek the help of Kiva through ID-Ghana to acquire a loan for their businesses. They sell foodstuffs, electrical parts and car spare parts. Andrews was born in 1980, he is married and has one child. Andrews join ID-Ghana at about 6 years of age and has been an active member who contributes a lot. Due to the fact that there is no loan guarantee system, the organisation uses group pressure for the recovery of the loan repayment. He is asking for a loan amount of GHS 2,500 to buy more electrical parts from the main market at wholesale price and sell them on a pavement to her customers. They promise to repay the loan without any problem.

loans.use: to buy more electrical parts from the main market at wholesale price and sell them on a pavement to her customers.

loans.name: Andrei

texts.en:
Andrei is a farmer from Voznesenovka. He grows greens, like parsley, cilantro and dock, as well as radishes, cucumbers, etc. He is 44, married, and has a 21-year-old son.
