Recently, stormy wind damaged a part of the roof in his house, which caused a serious leak. Andrei is seeking 20,000 Grivnyas to invest in minor repairs of the roof and major repairs of the corridor that was damaged by the leak.

Repair work is costly in Ukraine, which is why Andrei had to seek financial assistance to cover all expenses at once.

loans.use: to invest in minor repairs of the roof and major repairs of the corridor that was damaged by the leak.

loans.name: Ramzi

texts.en:
Ramzi is 28, married, and has a 3-year-old son and a 1-year-old daughter.

Ramzi works at a local marketplace in Pavlograd. He owns a small cafeteria offering meals and snacks, like falafel balls and lavash wraps to shopping market customers. Ramzi rents this place. He has been running this business for three years.

Currency fluctuations and bureaucracy issues are some of the worst challenges in Ramzi's daily work.

Ramzi wants to buy a heating boiler for his cafe. As temperatures drop, it gets chilly outside and the atmosphere inside his cafe is no longer comfortable at this point. A heating boiler for a cafe like Ramzi's would cost around 10,000 Grivnyas.

loans.use: to buy a heating boiler for his cafe.

loans.name: Abesalom

texts.en:
Abesalom is 42 years old. He lives with his pensioner grandparents.

The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have a small agricultural land where they grow seasonal fruits and vegetables.

Abesalom decided to start a trading business in order to generate a stable income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 500 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase wood and resell it at a higher price. This will give him a chance to generate stable income and improve the living conditions of his family.

Abesalom awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade wood in order to generate a stable income.

loans.name: Bunena Tukwatanise 'a' Group

texts.en:
Redempta is a 45-year-old widow with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. All her children attend school.

Redempta is a member of Bunena Tukwatanise A and she deals in cattle fattening alongside growing of crops and keeping of pigs to earn daily extra income. She has been a farmer for ten years and her clients are the people in and around her community.

She hopes to give a great future to her children by educating all of them because they are orphans, but her main challenge is bad weather that affects both her animals and crops.

She is requesting a loan to buy feeds for her pigs.

loans.use: to buy feeds for her pigs.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old. She is married and blessed with four children.

Her business is operating a quarry. She has been in the business for two years. She earns a monthly income of 10,000 Kenya shillings.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to rent more land for quarrying. She will use the profits from expanded business to pay school fees for her children and increase her savings.

Her hopes and dreams are to be a large-scale farmer.

loans.use: to rent more land for quarrying.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 58 years old. She is widowed and lives with her daughter and son-in-law in Zugdidi district.

Nona is unemployed and decided to start her own business in order to generate income. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 2,000 USD.

With the received credit, Nona will purchase a stock of clothes at wholesale prices and will resell. This will give her a chance to generate income and improve the living conditions of her family. Nona hopes that the business will be profitable and awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin to trade clothes in order to generate a stable income.

loans.name: Suksur

texts.ru: Суксур, 51 год, вдова, мать 4 сыновей. У Суксур среднее образование, она занимается животноводством и земледелием, стартовав 6 лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду Суксур, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 6 коров, 4 овцы. На 0,50 Га земли она выращивает кукурузу, есть сад. Ежемесячная прибыль - 22,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Суксур обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 коров. Доходы от кредита Суксур планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса, чтобы накопить на образование ее сына.
texts.en: Suksur is 51, widowed, and a mother of four sons. Suksur has a high school education and raises livestock and plants crops, which she began six years ago. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has six cows and four sheep. She grows corn on a 0.5 hectare plot of land and also has a garden. She earns 22,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to further develop her business, Suksur applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy three cows. Suksur plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in expanding her business in order to save up for her son's education.

loans.use: to purchase three cows in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Faniya

texts.ru: Фания, 66 лет, замужем, дети взрослые, самостоятельные, уже есть внуки. Образование у Фании высшее, сейчас она на пенсии, но много лет проработала ветеринарным врачом, также по сегодняшний день занимается сельским хозяйством. У Фании есть 3 коровы, 25 овец, на 1,40 Га земли она выращивает клевер, в саду - фруктовые деревья. Деятельность приносит прибыль в размере 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Фания обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец и 2 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она направит на дальнейшее развитие бизнеса. Также Фания мечтает накопить на поездку в гости к ее дочери в Россию, которая сейчас там на заработках.
texts.en: Faniya is 66 and married. Her children are grown up and independent, and she already has grandchildren. She has a university education and is now retired, having worked many years as a veterinarian. She also is a farmer. Faniya has three cows, 25 sheep, and grows clover on a 1.4 hectare plot of land and fruit trees in the garden. She earns 15,000 som (KGS) per month. Faniya applied for a loan of 120,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy ten sheep and two cows to increase her livestock headcount. She will use the income from the loan to develop her business. She also dreams of saving money for a trip to Russia to visit her daughter, who now works there.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep and two cows in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed is married and has children. He is a resident of Kasese, Uganda.

He operates a shop of new clothes, shoes, and general merchandise. He also operates a hardware shop as a side income business.

Ahmed is a very hardworking and experienced businessman who fights to explore the existing market by bringing on board the latest fashions and designs.

He is now looking at adding women's second-hand clothes and shoes to attract more customers, but the money at hand is not enough. He is requesting a loan to buy women's secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy women's second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Mujeres Unidas, está en su ciclo número 9 del programa de comité de mujeres, este grupo que ha pasado por muchas dificultades, pero a pesar de eso se mantienen en el programa, gracias a la unidad de todas.
La Sra. Idalina, una de las integrantes, pide este préstamo para poder cultivar  mandioca, maní, maíz y otros para vender; de esa manera poder continuar con su negocio de ventas. Idalina es una mujer muy luchadora, que quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida, es por ello que esta poniendo su mayor esfuerzo.
Ella comenta que gracias a su sacrificio ha podido sacar adelante a sus seres queridos. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
This group, which is called Mujeres Unidas ('United Women'), is in their ninth loan cycle with the Women's Committee Program. The women have faced many difficulties, but, despite everything, they have stayed in the program thanks to the support they provide for each other.

Idalina, one of the members of the group, is requesting a loan to be able to cultivate cassava, peanuts, corn and other crops for sale. In this way, she will be able to continue making sales. Idalina is a fighter, who is determined to improve her living conditions. She says that thanks to sacrifices she has made, she has been able to help her loved ones get ahead. She is very grateful for the opportunity she has received to be able to grow and to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to grow cassava, peanuts, corn and other crops.

loans.name: Las Maravillas Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Las Maravillas está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comités, es un grupo nuevo que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para salir adelante y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Maribel, una mujer muy sacrificada y trabajadora, ella tiene una peluquería en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana, hasta tarde en la noche. Maribel es conocida en su barrio por el buen servicio que siempre brinda a sus clientes, quiere crecer y mejorar, y es por ello que se unió a este grupo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar shampoo, enjuagues, cremas, tintes y otros, y de esa manera procurar dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, de manera a poder seguir creciendo en su clientela.
texts.en:
The group has the name Las Maravillas and is in its first loan cycle in the committee program. This is a new group that is putting forth its best efforts to get ahead and improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

One of the people who makes up this group is Maribel, a very self-sacrificing and hard-working woman. She has a beauty salon where she works every day from very early in the morning until late at night. Maribel is known in her neighborhood for the good service that she always offers to her customers, she wants to grow and improve, and for this she joined this group.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase shampoo, rinses, creams, dyes, and more, and in this way to manage to provide a better service to her customers, in such a way to be able to continue growing her customer base.

loans.use: to purchase shampoo, rinses, creams, dyes, and other hair dressing supplies.

loans.name: Divino Niño Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Divino Niño, se formó en la ciudad de Villa Elisa, está en su ciclo número 8º  del programa de comité de mujeres, donde a la par también están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, para que cada una pueda conocer su situación de vida, y conforme a ello puedan ayudar a sus familias.
Una mujer muy luchadora y sacrificada es la Sra. Dolly, quien se dedica a hacer manicura, comenta que siempre tiene muy buena clientela que les hace muchos pedidos de su servicio. Ella está luchando y se esfuerza para mejorar sus condiciones de vida, es por eso que se unió a este grupo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar esmaltes, acetonas, alicates, limas y otros, y de esa manera seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes, y también poder captar otros nuevos. Esta agradecida por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The group called Divino Niño was formed in the city of Villa Elisa. It is in its 8th loan cycle in the women's committee program, where they also are completing the poverty elimination tool, so that each one can know her life situation and, according to that, they can help their families.

Dolly is a very determined and self-sacrificing woman. She works doing manicures and says that she always has a good customer base that makes a lot of requests for her service. She is struggling and works hard to improve her living conditions, and for this she joined this group.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase nail polish, nail polish removers, clippers, files, and more, and in this way to continue providing her customers with a good service, and also to be able to attract other new ones. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting and it will be a great help.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, nail polish remover, clippers, files, and other manicure products.

loans.name: Toktokan

texts.ru: Токтокан  успешно погасила свой кредит, использовав средства по назначению. Она благодарна фонду Кива и всем, кто откликнулся и помог ей в финансировании. Благодаря упорному труду Токтокан, на сегодняшний день ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет в среднем до 18,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 5 коров, 50 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Токтокан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 80,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 15 овец для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита Токтокан планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, чтобы накопить на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Toktokan successfully repaid her loan, having used the money for the intended purpose. She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. Thanks to Toktokan's hard work, her monthly income is currently around 18,000 som (KGS). She has five cows and fifty sheep on her farm. In order to develop her business, she applied for a loan of 80,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy 15 sheep to fatten and resell. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in developing her business in order to save money to renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase 15 sheep for fattening and resale

loans.name: Tweheyo Kikwatamigo Group

texts.en:
Phiona, a member of Tweheyo Kikwatamigo, is aged 35 years. She is a married lady with four children and only one attends school. They live in Hoima, Uganda.

She operates a retail shop, mainly selling general merchandise, salt, sugar and soap among other items. She also carries out farming, mostly cassava, in order to supplement her income.

She expects her business to grow and fulfill the increasing demands of her customers only to be limited by inadequacy of capital. She will use the loan facility to buy more stock like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

The extra person in the photo is also a group member with savings who has guaranteed others but has not taken the loan.

loans.use: to buy more stock like salt, sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Luisa Melba

texts.es: Luisa es una señorita de 26 años, es madre soltera, su hija Emily tiene dos año de edad, Luisa vive con su hermano, su cuñada y tres sobrinos, son 5 años que Melba se dedica a la crianza de pollos, viven en un lugar donde no tiene acceso al agua potable y tiene que coger de un renaciente de agua, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos para mejorar su negocio, la aspiración de Luisa es mejorar sus ingresos y de esta manera darle un buen futuro a su hija.
texts.en: Luisa is a 26-year-old young woman, a single mother. Her daughter, Emily, is two years old. Luisa lives with her brother, her sister-in-law and three nephews and nieces. She has been working raising chickens for 5 years. They live in a place where they don't have access to potable water and they have to get it from a spring. The loan will be invested in the purchase of chicks to improve her business, Luisa's aspiration is to improve her income and in this way give her daughter a good future.

loans.use: to increase her number of chicks.

loans.name: Mango Poty Group

texts.es:
El grupo Mango Poty está en su ciclo número 2° del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas quieren conocer su situación de vida y conforme a ello poder trabajar para mejorar.
La Sra. Edith integra este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropas, y comenta que sus ventas las hace de manera ambulante, y que ya tiene una clientela bien formada. Edith es una mujer muy luchadora, que se esfuerza para poder ayudar a su familia por medio de su esfuerzo y su lucha diaria.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de remeras, jeans, camisas, pantalones, blusas y otro tipo de prendas, de manera a poder cumplir con el pedido de sus clientes. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de mejorar y crecer en el emprendimiento que hace.
texts.en:
The group Mango Poty is in its 2nd loan cycle in the women's committee program, where they all work and help each other to get ahead. They are completing the poverty elimination tool where they all want to know their living situation and, according to that, be able to work to improve.

Edith joined this group. She works selling clothing and says that she makes her sales as a street vendor and that she already has a well-established customer base. Edith is a very determined woman who works hard to be able to help her family through her efforts and her daily struggle.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, blouses and other types of clothing, in such a way as to be able to fill her customers' orders. She is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to improve and grow in her undertaking.

loans.use: to purchase t-shirts, jeans, shirts, pants, blouses and other types of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer Group

texts.es:
En total son 20 mujeres inspiradas en mejorar sus condiciones de vida las que se unieron para poder formar este comité. Se formaron en este comité con el fundamento de ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Hilda es una de las que integra este grupo, ella se dedica al humilde trabajo de venta de remedios naturales, y por medio de este trabajo tiene los ingresos necesarios para poder ayudar a su familia. Hilda es una mujer muy luchadora que quiere ser alguien en la vida, es por eso que se unió a este grupo para poder capacitarse y mejorar en lo que viene haciendo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales para la venta, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Comenta que tiene una buena clientela que siempre se acerca a su puesto para poder comprar sus remedios naturales.
texts.en:
In all, they are 20 women inspired to improve their living conditions who joined to be able to form this committee. They got together in this committee on the basis of helping each other to be able to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

Hilda is one that makes up this group. She works in the humble job of selling natural remedies, and through this work she has the income needed to be able to help her family. Hilda is a most fighting woman who wants to be somebody in life. It is why she joined this group to be able to become skilled and improve in what she has been doing.

Hilda is asking for this loan to be able to buy natural remedies for sale and thus be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She says she has a good customer base who always come to her workplace to be able to buy her natural remedies.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies for sale.

loans.name: San Expedito Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “San Expedito” está dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza de la fundación paraguaya, ellas a través de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores podrán conocer su situación de vida, y una vez que lo sepan podrán trabajar por mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Juana, quien se dedica a las costuras, ella hace todo tipo de confecciones, es muy conocida en su barrio ya que hace muy buenos trabajos siempre. Juana es muy trabajadora, comenta que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día y termina tarde en la noche, de manera a poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones y otros, ya que tiene diversos pedidos con los que quiere cumplir. Agradece por esta gran oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y capacitarse para aplicar lo que aprendió a su emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The group called San Expedito is in Fundación Paraguaya's poverty elimination program. They, through the survey of the 50 indicators, will be able to know their life situation and once they know it they will be able to work to improve their living conditions and those of their families.

One of the members of this group is Juana, who works in sewing. She sews all sorts of products, and is very well-known in her neighborhood since she always does very good work. Juana is very hard-working, and says that she works every day from the very early hours of the day and ends late at night, so as to be able to fill her customers' orders.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase fabric, thread, elastics, buttons, and more, since she has a variety of orders that she wants to fill. She is grateful for this great opportunity that she is getting to be able to grow and get training to apply what she learned to her undertaking.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, elastics, buttons and other supplies for sewing.

loans.name: Ramos

texts.es:
Ramos con 42 años de edad, de estado civil soltera,vive en casa familiar, junto a sus padres en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona urbana.Ramos cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ramos se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales como aptos y gallinas,con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 6 años, en su propio domicilio.Solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento para sus animales y ampliar sus corrales.De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Ramos a tenido préstamos con Edpyme Alternativa, el último fue de S/.2,000.00 el cuál canceló puntualmente.Ha mejorado su calidad de vida desde que se hizo socia de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Ramos, 42 years old, is single and lives in the family home with her parents in Cayaltí district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, in the country of Peru, in an urban zone. Ramos has very good personal and work references. The people in this area work primarily in agriculture, commerce and raising animals.

Ramos works at raising and selling animals such a ducks and chickens at her own home, with over 6 years of experience in this field. She asks for the loan to purchase feed for her animals and expand her corrals. In this way, she will grow her business more, get more income, and be able to improve her quality of life.

Ramos has had loans with Edpyme Alternativa. The last one was for S/.2,000.00 which she paid off punctually. She has improved her quality of life since she became a client of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her animals and expand her corrals.

loans.name: Vecinos Emprendedores Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “VECINOS EMPRENDEDORES”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Echarate, perteneciente a la provincia de La Convención y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Soledad continua con su negocio de restaurant, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia lleva años dedicándose a su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua elaborando diferentes platos como pollo al horno, sopas y saltados de carne entre otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, aceite entre otros.
Los socios en general agradecen  a quienes forman parte de este sueño y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to the communal bank "Vecinos Emprendedores" [Enterprising Neighbors]. This bank is located in the district of Echarate, belonging to the province of La Convención and department of Cusco.

The borrower is Soledad. She continues with her restaurant business. She is a responsible and persevering person. Soledad has spent years working on her business which is doing well thanks to the effort she puts in her business each day. She continues to make different dishes like baked chicken, soups, and sautéed meat, among others, this being the way that she gets her family ahead. Soledad is requesting a loan to buy rice, oil, among others.

The members, in general, are grateful to those who are part of this dream and commit to comply with their installments' payments by the deadline set.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, among others.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es:
Miriam continúa con su negocio de venta de comida tradicional. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó comprando un refrigerador para conservar los alimentos frescos, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque su negocio funciono correctamente. Actualmente su negocio funciona todos los días de la semana y cuenta con clientes continuos, “es sumamente necesario el refrigerador,  ahora me es más fácil cocinar porque puedo guardar los alimentos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que se encuentra bien ubicado, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para reponer los insumos de cocina como; aceite, arroz, fideo, carne y otros. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y vender pollo a la broaster por las noches, ella desea comprar insumos de cocina para cocinar almuerzo y cena. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene desarrollando esta actividad.
 Es por esos motivos que Miriam solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos de cocina para cocinar almuerzo y cena.
texts.en:
Miriam continues to work at his business selling traditional meals.

Miriam used her previous loan to buy a fridge to store fresh food. She repaid her loans punctually as her business was working well.

Miriam's business is open every weekday and has regular customers.

Miriam says, "The fridge is very necessary. Now it is easier to cook because I can store foods."

One strong-point of Miriam's business is that it is in a good location. One disadvantage is that she does not have enough capital to buy cooking supplies such as oil, rice, pastas, meat and more.

Miriam's dream is to make improvements to her business and to sell broaster chicken in the evenings. She wants to buy supplies to prepare lunches and dinners. This is Miriam's second loan in the six years that she has had this business.

For the above reasons, Miriam is applying for a loan in order to buy supplies to prepare lunches and dinners.

loans.use: to buy supplies to prepare lunches and dinners.

loans.name: Eladio

texts.es:
Eladio con 66 años de edad, de estado civil viudo, vive en casa propia, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú. Eladio cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Eladio se dedica brindar servicio de urbano en mototaxi, con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 05 años, brindando servicio en Cayalti y anexos.Solicita préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. De esta manera hacer crecer más su negocio,obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Eladio a tenido 6 préstamos en Edpyme Alternativa, el último fue de S/.2,000.00 el cuál lo canceló puntualmente.
texts.en:
Eladio is 66 years old and a widower. He lives in a house that he owns in the Cayalti district, Chiclayo province. Chiclayo is in the Lambayeque province of Peru. Eladio receives very good personal and professional references from locals. The people here in Cayalti mainly work in farming, cattle-raising and trade.

Eladio himself makes a living providing motorcycle taxi services. He has five years' experience providing such services in Cayalti and neighbouring areas. He is applying for this loan to maintain and repair his motorcycle taxi. He can thus expand his business, earn a higher income, and to improve his quality of life.

Eladio has taken out six loans with Edpyme Alternativa. His last loan was for 2000 Nuevo Soles, which he paid back on time.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Nuevo Amanecer De Curahuasi Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “NUEVO AMANECER DE CURAHUASI”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Curahuasi, perteneciente a la provincia de Abancay y departamento de Cusco. 

La socia es la Sra. Justina ella es casada y tiene 48 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de cereales, la socia vende maíz, trigo y quinua, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 5:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 4 años en este negocio y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener un local donde pueda vender los cereales. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar trigo, maíz y quinua.

Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de agricultura, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de animales. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
These members belong to the "Nuevo Amanecer de Curahuasi" communal bank, located in Curahuasi district of Abancay province in Cusco department.

One member, Justina, is 48 years old and married. She has three children. Justina works at her business selling corn, wheat and quinoa. Justina works from 8am to 5pm. She has had the business for four years and it is going very well. Justina's dream is to have premises where she can sell cereals. Justina is applying for a loan in order to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

The other members of the group has various business, including a farming business, one selling meals, a grocery shop and a business selling animals.

Justina is grateful to those who are part of this dream and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy wheat, corn and quinoa.

loans.name: Once De Mayo - Huancarani Group

texts.es:
La socia Benita pertenece al banco comunal ONCE DE MAYO-HUANCARANI.
La socia Benita  continua con su negocio de venta de comida, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia continua elaborando diferentes tipos de platos para sus distintos clientes que le solicitan, a la vez la socia continua dedicándose a su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, siendo de esta forma que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
 La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite, azúcar, gaseosas entre otros.
Los socios se sienten agradecidos por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de salud y trabajo.
texts.en:
Benita is a member of the communal bank called ONCE DE MAYO-HUANCARANI.

Benita is a responsible and diligent person who has a business selling prepared food. She makes different types of meals for at the request of her various clients. She also has a grocery store business and in this way she is able to provide for her family.

Benita is asking for a loan to buy oil, sugar, sodas and other products.

The group members are grateful for the loan credit that has been approved and commit to making the required repayments.

The members whose photo's have been added to the main picture apologize for their late arrival at the meeting due to work and health reasons.

loans.use: to buy oil, sugar , sodas and other products.

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino con 32 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico, vive junto a su cónyuge e hija,en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú, en zona urbana. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican básicamente a la agricultura cultivo de café, cría-engorde de ganado vacuno, cría de animales menores y cultivo de producto de pan llevar.

Celestino se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, variedad Catimor, plantación tiene 4 años de edad,con una experiencia en el rubro de 04 años. Así mismo cuenta con una pequeña bodega, vendiendo productos de víveres, negocio funciona en casa propia .Adicionalmente cría animales menores (cuyes, gallinas y cerdos), cultiva productos de pan llevar (yuca, menestras, vitucas y otos) siendo estos dos últimos para su consumo y en ocaciones para la venta.Solicita préstamo para el mantenimiento de sus cultivos, con ello obtendrá una mayor y mejor producción obteniendo mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Celestino es socio recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa. Celestino firma con su cónyuge.
texts.en: Celestino is 32 years old and in a common-law marriage. He lives with his domestic partner and their daughter in their own house made of rustic material in an urban area of the district of Santo Tomas, province of Cutervo, department of Cajamarca, Peru. The inhabitants of this town work mainly in agriculture: in coffee cultivation, raising and fattening cattle, raising small animals and cultivating basic staples for daily consumption. Celestino works in farming: specifically cultivating coffee of the Catimor variety. He has 4 years experience. He also has a small grocery store where he sells basic items. His business is located in his own house. Additionally, he raises small animals (guinea pigs, chickens and pigs). He cultivates basic staples (cassava, cereals, taro, and others), being the latter two for his consumption and occasionally for sale. He is requesting a loan to maintain his crops. With it, he will obtain a larger and better production, earning more to improve his quality of life and that of his family. Celestino is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa. Celestino is signing the loan with his partner.

loans.use: to maintain his crops.

loans.name: Kyakatabuka United Group

texts.en:
Julius, 36, is married and lives in Masindi, Uganda. He is responsible for taking care of seven children, five of whom are able to acquire an education. He has been riding a motorcycle since 2009 for income to support his family. After realizing that the motorcycle alone could not cover his daily expenses, he started farming.

Julius is a member of the Kyakatabuka United Group, which uses group guarantorship because members don't pledge securities. Julius would like to buy a motor vehicle for transport but, due to inadequate capital, he has failed to raise the money. In addition, he complains of poor roads that lead to constant mechanical expenses. He needs a loan to service his motorcycle.

loans.use: to service his motorcycle.

loans.name: Kyandema Twetungure  Group

texts.en:
Scovia is a hardworking married woman with four children, aged 9, 3, 15 and 18 years. All of her children attend school in Kamwenge, Uganda, where they live with their parents.

Scovia is a member of the Kyandema Twetungure Group, whose members guarantee each other to acquire loans. She grows crops as her main source of livelihood. Apart from that, she buys and sells fish to earn extra income. She started selling fish four years ago and works six days a week.

Scovia has a dream of educating all of her children. Her main challenge is bad weather, which leads to low output from her garden. She is requesting a loan to buy pesticides for her garden.

loans.use: to buy pesticides for her garden.

loans.name: Vergenia

texts.en: Living near the sea allows Vergenia to make a business out of it. Coming from Bien Unido, she learned the business of buying and selling dried fish and salted fish. This business provided for her six children during their growing-up years. She is asking for a loan to continue expanding her business. She will use the loan to buy more salted fish and dried fish to sell. She is eager to make continuous improvements to support her youngest child, who is 18 years old. Her income will also be used for the family's needs.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish and salted fish.

loans.name: Rahila

texts.en:
Rahila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating of a good harvest this season, Rahila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. Before joining Babban Gona, Rahila would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs.

With the help of this loan, Rahila can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. As a Babban Gona member, Rahila will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. Rahila is thankful that she now has the opportunity to to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Ida

texts.en: Ida has been running her business. She has been in this business for many years.She's working hard to earn for profit.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her corn production

loans.name: Angel

texts.en:
Angel is an artisan from Peru who specializes in bronze and copper art. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including copper, bronze and silver solder.

Angel has been selling through NOVICA since 2010. This is his story:

"This art means a lot in my life; it is how I support my family and is also my passion. My art is a way of capturing all my efforts and dedication toward my family. What motivates me is that I want to learn more about my ancestors and our cultural legacy. What I want to transmit is everything that ancient Peruvian cultures left for the world. I want everyone to know these great artisans and their creations."

"I'd like to thank you all from the bottom of my heart, for it's not often that I have felt so supported and appreciated. Sending you all a warm hug from a distance."

Use the link below to view Angel's bronze and copper art on the NOVICA site:

http://www.novica.com/kiva/7664

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including copper, bronze and silver solder

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
Zahida is responsible mother of 5 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan where her husband has been providing transport facilities by driving a taxi for 15 years. Her husband needs to do maintenance on his taxi because its current condition is not good and it requires more maintenance charges on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to do this.

Therefore Zahida has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
With the help of this loan Zahida's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And provide the better transport facilities to earn the profitable income. Zahida also plans to make savings with the profit amount of her husband's income to meet her family's needs in future.
Zahida is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her husband's taxi.

loans.name: Henry

texts.en:
Henry is a 51 year old married man with 3 children aged 16, 14 and 10 who attend school. He is a farmer, growing food crops like Irish potatoes, sweet potatoes and also rearing chicken for egg production that he sells. At the same time Henry spends most of his time brewing waragi a local drink in his village.

Hardships like limited capital,high cost of poultry feeds and unpredictable weather changes are a hindrance to his goal of building a good residential house. Henry needs a loan to buy poultry feed for his birds.

loans.use: to buy poultry feeds for his birds.

loans.name: Diep's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Diep, born in 1988 is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family’s main occupation is small trade and raising chickens, pigs to get more income for the family. The income after deducting costs and payments for her children’s education fee is just enough to cover the living expense of the family.

She wants to invest in raising chickens and pigs but she does not have enough money to do. Therefore, she wants to take a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding, and when selling the next chicken and pig herd, it will bring her family a considerable profit. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in raising chickens and pigs

loans.name: Olive

texts.en:
Olive is 28 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. Her business is selling clothes. She has been in the business for 10 years. She earns a monthly income of 30,000 Kenya shillings. 

This is her first loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy more clothes to sell. She will use the profits from the expanded business to pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams are to be financially stable.

loans.use: buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Agape Group

texts.en:
From a humble background to attain a purposeful business enlargement, the Agape group with it's excellence in business development wishes to acquire a loan of GHS 5200.

Emmanuel who is the group representative is a married man with 3 children. Emmanuel, with his group sell second-hand cloth, charcoal and hair products, he has been a supportive and active member of ID-Ghana for the fifth (5th) time now with no regret or difficulties of repayment. By the help of Kiva through ID-Ghana he has developed the desire to enlarge his business in order to meet the requested needs of his customers.

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothing to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Remberto

texts.en: Remberto is 52 years old he works as a taxi driver. He is doing well and this time he needs a loan to buy an engine for his car. Remberto has invested a lot in his vehicle but he can't buy a new one so it is very important for him if you can help. Remberto is a married man with a family and now he is living with them at his parents house. Remberto is the only one that works in the family

loans.use: to buy an engine for his car

loans.name: Rudelyn

texts.en: Rudelyn started her business six years ago. She sells dried fish and salted fish in Bien Unido, Bohol. Salted fish serves as an appetizer every meal time, it adds flavor to any dish because of its salty taste. While on the other hand, a fried dried fish is always welcome every morning for breakfast with rice. Because of the high demand, Rudelyn is asking for additional capital so she can buy more stocks of these to resell, thus augmenting her income. She hopes that out of her loan through CEVI and Kiva, she will be able to support the schooling of her ten-year-old daughter.

loans.use: to buy salted fish and dried fish

loans.name: Ruby

texts.en: Ruby is 41 years old; she is from the community of Bien Unido. In her area seafood is the main livelihood of most people because of the thriving fishing business. Her husband is a fisherman too. Out of this, she learned to buy and sell dried fish and salted fish. She is asking for a loan to buy more fried fish and salted fish. Out of her business, she supports three children aged 13, 16 and 18. It is her hope and dream that she can support the needs of her children through education so that they can have a better life quite different from hers in the future.

loans.use: to buy dried fish and salted fish to sell.

loans.name: St. Edwards S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Vincent. He is the Deputy Head teacher of St. Edwards Secondary School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kibaale with 800 students. St. Edwards School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

St. Edwards School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Vincent ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Kalerwe Tulla Tda Group

texts.en:
Farouk is 36-year-old taxi driver and a father of two. He does this work every day and has found it rewarding. He has been able to buy a plot of land and build a small house for his family in Kalerwe, a Kampala suburb.

He started by driving other people's taxi's, but now wants to buy his own taxi; with his experience he is sure it will be very rewarding. He therefore joined Kalerwe Tula Taxi Drivers Group, Sub Group A to access a loan facility of 1,000,000 Uganda Shillings from Ugafode Microfinance to top off and buy a taxi.

With hard work, he believes he will soon be able to have a stable income, put up some rentals and have his children’s education needs catered for.

He appreciates the support.

loans.use: to buy a taxi.

loans.name: Genara

texts.en:
Genara is 37 years of age and a married woman. With three children to take care of ages 5, 12 and 13, she chose to engage herself in managing a small business so she will not have to leave home. Genara owns a sari-sari store business in their village. Her wish is to have another business to have an additional source of income.

She is asking for a loan to buy rice, feed, toothpaste, shampoo, vinegar, cooking oil, soy sauce and canned food for her store. At present, Genara utilizes her profits to supporting the basic needs of her children like food and school fees. She hopes to further expand and introduce more merchandise in her store for better profitability.

loans.use: to buy rice, feed, toothpaste, shampoo, vinegar, cooking oil, soy sauce and canned food for her store.

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.en:
Rogelio lives in in Bien Unido, Bohol with his wife. He is engaged in fishing and he also owned a sari-sari store business in the place.

He is asking a loan to buy a new fishing boat and to increase his store's inventory with things like noodles, seasoning, toiletries and canned food.

With this, Rogelio will be able to improve his catch, thus giving him more fish to sell in the market and will also impact his store to attract customers.

In the future, he hopes to make his business more stable and sustainable.

loans.use: to buy a new fishing boat and to increase his store's inventory with things like noodles, seasoning, toiletries and canned food.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
As a woman married to a fisherman, Margarita runs a fishing business with her husband. She sells her husband's catch at their town's market.

She is worried because their fishing boat needs repair and it affects their finances.

She is asking a loan to buy paint, plywood and nails to repair the boat.

Once this is addressed, he can go back to fishing as usual, catch more and their life will be easier, allowing her to buy a healthy diet for herself and her husband, and also pay for household expenses like water and electricity.

loans.use: to buy plywood, paint and nails

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of five children from Bien Unido, Bohol. She runs a sari-sari business while her husband is engaged in fishing.

Alma is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell in her store such as noodles, spices, toothpaste, detergent, coffee, sugar, chips and toiletries. She will also use the money to pay for house repair and buy cement.

It is her dream to be successful in giving her children a better future through education, and for her to keep a good record of paying her loan on-time.

loans.use: to buy noodles, spices, toothpaste, detergent, coffee, sugar, chips, toiletries, to pay for house repair and to buy cement.

loans.name: Nyakiyumbu S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Nyamusana. She is an Administrator of Nyakiyumbu S. School, a mixed school in the Rural area of Kasese with 750 students. Nyakiyumbu School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Nyakiyumbu School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Nyamusana ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es: Fernanda es humilde y trabajadora tiene 26 años es madre soltera de tres hijos Fernando de 4 años está estudiando en una escuela gratuita del sector , Paul de 2 años y Miguel de un año permanecen junto a su madre que se dedica  hace seis años atrás a la crianza de pollos. Fernanda necesita el dinero para comprar  vitaminas, balanceado incrementar pollos, para poder quedarse en casa junto a sus hijos pequeños sin salir a trabajar a otro lugar obteniendo dinero para alimentarlos, pagar el lugar donde viven y seguir educando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fernanda is a humble, hardworking 26 year old single mother with three children. Fernando is four years old and attends a free school in the area, Paul is two years old, and Miguel who is one all live with their mother. Fernanda has made a living by rearing chickens for the last six years .

Fernanda needs a loan to buy vitamins and compound feed to rear chickens. This will allow her to stay at home with her young children without having to out to work. It will provide an income to feed her children, pay for their home and continue her children's education.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and chickens.

loans.name: Mutanywana S. School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Joshua. He is the head teacher of Mutanywana S. School, a mixed school in the rural area of Kasese with 520 students.

Mutanywana School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent, clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 520 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day.

Mutantwana School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Joshua ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students’ concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Trinity

texts.en:
Trinity is a bright, eager young woman who resides in the city of Blantyre, the second largest city in Malawi and is sometimes referred to as the commercial capital of Malawi. This makes it an ideal location for an emerging entrepreneur. Trinity is looking to tap into that and run her own business here, this will make the sending and receiving of money much easier and safer for locals.

At 20 years old, Farida is the breadwinner in a family of four. Her dream is to run her own business, but lack of capital is a huge obstacle in making this dream a reality. Currently, the economy in Malawi makes it difficult for young people to find gainful employment. This makes it difficult for Trinity to support herself and her family. She believes that becoming a Zoona agent and running her own business will turn his situation around.

Trinity has a diploma in marketing management and she would like to make a success of running a mobile money transfer business in Blantyre. Trinity will use the revenue generated to further her education and plow all that knowledge back into her business and her community. She loves working with people and she would like to use her business to create employment opportunities for others.

On a broader spectrum, Trinity would like to be able to give back to her community by not only creating employment opportunities and thus helping others achieve peace of mind, but also to be a viable, trustworthy alternative in a country where banking is simply too expensive for most of the ordinary people.

This would not only save her community member’s time, but it would also lower their expenses as this would reduce the need to travel long distances in order to send and receive money.
One of her objectives is to take safe money transfer facilities to the community, and clients no longer having to spend on travel would make this a reality as well as improve the overall customer experience. She would like to increase her Zoona footprint in Malawi. She also hopes to influence some of the young people in her family to become entrepreneurs like her.
Zoona has done market research and in so doing has found that, with Blantyre being the second largest city in Malawi, the location in which Trinity is looking to open her outlet, would be ideal not only for employment opportunities for that community, but also to generate the traction she envisions for her business.
Trinity thanks the Kiva lenders for their support in her endeavor.

loans.use: to procure a Zoona branded trolley and an internet enabled phone as well as the funds needed to make the actual transactions so that she can start running her own business.

loans.name: Llesh

texts.en:
Llesh is in the photograph with his wife, Marije and they are in their early 50s and parents of two children, 20 and 17 with the older one studying in a public university. During these past ten years, their focus has been on agriculture. They have about six dynym of agricultural land where they mainly plant fodder for the animals and some seasonal veggies and have a few orchards. They have two dairy cows selling roughly eight liters of raw milk/day and two calves a year. Another income in the family is the retirement pension of his elderly mother in an amount of $49/month and a $94/monthly pay of his wife. Llesh does seasonal work in Greece; picking olives.

A loan in an amount of 300,000 Albanian Lek that Llesh is requesting will be used to pay his child's university tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for the university tuition fees of the older child.

loans.name: Marie Honorine

texts.fr: Honorine vous remercie beaucoup de tout son cœur pour le crédit. Elle a pu acheter des serviettes supplémentaires et des sous-vêtements et tee-shirts pour son commerce pour compléter l'étalage. Elle est en mesure de soutenir la scolarisation de ses enfants. Elle espère pouvoir encore compter sur vous pour un autre demande de crédit. Elle voudrait encore continuer à lutter et à avancer car l'objectif n'est pas encore atteint. Le chemin est encore loin. Elle souhaite encore renforcer le capital pour pouvoir augmenter de plus en plus le revenu. D'ailleurs c'est le moment très propice pour renouveler les stocks de marchandises.
texts.en:
Honorine thanks you from the bottom of her heart for the loan. She was able to buy more towels and some underwear and T-shirts for her business so as to complete her inventory. This allows her to pay her children's school fees.

Honorine hopes to be able to count on you again for another loan. She would like to continue her struggle to move forward since she has not yet attained her goal. The distance to that goal is still great. Honorine would like to increase her working capital so as to bring in more income. As a matter of fact, it is an excellent moment for her to renew her inventory.

loans.use: to buy supplementary towels, T-shirts and undergarments.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es:
El grupo Virgen de Fatima  está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación donde una de las integrantes es la Sra. Limpia, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel dos, es decir, está en un nivel medio de ingresos. Ella cuenta que se dedica a la venta de helados y posee su propio negocio en su casa.
La Sra. Limpia  solicita el préstamo para la compra de sabores variados de Helado, vasitos para servir sus helados y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
Limpia a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza.
texts.en:
The Virgen de Fatima is in its second cycle of the women's committee program. All of them are working and helping each other get ahead. They are completing the poverty eliminatio survey. Limpia is one of the members. On the last survey she was at a level two level of poverty. That means that she is at a middle level of income.

She sells ice cream, and she has her own business at her house.

Limpia is requesting the loan to buy different flavors of ice cream and cups to servce the ice cream and other items. This way she will be able to continue with her sales.

Limpia, through her effort, continuing work, and the application of the vital behaviors of a successful woman, is improving her poverty situation.

loans.use: to buy different flavors of ice cream and cups to serve the ice cream and other items.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane, aged 48, is married and has three children; ages 17, 16 and 13 years old. She live a simple with her family in Carles, Iloilo. Mary Jane has been engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 18 years. It is their main source of income. Mary Jane is requesting a loan to buy fishing net. This loan will allow her to improve their fishing business as well as their income. Aside from buying fishing net, she also plans to buy piglets. Perhaps, she is thinking of other business that will enhance their livelihood, such as raising pigs. In the future, Mary Jane hopes to make their business sustainable and productive. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's schooling.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and piglets

loans.name: Zou El Fikar Group

texts.en:
Halima is the featured borrower for Zou El Fikar Group. She joined with her other group members to take this Al Majmoua loan because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are working hard to develop their businesses and living at the same time.

Halima is 51-year-old widow who started thirty one years ago working in tailoring to cover the needs and expenses of her family that consists of seven. She is well known locally for her professional skills in this domain. Halima is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary textiles to make curtains and bed covers. Halima is the lady standing in the middle. Fatima is the first lady on the right, and Layal is the lady on the left of the photo.

loans.use: to buy the necessary textiles to make curtains and bed covers.

loans.name: Mukhtar

texts.en:
Mukhtar is maize farmer from Wambai village. As a member of Babban Gona, Mukhtar is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Mukhtar would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Mukhtar can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Mukhtar is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Oganizasyon Tet Ansanm Milo(Otam)

texts.en:
Conzales is the coordinator of a rural organization located in Milot, in the North of Haiti. He is largely assisted by agricultural professionals and some city officials. Conzales manages the marketing of cocoa and controls the entire chain (production, processing and packaging). Conzales's organization produces chocolate, cocoa oil, an oil derived from refined cocoa for pain, and markets fermented cocoa.

With the collective support of its members and some marketing strategies, Conzales has penetrated a large segment of the local and national market. Conzales' organization has been selling at least 200 packets of chocolate and other products to its various outlets. However, their mill broke down a few months ago, which made them unable to satisfy their clients' demand. As a result, many members have no economic activity.

Therefore, Conzales, aged 39, requests a loan through Fonkoze-Zafen to buy the much-needed equipment. From left to right in the picture, a committee of five members: Conzales (leader-coordinator), Jacques (deputy coordinator), Emmanie (delegate), Immacula (treasurer), Judson (advisor).

loans.use: to buy a mill, a freezer, and some raw materials to increase its production.

loans.name: Willy

texts.en:
Willy is a repeat client of Ugafode. He is a motorcycle owner and he personally rides it in he city and it is his only source of income. He is appreciative of Kiva and Ugafode for the better financial assistance rendered to him.
This is his family's only source of income. His challenge is that he now has many competitors dong the same business. He needs the loan to buy another motorcycle to increase his income sources.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle

loans.name: Mario Rene

texts.es: Mario de 48 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, el trabaja en una empresa privada desde hace 10 años y es gracias a su trabajo como ha podido salir adelante con los gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejorar su vivienda contruyendo el baño y cambiando el techo donde esta el lavadero pero como no posee de suficiente capital esta solicitando un credito para la compra de todos los materiales de contruccion para poder mejorar su vivienda y tener un lugar mas limpio donde vivir.
texts.en:
Mario, age 48, lives in his own house with his wife and their four children. He has been working for a private company for ten years. Thanks to his work, he has been able to get ahead with the household expenses.

He wants to improve his house by building a bathroom and changing the roof where the sink is. However, he does not have enough capital. He is requesting a loan to buy construction materials to be able to improve his house and to have a cleaner place to live.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Willie

texts.en:
Willie is already 45 years old and is a married man. He has a contractual job in his town Mitugas Tudela, Misamis Occidental while his wife is left in their house to take good care of their 6 children. Unfortunately his salary is not enough to provide the needs of his family. He still sends them to school despite of the hardship they are facing. In order to support the financial needs of his family he has to engage in a selling copra business.

He planted almost 25 coconut trees and this makes him earned extra income. The trees need to be maintained in a good condition in order to bear fruits. He has applied a loan from Gata Daku MPC for the maintenance/labor cost of the said business. In the near future he plans to buy a motorcycle to be used for the transportation of his children from their house to school.

loans.use: to pay for the labor costs and maintenance of his coconut business

loans.name: Alh. Sule

texts.en:
Alh. Sule is a Babban Gona farmer. Alh. Sule is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Alh. Sule would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With this loan Alh. Sule can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Alh. Sule has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Alh. Sule is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to improve his farming skills and looks forward to using his additional earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Nguyen Hong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Hong, 42 years old, is the Kinh ethnic majority woman. She is living with her husband and her son in Mai Son district, Son La province.
Her family lives mainly based on her husband’s meager salary and the pig breeding job. However, the income from salary and current breeding is just enough to cover the basic living expense of the family. She wants to expand the breeding but she does not have enough money to do it. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan to invest in raising pigs.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in pig breeding more effective with high productivity. Then, when selling the coming pig herd, it will bring her family a considerable profit. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to invest in raising pigs.

loans.name: Aneela

texts.en:
Aneela is active borrower of BRAC Pakistan, she lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is 33 years old and a mother of 3 children. Her husband has been working as a carpenter for 7 years.
Aneela's husband wants to buy pieces of wood and other tools for his business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband cannot afford to buy them. Therefore Aneela has applied for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. with the help of this loan her husband can purchase the relevant items and earn profitable income to meet the daily needs of family and business.
Aneela is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy wood for her husband's carpentry business.

loans.name: Claudina Ester

texts.es: Claudina es una mujer muy trabajadora. Se dedica a la actividad de cría de pollos de engorde. Solicita un préstamo de dos mil cien dólares ($2,100), para la compra de pollos y materiales de construcción para la ampliación de la granja. De esta manera podrá generar un ingreso extra en su hogar.
texts.en: Claudina is a hardworking woman. She makes a living by rearing broiler chickens. She is asking for a loan of two thousand one hundred dollars ($2,100) to buy chickens and construction materials to expand her farm. This will allow her to generate an additional income for her home.

loans.use: to buy chickens and construction materials to expand her farm.

loans.name: Silvia Eugenia

texts.es:
Silvia es una mujer de 29 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo de 8 años y una hija de 5 años, y su negocio es el tejido a mano.
Ella es buena madre, emprendedora y muy paciente. Su negocio lo realiza en la localidad ‘batallas’ caracterizado por encontrarse en cercanías al lago Titicaca.
Silvia es morena de baja estatura y físico delgado, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español, su vida la comparte con su esposo que se dedica al comercio de ganado y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela viven en una casa propia construida de adobe que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de vertiente. Su negocio es el tejido a mano, ella confecciona prendas como, gorros, guantes, bufandas y otros utilizando un par de agujas de tejer y lana su labor es netamente artesanal, “aprendí a tejer a los 11 años, ahora me hacen pedidos...” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con pedidos, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar lana. Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y contar con más lana para tejer, ella desea comprar lana para confeccionar tejidos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 18 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Silvia solicita un préstamo para comprar lana para confeccionar tejidos artesanales.
texts.en:
Silvia, age 29, is married and has an eight year old son and a five year old daughter. Her business is knitting by hand. She is a good mother, enterprising, and vey patient. She conducts her business in the "Batallas" area, which is known for being near Lake Titicaca. Silvia has a dark complexion and is short and thin. Her native language is Aymará, and she speaks Spanish. She shares her life with her husband, who sells livestock, and with her children, who go to school. They live in their own adobe house that has electricity and well water.

Her business is knitting by hand. She makes clothes like hats, gloves, scarves, and others using a pair of knitting needles and wool. Her work is purely handmade. "I learned to knit when I was 11 years old. Now orders are placed with me," she says. The advantage of her business is that she has orders. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy wool.

Her dream is to improve her business and to have more wool to knit. She wishes to buy wool to make knitted goods. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 18 years that she has been engaged in this business activity. It is for these reasons that Silvia is requesting a loan to buy wool to make handmake knitted goods.

loans.use: to buy wool to make knitted handicrafts.

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
Oliver is 35 years old, a resident of Bunamwaya and member of God is Able group. She is a widow with four children who all attend school. Despite the fact that she earns little income, Oliver has managed to take care of her children and she has provided the best for them.
Oliver has been a tailor for many years however she has been very hard working and this has enabled her to start up another business that is brick making and has also helped her a lot in supporting her family.
Oliver however needs a loan to pay her siblings fees to enable them to have a bright future.
Oliver is a hard working, honest and cooperative member in society.

loans.use: to pay tuition for her siblings.

loans.name: Neidy Estela

texts.es: Neidy de 51 años de edad es una comerciante con una amplia experiencia que lleva dedicada a esta actividad doce años en los que ha proveído bienestar a su familia; al ser madre de cuatro hijos, de los cuales solo uno es mayor de edad, le emerge una gran responsabilidad y compromiso, es por ello que en su día a día, dedica al menos 14 horas a su negocio para cumplir con la meta de ventas que le garantice un ingreso seguro.  Ella reside en compañía de su familia en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla y en esta misma localidad se encuentra su base de clientes que en su gran mayoría son conocidos, vecinos y transeúntes del lugar que llegan hasta su punto de venta a comprar productos de belleza . Ella maneja varias referencias y marcas de productos que compra de contado a almacenes especializados. Neidy tiene un nuevo proyecto de inversión que beneficiará el nivel de ingresos del hogar, ella desea invertir en electrodomésticos  y para ello aplicó a una solicitud de crédito,  su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos con los que se financiará en esta nueva oportunidad de negocio. Su meta a futuro es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Neidy is 51 years old. She is a merchant with a great deal of experience, since she has been doing her work for 12 years. In that time, she has provided for the wellbeing of her family. She is the mother of four children, of whom only one is an adult. This is a big responsibility and commitment, and it is because of this that she spends at least 14 hours a day at her business to achieve her sales goals, which guarantee her a secure income.

She lives with her family in a neighborhood located in the municipality of Barranquilla. In this same place, she has a base of clients--most of whom are acquaintances, neighbors, and passers-by. These people come tho her store to buy beauty products. She manages types and brands of products, which she buys wholesale from specialized stores.

Neidy has a new project that will increase her income for her household. She wants to invest in electronic appliances and, thus, she has applied for a loan. Her first Kiva loan is from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, and the resources from it will finance this new business opportunity. Her future goal is to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in electronic appliances.

loans.name: Flor Elizabeth

texts.es: Flor tiene 43 años de edad es madre soltera su hijo Andrés  estudia en una unidad educativa gratuita, hace ocho años atrás luego de vender café con tortillas de tiesto en las calles pudo ahorrar para  tener un pequeño negocio en el que  vende  huevos  con el dinero que obtiene satisface las necesidades básicas de su hogar. Flor necesita dinero para poder comprar más huevos  aumentaría así sus ventas  generando mayores ingresos para poder educar a su hijo y cubrir las necesidades prioritarias de su hogar.
texts.en:
Flor is 43 years old. She is a single mother and her son Andrés studies a free educational program. Eight years ago, she started selling coffee and toasted tortillas in the streets so that she could save up for a small business, in which she sells eggs. With the money she earned, she met the basic needs of her household.

Flor needs money to buy more eggs. She will increase her sales, generated more income so that she can educate her son and cover the main needs of her household.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Arshad Mehmood

texts.en:
Arshad is 53 years old. He is married and has six children, all are school and college going, Arshad works hard to provide for his family.

Arshad completed secondary school and college long before. He has started his own garments shop business for 15 years. Arshad enjoys his business because it allows him to gain invaluable experience in customer service matters, and it gives the people in his community access to the garments without any barriers.

Arshad is requesting a loan in order to expand his business from one shop to two and bring garments to more communities. He described himself as a driven and hardworking man who dreams of achieving success in business in order to further support his family and his children’s education.

When Arshad receives this loan, he will be able to purchase the required cloth and other items to complete the order he had received and continues to take orders and increase his living. Arshad has done a lot of market research and is confident of the location where he wants to expand his business. Opening this location will enable Arshad to hire two new people to help him run the branch.

This loan means a lot to Arshad, as it will give him the chance to grow.

loans.use: to run his garments shop and help educate his children.

loans.name: Husam

texts.en:
Husam is a 39-years-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids in a simple house. Husam works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to improve the family living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Husam took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Husam will be able to provide clean water especially for his kids.
Husam appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Gazmend

texts.en:
Gazmend lives in a small village and earns a living working in agriculture. He is the father of four children; three daughters and one son between the ages of 2 and 8 years old. As the main source of income, he works hard to be able to provide for his family. He has cows that he keeps and raises to sell and also to gain the milk and dairy products from for his family consumption and to sell. He also has land where he plants wheat and corn.

Gazmend has a lot of demand for his dairy products and is requesting a loan to purchase another milk cow. He would be happy to see his farm expand and be able to continue to increase his income so that he can provide a better life and future for his children.

loans.use: to purchase another milk cow.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 22 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, posee una tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia desde hace 2 años e inicio con capital propio para poder salir adelante con su familia, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida junto con su familia.
texts.en:
The young woman whose blurred face you see is twenty two years old and lives in a high risk location. She has run a shop from her home for the last two years that she started with her own capital. This allows her to provide for her family.

She lives in her own home with her domestic partner and her daughter. She is asking for a loan to buy soup, eggs, basic staples, sodas, candy, pastries and so forth. This will allow her to increase her income and provide a better standard of living for her family.

loans.use: to buy soups, eggs, basic staples , sodas, candy, pastries etc

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Y Solidarias Group

texts.es:
