Este grupo es bastante numeroso, se formó en la ciudad de Encarnación, ellas son mujeres muy unidas y sacrificadas que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las que integra este grupo es la Sra. Petrona, una mujer muy sacrificada que está poniendo todo de sí para poder crecer y mejorar sus ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia. Petrona es una persona entusiasta que pone todo de sí para poder capacitarse y mejorar en su humilde emprendimiento el cual es una despensa.
La Sra. Petrona solicita  este préstamo para la compra de productos  para su negocio, como ser verduras, frutas, lácteos, panificados, lácteos y otros, y de esa manera poder continuar con su lucha como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar en su emprendimiento.
texts.en: This group is quite large. It was formed in the city of Encarnacion.  These are very united and dedicated women who want to improve their own quality of life and the lives of their loved ones. They belong to the program for the elimination of poverty,  fighting to improve their lives. One of the women who forms part of this group is Mrs. Petrona, a dedicated woman who is giving her best to grow and improve her earnings to help her family. Petrona is very enthusiastic, and tries hard to learn and improve her humble business which is a grocery store. Mrs. Petrona is requesting a loan to buy products for her business such as vegetables, fruits, milk products, breads and others, thus she will continue her fight. She is grateful for the opportunity given to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetable, fruit, dairy products, bread products and other items to stock the store.

loans.name: Jose Medardo

texts.es:
Jose continúa con su negocio de pesca. El crédito que obtuvo lo utilizó para refaccionar su bote y arreglar el motor, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo trabajar todo el tiempo. Actualmente su bote funciona correctamente y brinda la seguridad que necesita, “con la refacción de mi bote trabajo desde el amanecer…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que vende toda su mercadería, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para comprar redes de pescar. Su sueño es contar con dinero para trabajar, él desea comprar redes de 30 y 20 piezas. Esta es la 2 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 6 años que viene realizando esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Jose solicita un préstamo para comprar redes de 30 y 20 piezas para pescar en el lago Titicaca.
texts.en:
Jose continues with his fishing business. The loan he obtained was used to repair his boat and fix the motor. His payments were on time because he was able to work the whole time. Right now, his boat functions properly and offers the safety that he needs. “With the repair of my boat, I start working at dawn", he remarks. The advantage of his business is that he sells all of his merchandise. The disadvantage is the lack of money to buy fishing nets. His dream is to have the money to work. He wants to buy 30 and 20 piece nets. This is his second loan cycle with the institution in the 6 years that he has been doing this activity.

These are the reasons that Jose is asking for a loan to buy 20 and 30 piece nets to fish in lake Titicaca.

loans.use: to buy 30 and 20 piece nets to fish in lake Titicaca.

loans.name: Lurdes

texts.en:
A $1,000 loan is being offered to Lurdes to improve her business.

Lurdes lives in Atsabe. Most of her daily income is from selling shoes and she is still happy to be doing this business. She sells shoes and also other items like hats, bags, belts, woven blankets and other items. She started her business in 2006 with her own working capital of $300.

She is going to add this money to the loan amount in order to buy more shoes, slippers, hats, bags, belts, woven blankets and other items that people like, as this has now become her principal activity.

She is happy with the loan that has been offered by Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more shoes, etc. and she wants to manage her business well.

The two men on the side of the photo are her husband in a yellow shirt and their friend in a blue shirt.

loans.use: to buy shoes, slippers, hats, bags, belts, woven blankets and other items.

loans.name: Bernadino

texts.en:
Bernadino is a 29-year-old married father of three children who works hard to support his family. He is a teacher and his wife is a housewife. Even though the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to support the cost of their brother’s education.

This loan of $1,000 will allow Bernadino to help Jaime to continue his studies at university, and the loan will be used to pay for his tuition, textbooks and school supplies.

Bernadino loves his brother very much, and in the future, he hopes to send all of his children to school.

loans.use: to pay for his brother's tuition, textbooks and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, trabaja como maestra en un centro educativo desde hace algunos años y es gracias a su trabajo como ha podido salir adelante, la joven vive en casa propia con su esposo, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo ya que con las lluvias se ha ido deteriorando pero con lo que obtiene de su trabajo y la ayuda de su esposo no ha podido cambiarlo, por esa razon esta solicitando un credito para la compra de laminas, polines y pago de mano de obra para poder tener una vivienda mas segura.
texts.en: This young women's face is shown as pixelated because she is 27 years old and she lives in a high risk area. She has worked as a teacher in an education center for some years and it is thanks to her work that she has been able to get ahead. She lives in her own home with her husband. She wants to improve her home by changing the roof, because it has deteriorated from the rain. With what she earns from her job and her husband's help, she hasn't been able to change it. That is why she is asking for a loan to buy sheeting and rods and to pay for labor so that she can have a more secure home.

loans.use: to buy sheeting, rods and to pay for labor.

loans.name: Yunusa

texts.en:
Yunusa is a Babban Gona farmer. Yunusa is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Yunusa would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan Yunusa can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Yunusa has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha.

Yunusa is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to feed his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Harbeed

texts.en:
Harbeed is a 39-years-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and four kids in a simple house. Harbeed works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to improve the family living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Harbeed took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Harbeed will be able to provide clean water especially for his kids.
Harbeed appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Maria Fernanda

texts.es: Fernanda tiene 32 años de edad está casada su esposo es albañil, tienen tres hijos James de 15, Johan de 8 y Fernando de 7 años de edad estudian en unidades educativas del sector. Hace cuatro años atrás  vende frutas y verduras en un pequeño puesto del mercado este negocio  le ha permitido seguir educando a sus hijos y pagando el lugar donde viven. Fernanda necesita el dinero para comprar mercadería, obtener mayores ingresos, cubrir los gastos del hogar y poder seguir educando a sus hijos que es su mayor anhelo tratando de que ellos tengan un buen futuro.
texts.en:
Fernanda, 32, is married to a construction worker with whom she has three children: James, 15, Johan, 8, and Fernando, 7. All of the children go to school in the area.

For four years, Fernanda has been selling fruits and vegetables in a small stand at the market. This business has enabled her to continue her childrens' education and pay for housing expenses.

Fernanda needs money to buy merchandise so that she can earn more income and pay for expenses at home, as well as continue her sons' education. Her greatest wish is for her children to have a good future.

loans.use: buy fruits and vegetables to increase her sales.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Antonio de 73 años es un microempresario residente en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Soledad y al contar con conocimientos en el área de la metalmecánica, en el año 1999 decidió formalizar su negocio y aperturar su taller, en el que ofrece servicios técnicos de mantenimiento y reparación de equipos.  Alternamente ofrece servicios de asesoría inmobiliaria y en la actualidad tiene un proyecto de construcción de tres apartamentos, los cuales arrendará, lo que le permitirá tener un incremento de su ingresos en un 33%, para ello aplicó a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos con los que financiará su oportunidad de negocio. Antonio está separado y tiene siete hijos a los ha ofrecido bienestar y en sus metas futuras está presente su familia, por lo que desea aportar a la descendencia de sus hijos estudios profesionales y en su negocio desarrollo y el incremento del área inmobiliaria.
texts.en: Antonio is 73 years old. He is a micro-businessman who lives in a neighborhood located in the town of Soledad. Because he had knowledge in the field of mechanics, in 1999 he decided to formalize his business and open a shop. He offers technical maintenance services and equipment repair. He also offers real estate services and right now he has a project to build three apartments, which he will rent out. This will allow him to have an 33% increase in his income. For this, he has applied for a loan, his first Kiva loan from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. These resources will finance his business opportunity. Antonio is separated and has seven children whom he has offered well being. His family is in his future plans. He want to give his descendents a college education and for his business he wants to develop and increase the real estate work.

loans.use: with a project to build three apartments.

loans.name: Ardiana

texts.en:
Ardiana is very thankful for the previous loan that she has used for the loan to purchase an incubator for her business. She is very satisfied and happy with her business and hoping to continue in the future. Adiana loves her family and she is a lovely woman with a kind heart.

For the second time, Ardiana is in need of a loan for 700 Euros to purchase packages to sell the chicks. She is very optimistic that her business will expand and continue to be successful. She promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase packages to sell the chicks

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Natalia lives in Atsabe. She is married and is a business woman. She is applying for a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.

Natalia has a shop for her business and she sells in the market on market day. She has been involved in business activities since 2013 and she started with her own working capital of $400. She is earning a good income from her business and so she is still happy to do it. She started with a small store, and now she wants to change her business somewhat with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin.

She is taking out this loan because she wants to add more items including slippers, shoes and socks.

loans.use: to buy slippers, shoes and socks.

loans.name: Anelda

texts.en:
Anelda lives in Atsabe and she is a business woman. She has been involved in her business for a few years using her own working capital, and she makes the best of it.

Anelda has a very high interest in doing business. She has an small store and hopes to open a bigger store, but she doesn't have enough capital. She is requesting a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business. She will used this loan to buy additional items to keep in her store including detergents, water, sugar, noodles, cooking oils, milk, slippers, soft and hard drinks, and other things.

Anelda is taking this loan because she also wants to improve the management of her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy detergents, water, sugar, noodles, cooking oils, milk, slippers, soft and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

loans.name: Joanina

texts.en:
Joanina has been in business for a few years. She started her business with her own working capital. She also cultivates animals, like pigs, chickens and cows.

Joanina is married, and husband is very supportive of her doing business. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional items to sell, including detergents, sugar, toothpaste, water, sardines, candies, milks, onions and garlic.

Joanina wants to open a bigger business in the future. She is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business in the future, and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy detergents, sugar, toothpaste, water, sardines, candies, milks, onions, garlic and other things to sell.

loans.name: Imran Khan

texts.en:
Imran is a 31-year-old owner of a general store. He is married and lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. He runs a general store business that serves the needs of his community by providing day to day items. The business is Imran's only source of income.

Imran is requesting a loan to grow his business so that he can open increase the size of his general store and serve more customers. He would like to let his lenders know that his past he was helped to flourish his business. He is now able to serve many more customers. He explains that his personal life has improved with this business growth as, he is able to manage his home and has managed to use some of the profits from his business to furnish his house. Imran has fully repaid the last loan amount.

This loan will be used to expand his business by opening increasing the size of his general store . He conducted a survey to find out the need for a bigger area shop with customer demand. Imran would like to thank lenders for believing in him and allowing him to grow his business and improve his life through access to capital.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his general store

loans.name: Thanh's Group

texts.en:
Mrs.Thanh, born in 1973 is a Thai ethnic woman, living with her family in Mai Son district, Son La province. Her family consists of three members, including her husband and her son.

Her family’s main income is from her civil servant salary, so the income is just enough to cover foods for the family. She wants to raise chicken to improve meals for the family and get additional income but she does not have enough money to do. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in the breeding with high productivity, and she will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise chicken to improve meals

loans.name: Manchester Group

texts.en:
Sophia who is in his late 40s, is single with one child who is still at school. She has been a tailor for ten years now. She works from 7.30am to mid-night daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her sewing equipment and has managed to repay her loans successfully. She is happy with the loan. She used the profit to pay school fees, to pay shop rent, to repay loan and covered household expenses. She will use this loan to buy sewing products and to buy a designing machine. She dreams of having animal sales business.

Sophia will share this loan with her loan group MANCHESTER which consists of four members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sewing products and to buy  a designing machine.

loans.name: Solidality Group

texts.en:
Albert is 37 years old and is married with six children who are 25 and 37 years old. He is well-known in the business of buying spare parts and resale which he has been doing for about three years. This the 5th cycle to request loan in Vision Finance Company and the previous loans were good paid. He has four employees to help him in his business. 

Albert is the president of this group SOLIDALITY and is standing behind. His hours of selling spare parts are from 6 a.m. to 5 p.m. every day except on Sunday sometimes and others in group they have boutique,supermarket, spare parts... to develop their lifestyle. 

Albert wants to request a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to buy more spare parts for sale. With the profit from this loan, he will purchase enough food for the family, to buy new cloths for children, to buy medical insurance for his family and he will be able to buy his own car to help him in his business.

loans.use: to purchase more spare parts for sale.

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en: Lucina has been running a furniture-making business for twenty years. Her business is thriving specially since her husband is into carpentry and has been instrumental in helping their business. She is asking a loan to buy materials such as hard wood, nails and varnish so they can produce more and accommodate more orders. Her profit will provide her two children their school fees and healthy diet. In the future, she hope to continue increasing her customer base.

loans.use: to buy hard wood, paint and varnish

loans.name: Llane

texts.en:
Llane is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She has a hardware store in the Philippines and requested a 50,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock to have for her customers.

Llane industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling dried fish. She dreams that one day, she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of hardware to sell to customers.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a bright, eager young woman who resides in the city of Lilongwe, the capital of Malawi. It is also the transport and economic hub of Malawi, which makes it an ideal location for an emerging entrepreneur. Farida is looking to tap into that and run her own business here, this will make the sending and receiving of money much easier and safer for locals.

At 29 years old, Farida is the breadwinner in a family of six. Her dream is to run her own business, but lack of capital is a huge obstacle in making this dream a reality Currently, the economy in Malawi makes it difficult for young people to find gainful employment. This makes it difficult for Farida to support herself and her family. She believes that becoming a Zoona agent and running her own business will turn his situation around.

Farida has a certificate in banking and she would like to make a success of running a mobile money transfer business in Lilongwe. Farida will use the revenue generated to further her education and plow all that knowledge back into her business and her community. She loves working with people and she would like to use her business to create employment opportunities for others.

On a broader spectrum, Farida would like to be able to give back to her community by not only creating employment opportunities and thus helping others achieve peace of mind, but also to be a viable, trustworthy alternative in a country where banking is simply too expensive for most of the working class.

This would not only save her community member’s time, but it would also lower their expenses as this would reduce the need to travel long distances in order to send and receive money.
One of her objectives is to take safe money transfer facilities to the community, and clients no longer having to spend on travel would make this a reality as well as improve the overall customer experience. She would like to increase her Zoona footprint in Malawi.
Zoona has done market research and in so doing have found that, with Lilongwe being the largest city in Malawi, the location in which Farida is looking to open her outlet would be ideal not only for employment opportunities for that community, but also to generate the traction she envisions for her business.
Farida thanks the Kiva lenders for their support in her endeavour.

loans.use: to procure a Zoona branded trolley and an internet enabled phone as well as the funds needed to make the actual transactions so that she can start running her own business.

loans.name: Puente A Group

texts.en:
Microcredit loans are effective in developing countries like Guatemala where wage paying jobs are scarce and people survive through self-employment using their skills such as weaving, embroidery, raising livestock and poultry, or growing fruits and vegetables. The “Microcredit Plus” Program of Friendship Bridge, that combines small loans and education is an effective way for impoverished and underserved indigenous Guatemalan women to create a better life for themselves, their families and their communities.

Antonia is an example of a woman who has had very limited opportunities to grow and prosper. She has just joined the Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Puente A” located in Totonicapán, about 120 miles from Guatemala City in the Western Highlands. Antonia has a textile business and makes pants that she sells at the wholesale level in various locations around Totonicapán. She is very aware that the end of the year brings increased demand for clothing and so she is requesting a loan to buy various kinds and textures of fabric, as well as supplies for her business. Antonia and her husband are determined that their 3 children go to school. She and her husband work hard to not only meet those expenses but also to cover the expenses of their household.

Kiva investors are wonderful partners with Friendship Bridge for these women. They are moving ahead, day by day, toward a more prosperous and successful future benefiting themselves, their families and their community. Thank you, Kiva investors!

loans.use: to buy various kinds and textures of fabric, as well as supplies for her business.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: Rowena is a business-minded person. She has owned and operated her grocery store for two years. She offers various merchandise in her store. Out of this business, she support the needs of two dependents. With her goal to obtain a better income and improve her store, she is requesting a loan to buy beer, soft drinks and dried fish. She is hoping to avail this loan to keep her business progressive and have a stable source of income for her family.

loans.use: to buy beer, soft drinks and dried fish

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria has been in business since 2013. Maria has a small kiosk, which she started with her own working capital of $500.

Maria is requesting a loan of $600 from Tuba Rai Metin to buy additional supplies according to her customers' likes. She will use the loan to buy shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, hand and body products, milk, sardines, soft and hard drinks, and other things to sell.

Maria is happy because with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can grow her business in the future and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, cigarettes, candles, hand and body products, milk, sardines, and soft and hard drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 28 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a realizar viajes en su mototaxi desde hace 5 años, tiene muchos clientes que lo buscan por su responsabilidad a la hora de manejar, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, el esta solicitando un credito para darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi ya que es su fuente de trabajo y asi poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young man, whose face has been blurred in the photo, is 28, and lives in a high-risk area. For the last 5 years, he has been running a moto-taxi service, and has a lot of clients thanks to his responsibility behind the wheel.

The young man lives in his own house with his partner and child. He is asking for a loan to service the moto-taxi which provides his income, so that he can improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: A loan of $600 helps this borrower to service his moto-taxi.

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Massan est une femme âgée de 34 ans qui vit à Baguida. Mariée et mère de cinq enfants, Massan est une revendeuse de produits de liquidations qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend de quartier en quartier. Massan demande ce prêt pour commander des cartons de pommades médicalisées en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner des bénéfices afin de pouvoir répondre aux attentes de ses clients et aider son mari à prendre en charges les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Massan is 34 years old and lives in Baguida. She is married and the mother of five children. Massan resells clearance products that she buys once a month in the market. She resells in various neighborhoods.

Massan is asking for this loan in order to buy boxes of medical ointment. She'll resell these to increase her profits, meet the needs of her clients, and help her husband with the family expenses.

loans.use: buy four boxes of medical ointment.

loans.name: Damari Elizabeth

texts.es:
Damaris, de 32 años de edad, es una persona luchadora que desde pequeña creció trabajando en los cultivos de maíz y frijol y solo pudo estudiar hasta noveno grado, se acompañó y tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 3 van a la escuela y el último se queda en casa porque está muy pequeño y su pareja se dedica a trabajar en la albañilería. 

Damaris, de lunes a viernes se dedica a vender comida para los niños de la escuela de la comunidad, ya que todos los padres aportan dinero para que sea ella quien prepare los alimentos y los fines de semana viaja al pueblo para trabajar en puestos de comida, pues de su esfuerzo depende que sus hijos tengan mejores condiciones y es para eso que trabaja duro.

Damaris, necesita el préstamo para comprar medicinas para su esposo, porque está enfermo y no tiene dinero para poder cubrir las necesidades de su salud.

Sus sueños son, que sus hijos no dejen de asistir a la escuela y que culminen sus estudios universitarios, también sueña con hacer su casa más grande aunque sea de adobe.
texts.en:
Damaris is 32 years old. She is a fighter who has worked growing corn and beans since she was small. She could only study up to Grade 9. She is in a relationship and has four children, three of whom go to school. The youngest stays at home as he is still small and her partner works as a bricklayer.

From Monday to Friday Damaris works selling meals for the children in the community's school. All the parents contribute money so she can prepare the food. On weekends she travels to town to work in food stalls as her children having better living conditions depends on her efforts so she works hard.

Damaris needs the loan to buy medicine for her husband as he is sick and doesn't have the money to cover his health needs.

Her dreams are for her children to continue their schooling and complete university and she dreams of making her house bigger even if it is made of adobe.

loans.use: to buy medicine for her husband who is sick.

loans.name: Anselmo Anibal

texts.es:
Anselmo, de 35 años de edad, es un agricultor, se dedica a la agricultura y por motivos de tiempo solo estudio hasta segundo grado; actualmente está acompañado, su pareja se dedica a la elaboración de petates, esta actividad también les genera ingresos para los gastos de su casa y la de sus tres hijos. 

Anselmo, se dedica a la agricultura desde hace mucho tiempo, ya que esta labor es la principal fuente de ingresos para cubrir los gastos de su casa; pero aparte de eso también tiene una vaca y en estas labores se involucra toda su familia.

Anselmo, necesitando el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para el cultivo de maíz, así como también para pagar la mano de obra para el mantenimiento del cultivo.

Sus sueños son, comercializar granos básicos en grandes cantidades, para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y también sueña con comercializar ganado.
texts.en:
Anselmo is 35 years old. He is a farmer and he works the fields. He didn't have the chance to go to school, so he only finished second grade. He lives with his partner. She makes bedrolls and this activity also helps them earn some income to cover the household expenses and the needs for their three children.
Anselmo has been a farmer for a long time and this is the main activity that covers their home expenses; but he also owns a cow. The entire family is involved in these activities.
Anselmo needs a loan to buy farming supplies to grow corn, as well as to pay for manual labor to maintain the fields.
His dream is to one day be able to sell basic grains in bulk, improve his family's quality of life and he would also like to sell farm animals.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to grow corn, as well as to pay for manual labor to maintain the fields.

loans.name: Daphne

texts.en:
Daphne is 25 years old, she lives with her mother who is a subsistence farmer. Currently, she is finding it difficult to support herself and her mother. Daphne believes that becoming a Zoona agent and running her own business will turn her situation around. She would like to make a success of running a mobile money transfer business in Blantyre and eventually use the revenue generated to support her family.

Daphne has a diploma in rural community development and she would like to use this in conjunction with the business management exposure she will gain in order to uplift her community. She would like to be able to give back to her community by not only creating employment opportunities and thus helping others achieve peace of mind, but also to be a viable, trustworthy alternative in a country where banking is simply too expensive for most of the working class. This would not only save her community member’s time, but it would also lower their expenses as this would reduce the need to travel long distances in order to send and receive money.

One of her objectives is to take safe money transfer facilities to the community, and clients no longer having to spend on travel would make this a reality as well as improve the overall customer experience. She would like to increase her Zoona footprint in Malawi. With this loan, Daphne will be able to start running her own business by procuring a branded trolley and an internet enabled phone as well as use the funds to make the actual transactions so that she can start running her own business.
Daphne thanks the Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to procure a branded Zoona trolley and an internet enabled phone as well as the funds needed to make the actual transactions so that she can start running her own business.

loans.name: Amavi

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Amavi est une femme âgée de 42 ans qui vit à Baguida. Amavi est une revendeuse de pommades médicalisées et des savons qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Amavi sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des cartons de pommades médicalisées en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner des bénéfices afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients et aider son mari à couvrir certaines charges de la famille.
texts.en: Amavi is married with two children. She is 42 and lives in Baguida. Amavi sells medicated ointments and soap. She buys her stock once a month at the market, and sells her merchandise travelling through the neighbouring districts. Amavi requests this loan to buy cartons of medicated ointment so that she can make good sales and earn profits. She hopes to answer the expectations of her customers, and to help her husband cover certain family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 04 cartons of medicated ointment.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en: Munira is a kind and hardworking woman. She lives together with her family in a house which is located in the capital of Tajikistan. Munira during many years works in a state organization. Munira is very industrious woman and makes her job well. She is asking for a loan because she is ill and she must buy medicines. Munira is asking for a loan of 2500 Somoni to buy medicines for her treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Don Gerardo tiene su propia granja de pollos de engorde. Solicita un préstamo de un millón cincuenta mil colones (₡ 1 050 000), dinero que usará para la compra de pollos y alimentación para los mismos. De esta forma logrará aumentar el volumen de ventas de su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Gerardo has his own farm where he raises broiler chickens. He is requesting a loan of one million fifty thousand colones (1,050,000 CRC), money that he will use to buy chickens and feed for them. In this way he can manage to increase the volume of sales and improve his economic income.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.en:
Concepcion is 58 years old and married with seven children.  With two children in school, Concepcion works very hard to provide for them.

Concepcion has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Concepcion has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned good, noodles, sugar and other groceries. 

In the future Concepcion, would like to save enough money so she continue to send her children to school and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marilyn dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a fish vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs.

Flordeliza dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Murtala

texts.en:
Murtala is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Murtala is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Murtala would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Murtala will store the maize he harvests and delay it’s sale until a later date in the season when his can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000/Ha, Murtala now has the opportunity to actualize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members and would like to use this additional income to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Asma

texts.en:
Asma is 30 years old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is responsible mother of 3 children. Her husband is running his own medical clinic for the past 22 years.

Asma's husband wants to purchase different types of medicines for reselling purpose, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is not in position to buy these medicines. Therefore Asma has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. This loan will help her husband to purchase medicines and enable him to fulfill his business needs, so that her husband can earn profitable income. Her husband also plans to make savings with the income from his business to meet the uncertain events in future.
Asma is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy medicines for her husband's medical clinic.

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es: Marina de 61 años de edad de estado civil soltera vive con su hija y nietos  David de 11 años y Jefferson de 14 años ellos estudian en una escuela fiscal gratuita. Marina  comenzó hace 27 años atrás a vender comida en un pequeño puesto del mercado con mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y firmeza en el trabajo  ha podido llevar un plato de comida a su mesa. Ella necesita el dinero para poder comprar ollas y vajillas nuevas porque las que tiene están viejas, así mejoraría la presentación de la comida aumentaría sus ventas y por ende sus ingresos para poder cubrir los gastos básicos del hogar.
texts.en:
Marina, aged 61, is single and lives with her daughter and grandchildren. David, aged 11, and Jefferson, aged 14, are studying at a free school. Marina began selling food at a small market stall 27 years ago, and with a lot of effort, dedication and commitment has managed to contribute to her household.

She is requesting a loan to buy new pans and dishes, because the ones she has are old. She hopes to improve the presentation of her food in order to increase her sales and be able to earn more so that she can cover basic household expenses.

loans.use: to buy new pans and dishes.

loans.name: Eya

texts.fr: Eya est une femme divorcée âgée de 43 ans résidante à Baguida. Sans enfant, Eya est une revendeuse des tubercules d’ignames et des fruits qu’elle revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Eya s’approvisionne de ses marchandises deux fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des unités de tubercules d’ignames et des tas de bananes. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Eya compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens puis son épanouissement.
texts.en:
Eya is 43 years old, divorced, and has no children. She lives in Baguida. Eya resells yams and fruits by walking through neighboring areas. Eya buys her goods two times a month in the market.

She would like this loan to buy yams and a lot of bananas. With the profits she makes, she will improve her sales performance, meet her daily needs, and thrive.

loans.use: buy 40 yams.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 36-years-old married man from Rafah city. He lives with his wife and two kids in a simple house. Mohammad works as an employee in a local company where he gets a low income. This is the only source of income to the family. He would like to improve the family living conditions and buy some necessary items.

Mohammad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a water purification machine for the family house. By taking this loan, Mohammad will be able to provide clean water especially for his kids.
Mohammad appears in the photo

loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the family house.

loans.name: Xiprianecas Group

texts.en:
In a tranquil refuge amongst mountains with beautiful views of Lago Atitlán in Western Guatemala about an hour and a half from the city of Sololá, we find Xiprian, a hamlet just off of the main highway outside of the municipality of Santa Clara. The “Xiprianecas” trust bank, which has completed 3 credit cycles since it formed, is a group of 8 women, the oldest around 65 years of age and the youngest, just 24.

Simona, who is the treasurer of the group with 44 years of age, was able to study through 4th grade, and has a envisions success in her investment which will allow her to continue providing education to her 3 children, 2 who have graduated from secondary school, and a 15-year-old who is starting his degree in secondary school. Simona raises and sells animals, embroiders huipiles and fajas, traditional blouses and belts, and with the new loan she plans to buy 1 bull, 2 pigs and food to feed her animals.

Each of the women of this trust bank practices a distinct craft and trade, some running convenient stores or screen-printing shops, others weaving and embroidering traditional textiles or raising animals to sell in the market. Beginning their 3rd cycle with Friendship Bridge, and their first Kiva credit, they are excited to make investments in capital to have more products available for their clients, and see increased profit in their businesses.

Thank you Kiva and Friendship Bridge for the support!!

loans.use: to buy 1 bull, 2 pigs and food to feed her animals.

loans.name: Abadahemuka Group

texts.en:
Verena is 39 years old and is an orphan and she lives with four children between the ages of 8 and 19 and she lives with another three relatives. She runs a business of selling beans, sorghum and peanut. Verena is the president of ABADAHEMUKA group and she is the one in the photo who has paper in her hands. This is the fourth cycle in this group and the members are paying very well their loans.

She has been in this business for eighteen years and sells beans, sorghum and peanut. Other members sells different items like animals (cows,goats,chickens...),fruits to help them living in good condition and getting profits to grow up their businesses.

Verena has requested this loan through Vision Finance Company to purchase a large quantity of beans, sorghum and peanut for sale. Verena says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her family's status. She will be able to pay school fees for her children, to buy enough food for her children and buy medical insurance for her family. In the future, she will be able to buy four goats.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of beans, sorghum and peanut for sale.

loans.name: Maria Edilma

texts.es: Edilma  tiene 46 años, estado civil soltera madre de cuatro hijos vive con ellos y sus nietos Josting de 5 años, Pool  de 2 años, James de un año  y Maikel de 10 meses, trabaja desde las dos de la mañana todos los días en compañía de sus hijos  recogiendo  plástico, cartón chatarra  y todo el material reciclable antes de que pasen los recolectores de basura,  Edilma necesita el dinero para poder comprar cobre o papel blanco a bajo costo luego venderlo y ganar algo de dinero para cubrir los gastos de alimentación y alquiler de vivienda, sueña con tener una casa propia para dejarles a sus hijos porque vivir arrendando es muy cruel.
texts.en:
Edilma is 46 years old. She is a single mother of four children. She lives with them and her grandchildren, Josting, age 5, Pool, age 2, one-year-old James and 10-month-old Maikel. She starts working at 2 in the morning every day with her children, picking up plastic, cardboard, scrap metal and any other recyclable material before they are picked up by the garbage truck. 
Edilma needs funds to buy copper or white paper at low cost to resell and make some money to cover her rent and pay for food.
She dreams to have a home of her own that she can leave her children as renting is really tough.

loans.use: to buy white paper, copper and scap metal

loans.name: Fatima Guadalupe

texts.es:
Fatima, de 30 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera y  vive solo con su abuela.

Fatima, tiene cultivos de  guineo desde hace 5 años para vender, este negocio lo aprendió con su padre porque él tenía estos cultivos antes, pero a parte de eso ella también vende leche de vaca, las plantas de guineo están sembrados a 100 metros de su casa y su horario de trabajo es desde las 5:00 a.m. hasta la 1:00 p.m.

Fatima, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono para aplicarlo a una parte de los cultivos.

Su sueño es comprar otra vaca y que la venta de leche sea mayor para tener más ingresos, además espera formar una familia en el futuro.
texts.en:
Fatima is 30 years old. She attended high school, she is single and lives alone with her grandmother.
Fatima started growing bananas 5 years ago. She learned the business from her father, who grew plants before her. She also sells cow milk. The banana plants are located 100 meters from her home. She works from 5am to 1pm.
Fatima needs a loan to buy fertilizer to apply to a portion of her plants.
Her dream is to buy another cow to ingrease her earning from selling the milk. She also hopes to have her hown family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to use in a portion of her plants.

loans.name: Felix

texts.en:
Felix is a 50 year-old married father of three children who works hard to support his family. He is a teacher and his wife is housewife. Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to afford the cost of their son's education.

This loan of $ 1000 will allow Felix to help his son who will study at university. he will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies. In the future, Felix hopes that his children are all well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 27 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se gana la vida mediante la elaboración y venta de yuca salcochada y frita, pasteles, empanadas, etc. la venta la realiza en su casa de habitación desde hace 3 años y gracias a su carisma y la deliciosa yuca que vende, muchas personas la prefieren cada día más, la joven vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de yuca, aceite, platanos, maiz, verduras, entre otros ingredientes y asi poder seguir con sus ventas para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
This young woman's face has been blurred in the photo because she is 27 and lives in a high-risk area. She earns a living by making and selling boiled and fried yuca, cakes, pies, etc. She has been running her business from her home for 3 years, and, thanks to her charisma and her delicious yuca, she gains more clients every day.

The young woman lives in her own home with her partner and child, and is requesting a loan to buy yuca, oil, plantains, corn and vegetables, among other ingredients, so that she can continue her business and enjoy a better quality of life.

loans.use: A loan of $500 helps this borrower to buy yuca, oil, plantains, corn and vegetables, among other ingredients.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hilda is 34 years old and has five children who are in school.

Hilda has a fishing business in the Philippines. Hilda requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish nets, bamboo, and other supplies to use in her  business.

Hilda has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Hilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, bamboo, and other supplies to use in her  business

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa is maize farmer from Saddi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Musa is excited about the opportunity to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs . With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Musa would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Musa can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Musa is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to become a better farmer

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 48 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, Jocelyn works very hard to provide for them.

Jocelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell such as vinegar, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, snack foods, etc.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 25 years and sells a variety of items such as vinegar, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, snack foods, etc.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell such as vinegar, cooking oil, noodles, canned goods, snack foods, etc.

loans.name: Jean Richard

texts.fr:
42 ans, père d'un enfant scolarisé dans une école privée, Jean Richard est marié. Le couple exerce le même type d'activité source de revenu il y a déjà long temps, environ 20 ans. Il était auparavant agent de sécurité dans une entreprise privée. C'était un job un peu risqué alors que le salaire était très faible dit-il, c'est pourquoi, il décidait de se lancer dans le commerce.
Jean Richard est marchand d'arachides, il a des clients à qui il fait des ventes en demi-gros car ce sont des revendeurs. Le prêt va être utilisé pour acheter des arachides supplémentaires. Avec les bénéfices, il vise épargner davantage.
La famille a déjà sa propre maison mais envisage quand même d'en construire une autre un jour, à louer afin d'augmenter le revenu.
texts.en:
Jean Richard is a married, 42-year-old father of one child in school at a private school. For about 20 years, the couple has held the same kind of job. Previously, he was a security agent at a private company. He said it was a slightly risky job with a small salary, which was why he decided to go into business.

Jean Richard sells peanuts. He has customers who buy in wholesale and resell. The loan will be used to buy additional peanuts. With the profit, he hopes to be able to save more.

The family already has their own house however they hope to build another one someday in order to rent it out and increase their income.

loans.use: to buy peanuts.

loans.name: Jiza

texts.en:
Jiza is a married woman with six children. Jiza is 37 years old and five of her children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jiza has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Jiza requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shirts, underwear, pants, etc.

Jiza has been in this business for ten years. In the future, Jiza would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shirts, underwear, pants, etc.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Loreta has been in this business for 31 years. She earns more income from food vending.

Loreta is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Loreta has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. Her dream is to repair and renovate her family home in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Beulah

texts.en:
Beulah, 33 years old, is married and has two children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past seven years, Beulah has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Beulah has previously borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF. She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items such as canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, milk, etc. to sell. Beulah aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, milk, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Santa Del Carmen

texts.es:
Santa, de 36 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado porque sus padres no tenían los recursos económicos suficientes; es madre soltera de 2 niños, su esposo la abandono y solo ella ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos.

Santa, tiene mucha experiencia en la siembra de maíz y frijol, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre, a quien desde pequeña le ayudaba a realizar la siembra de estos cultivos.- Actualmente, tiene sembrados 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y 7,000 metros cuadrados  de frijol, de esta forma asegura parte de la alimentación para el próximo año y para llegar hasta sus cultivos camina 600 metros hasta los terrenos donde cultiva y continua criando ganado.

Santa, necesita el préstamo para comprar ganado de repasto.

Santa, sueña con que sus hijos puedan prepararse academicamente y brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Santa, 36 years old, studied until third grade because her parents did not have sufficient economic resources. She is a single mother of two kids. Her husband left her, and she alone has been able to raise her children.

Santa has a lot of experience in the sowing of corn and beans. She learned this occupation from her father, whom she has helped to sow these crops since she was little. Currently, she has 7,000 square meters of corn and 7,000 square meters of beans planted. In this way, she can assure part of her food for the next year, and to reach her crops, she walks 600 meters to the land where she cultivates her crops and continues to raise livestock.

Santa needs the loan to purchase grazing livestock.

Santa dreams that her children will be able to prepare themselves academically and wishes to afford them a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase grazing livestock.

loans.name: Yusuf

texts.en:
Yusuf is a Babban Gona farmer.  Yusuf is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. 

Traditionally, Yusuf would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan Yusuf can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Yusuf has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Yusuf is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to increase his farmland and looks forward to using his additional earnings to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Rumdol's Group

texts.en:
Rumdol’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province, Cambodia. Rumdol works as a factory laborer to support her family.

In the group's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Edouard

texts.fr:
Edouard est un brave père de famille de 35 ans. Il est mariée, et sa femme attend leur 3ème enfants en ce moment. L'ainé va à l'école et est en classe de 8ème, le second pas encore car il n'a que 2 ans. 
Il dirige un magasin de quincaillerie depuis l'an 2000 et il a une autre spécialité qu'est l'ouvrage métallique. Quand il a des commandes ou travaux à faire dans l'ouvrage métallique, c'est sa femme qui tient le magasin.Le couple se soutienne mutuellement dans l'exercice de leurs activités source de revenu afin de bien assurer le bien-être de leurs enfants. En plus, il rêve de construire sa propre maison et offrir une vie confortable à sa petite famille.
texts.en:
Edouard is an honest, 35-year-old family man. He is married, and his wife is currently expecting their third child. The oldest son goes to school and is in fourth grade. The younger son doesn't go to school yet, as he is only two years old.

Since 2000, he has been managing a hardware store and also specializes in metalworking. When he has orders or metalwork to do his wife runs the store. The couple supports one another in their businesses in order to ensure the well-being of their children.

In addition, he dreams of building his own house and providing a comfortable life for his little family.

loans.use: to buy flat, round, and corner irons, PVC pipes, curved PVC, etc...

loans.name: Tsagaantsooj

texts.en: Tsagaantsooj is 53 years old and lives with her husband in Erdenet, the third largest city of Mongolia. She has been working as a quality inspector at a carpet factory since 1982. Her husband works as an electrician at a power plant. Two of their daughters are married and live on their own. Their youngest daughter studies at the university in Ulaanbaatar (the capital city of Mongolia). She is requesting a loan of 2000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass and foam to be used for house renovation. By doing so her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate her house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Romeo

texts.en: Romeo is a hard-working man of 52 years. It is evident on his humble business which is producing firewood to sell. It was never an easy work but he obviously persevere since his firewood is piled so high it almost reach his rooftop. Aside from gathering firewood he also farms rice for additional income. He is asking a loan to buy fertilizer and finance the transportation expense during delivery of his firewood to customers. Romeo dreamed of living an abundant life out of his business. He has one adult daughter.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for transportation of firewood

loans.name: Lezelda

texts.en: Lezelda, 38 years old, has eight children, seven of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past four years, Lezelda has operated a business selling coconut wine in the Philippines. Lezelda has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell. In the future, Lezelda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more gallons of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Sirley Johana

texts.es: Sirley de 33  años, tiene un carisma e ímpetu envidiable  y afirma que difícilmente se deja  vencer por las circunstancias de la vida y  que sus tres hijos son su principal motivación. Ella vende mercancías de temporada, papelería, cosméticos, detalles para toda ocasión y ofrece el servicio de llamadas telefónicas, negocios con los que ha podido generar los ingresos que requiere para el sostenimiento de su hogar.  Su idea de negocio trascurrió en medio de la separación con su cónyuge y al ser madre soltera y no contar con una pareja que le apoye con los gastos, su responsabilidad y compromiso con el negocio es enorme, es por ello que se dedica 10 horas a atender su negocio. Sirley proyecta aprovechar la temporada de fin de año ofreciendo un mayor surtido de productos, por lo cual está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, recursos que planea invertir en la compra de ropa, calzado, juguetes y demás productos demandados por su clientela. Su sueño de prosperidad es ver crecer su negocio, generar mayores ingresos día a día y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sirley is thirty-three years old and has charisma and an enviable amount of energy. She says that she overcame situations in her life with difficulty and that her three children are her main motivation. She sells seasonal merchandise, stationary, cosmetics, and items for every occasion. She also offers a telephone calling service. These are the businesses that have generated the income she needs to sustain her home.

She didn’t deviate from her business ideas even during the middle of her separation with her spouse. Being a single mother, she can’t depend on someone to help with expenses. Her sense of responsibility and commitment to her business is enormous which is why she works ten hours a day.

Sirley plans to take advantage of the end of the season and offer a wider variety of products. That’s why she’s in the process of applying for her first Kiva loan with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. She plans to invest the funds in buying clothing, shoes, toys, and other products that her customers want.

Her dream of prosperity is growing her business, generating higher revenues every day, and providing a good education for her children.

loans.use: to invest in buying clothing, shoes, toys, and other things her customers want.

loans.name: Khin's Group

texts.en:
Khin’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province, Cambodia. Khin works as a farmer and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family.

In the group's village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Marline De Jesús

texts.es: Marline de 60 años es una microempresaria residente en un barrio popular de Barranquilla que emprendió su negocio por una revelación que Dios le hizo a su yerno, confiando en este designio inmediatamente se dirigieron a un almacén especializado a comprar materiales para que su yerno  con su experiencia en este arte iniciara la producción de bisutería. Además de sus propias creaciones, también se inspiraba en modelos de joyas que encontraba en revistas y catálogos, posteriormente Marline viajaba al municipio de Ciénaga y los comercializaba con excelentes resultados. Tiempo después Marline tuvo que dejar esta actividad porque su madre se enfermó y viajó a Bucaramanga para dedicarse cuidarla, durante su recuperación la estuvo acompañando por cuatro años. Regresó a Barranquilla y empezó a comercializar pasteles a tiendas y refresquerías, pero decidió dejar esta actividad y dedicarse a la venta de mercancías: ropa de cama, calzado, prendas de vestir y elaborar con sus nietos cargaderas de brasier.  Ella ofrece sus productos a conocidos y vecinos del barrio, brindándoles facilidad en sus pagos, pero como su capital no es tan amplio, ello aplicó a una solicitud de crédito, su primer credikiva financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para comprar mercancías; cubrelechos, tendidos, vestidos, calzado, entre otros encargos. Marline desea tener su casa propia y apoyar a sus nietos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Marline who is sixty years old is a small business owner who lives in a popular neighbourhood of Barranquilla. She started up her business following a revelation that God made to her son in law. Trusting in this divine plan they went immediately to a specialist shop to buy materials so that her son in law who had experience in the field could start producing costume jewelry. Besides his own creations, he took inspiration from jewelry designs in magazines and catalogs.

Subsequently Marline traveled to the municipality of Ciénaga and sold the items successfully.

Sometime later Marline had to stop this activity because her mother fell ill and so she went to Bucaramanga so she could devote herself to looking after her. She stayed with her for four years during her recovery.

She returned to Barranquilla and started to sell cakes to shops and cafes, however she decided to abandon this business and focus on selling merchandise: bed linen, footwear, clothing, and to make bra straps with her grandsons.
She sells her products to her friends and neighbors in the district , offering them payment terms , however as she does not have much capital she is applying for a loan. This is her first loan with Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to buy merchandise ; bed spreads, bed linen, clothing, foot wear among other things. Marline dreams of having her own home and to be able to support her grandsons education.

loans.use: to buy merchandise;  bed spreads, bed linen, clothing and foot wear among other things.

loans.name: In's Group

texts.en: In’s group lives in a rural village in the Kandal province of Cambodia. In makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer and construction worker to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses as well as saving time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family

loans.name: Thom's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thom, born in 1978, is the Kinh ethnic majority woman. She currently lives with her husband and her daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her husband’s civil servant salary, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family. She wants to repair her house and its sanitation work but she does not have enough money to to it. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have a spacious house with better living condition. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to repair her house and its sanitation work

loans.name: Juana

texts.en: Juana is married to a fisherman from Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. Fishing has been their source of income for ten years now. She works in a restaurant to help her husband and she also sell his catch. Juana is asking a loan to buy a new engine, Petromax pressurised paraffin lamp and paint. Juana is excited of the loan's impact to their business while she is raising six children and sending them to school.

loans.use: to buy a new boat engine, Petromax pressurised paraffin lamp and paint.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en: Clarita is a piggery owner from the municipality of Hernandez, Bohol. She is 59 years old and living with her husband who is a habal-habal driver. Clarita would like to maximize her time and make the most of her business. She is asking a loan to increase her piglets, stock sacks of feed and have supplements ready to keep them healthy. These are the purpose for her loan. She would like to have a good life as a result of her chosen business.

loans.use: to buy piglets, feed and supplements

loans.name: Above All 2 Gruop Group

texts.en:
A determined team of the Above all group from a small scale beginning in chorkor at the Greater Accra region of Ghana wishes to develop its business to attend to their customers requirement.

Mr Cyrill who is a leading member of the group, is very much grateful for the help of Kiva through ID-Ghana, for the organization's help. He is now able to provide for the family and his customers as he is a refrigeration mechanic and seller.

The group with it 4 members are dealing in the sale of refrigerator and oven parts, provisions, hair creams and wele (meat).

With the flexibility of repayment with loyalty, Cyrill been a responsible man with his wife and two children.

The group needs a loan sum of GHS 4800 to sustain and improve their businesses.

loans.use: to buy more refrigeration spare parts which he will use to repair his customers refrigerators.

loans.name: Josiah

texts.en: Josiah operates a shop of kitchen cutlery. He does agriculture, and is a teacher as well from where he gets supplementary income. He is mainly faced with a challenge of competition. He would love to add more up to date and quality cutlery for him to win more clients, and be able to perform better. Despite his zeal, Josiah meets a difficulty of limited capital to purchase the required stock at the moment. That's why he has resorted to requesting a loan to buy kitchen cutlery and other home products to sell.

loans.use: to buy kitchen cutlery and other home products to sell.

loans.name: Ana Maylen

texts.en:
Ana Maylen is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell, like soft drinks, milk, chips, bread, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling dry goods.

Ana Maylen dreams of one day being able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell, like soft drinks, milk, chips, bread, etc

loans.name: Madalo

texts.en:
Madalo resides in the city of Blantyre in Malawi, which is sometimes referred to as the commercial capital of Malawi. Sis looking to tap into the potential that Blantyre has and start running her own business.

At 23 years old, Madalo is the youngest in a family of six. She has a certificate in Human Resources and is passionate about business management. Her dream is to run her own business, but lack of capital is a huge obstacle in making this dream a reality. The biggest contributing factor to her wanting to run a successful business is the fact that she would like to use the funds generated to put her four younger sisters through school.

Currently, the economy in Malawi makes it difficult for young people to find gainful employment. This makes it difficult for Madalo to support herself and her family. She believes that becoming a Zoona agent and running her own business will turn her situation around.
Madalo would like to make a success of running a mobile money transfer business in Blantyre and eventually using the revenue generated to further her education and plough all that knowledge back into her business and her community. She loves working with people and she would like to use her business to create employment opportunities for others.

On a broader spectrum, Madalo would like to be able to give back to her community by not only creating employment opportunities but helping others achieve peace of mind. Madalo hopes that her business will be a viable, trustworthy alternative in a country where banking is simply too expensive for most of the ordinary people.

This would not only save her community member’s time, but it would also lower their expenses as this would reduce the need to travel long distances in order to send and receive money.
Zoona has done market research and in so doing have found that, with Blantyre being the second largest city in Malawi, the location in which Madalo is looking to open her outlet would be ideal not only for employment opportunities for that community, but also to generate the traction she envisions for her business.
Madalo thanks the Kiva lenders for their support in her endeavour.

loans.use: to procure a Zoona branded trolley and an internet enabled phone as well as the funds needed to make the actual transactions so that she can start running her own business.

loans.name: Muharam

texts.ru: Мухаррам очень благодарна на Вашу доброту. Мухарам очень рада, что у нее прекрасная семья. Ее муж добрый и честный мужчина. Он занимается торговой деятельности.  Мухарам живет в простом доме вместе с мужем и детьми. Она работает воспитательницей в детском садике. Она заботливая женщина с открытой душой. Мухарам копила денег для улучшения жилищных условий семью. Но у нее не хватает денежные средство для покупки домашних предметы (посуды для приготовления пиши, печь для выпечки лепешки и другие принадлежности). Из-за нехватки денег она запрашивает кредит. Мухарам надеется на поддержку с Вашей стороны.
texts.en:
Muharam is very thankful for your kindness.

Muharam is very happy for her beautiful family. Her husband is good and honest. He works with retail sales. Muharam lives in a simple house together with her husband and children. She works as a kindergarten teacher. She is a thoughtful and open-hearted woman.

Muharam ha saved money for improving the family's living conditions. However, she does not have enough money to purchase household items such as cookware, an oven for baking cakes and similar. Due to the lack of money she requests a loan. Muharam hopes for support from you.

loans.use: to purchase household items

loans.name: Rose Mae

texts.en:
Rose Mae, 26 years old, lives in Sinonoc, Sinacaban Mis. Occ. She got married at a young age and is blessed with two children. Rose Mae is a hardworking woman who was engaged in different businesses just to help her husband provide for the family's needs. Her husband is a private employee in a not-so-big company; as expected, he earns only a minimum salary.

Rose Mae plans to engage in another business – swine fattening. She started the business last year and, to her surprise, she got a profit of PHP 3,000 in two months. Unfortunately , the business did not expand due to lack of funds. Rose Mae heard an advertisement about GDMPC offering a microfinance loan. She went to GDMPC to borrow PHP 10,000 to buy piglets and feed. Her future plan, if God permits, is to have a piggery business run by her family.

loans.use: to buy piglets and feed for them.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
Santos con 51 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos, en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Santos se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café,variedad Catimor,con una experiencia en el rubro de 15 años,cuenta con fincas fruteras de café en buen estado,dichos cultivos se encuentran ubicados a unos metros de su domicilio. Así mismo se desempeña como peón agrícola en su caserío.Solicita préstamo para invertir en el negocio de abono y en el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café.Invirtiendo en su negocio podrá adquirir una utilidad aceptable para que de esta manera mejora su calidad de vida.

Santos es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, este es su tercer crédito.
texts.en:
Santos is 51 years old and is in a common-law relationship. He lives in his own house made of rustic material together with his spouse and two young children in the district of Pucará, Jaén province, in the department of Cajamarca, Peru. The inhabitants of this area work mainly in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.

Santos works in agriculture, specifically growing Catimore varietal coffee. He has 15 years of experience in the field. His coffee plantations are in good condition and his crops are located a few meters from his house. He also works as an agricultural laborer in his village. He is requesting a loan to invest in his business buying manure and maintaining his coffee crops to obtain an acceptable profit. In this way he can improve his quality of living.

Santos is a repeat client of Edpyme Alternativa, this being his third loan.

loans.use: to invest in his business with manure and the maintenance of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Bedi Woro Women's Group

texts.en:
Bedi Woro is a new group is located in the outskirts of Lira town.The group has a high form of solidarity to ensure that they develop each other as well as their community. Jacinta is single mother with 3 children two of which are school going age. She is a resident of Aboko village, Apac District 80km from Lira Municipality.

Jacinta a member of the group sells agricultural produce specifically ground nuts which business supports her family and pays school fees for her children. Due to the increasing demand of ground nuts in the area and financial education provided by Ugafode microfinance staff, she has applied for a loan of 600000 to boost her business. She will buy more stock of ground nuts.

The group members are grateful to Kiva funders and Ugafode microfinance for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy stock of ground nuts for sell.

loans.name: Violenda

texts.en:
Violenda is 47 years old and married with three children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional goods to sell.

Violenda has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from food vending. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Alona

texts.en:
Alona is married and works hard to support her family. She does business buying and selling ready-to-wear clothing in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

Alona has been in this business for 4 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.en:
Maria is a 40 year old woman and she raised her son along with her husband, until they saw him into a grown young adult, who is today studying at a local college, is their biggest achievement.

Maria's husband is the main economical support for the house. He drives a taxi, has been doing this for a long time, but he saw his family struggle in hard times, therefore Maria decided it was time to contribute as much as possible to the house total income.

She decided to start a clothes selling business, and she has been doing well. She has been contributing to the house income and is proud of her work, but lately she has been stuck with the sales because she doesn't have enough stock to offer. To get through this hard time she is applying for a $5000.00 MXN loan at Kiva, through Kubo financiero, which would allow her to buy more clothes to sell. She wants to buy jackets, hoodies and scarfs for the upcoming winter season.

loans.use: to restock her clothes business

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga has been involving in business activities since a few years ago, she started with her own working capital of $ 400.00.
