She has a kiosk in front of her house and she is taking the loan of $ 1000.00 from Tuba Rai Metin, she will use to buy additional supplies with the loan including detergents, sugar, milks, sardines, candle, tea, biscuits, hand body, aqua, candies, eggs, shampoo, ketchup, sauces and other things to sell. She is very happy when the Tuba Rai Metin offered the loan for her, because she can use this loan to improving her business.

loans.use: to buy detergents, sugar, milk, sardines, candle, tea, biscuits, hand body, aqua, candies, eggs, shampoo and other things to sell.

loans.name: Na Tau 22 Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sang is an ethnic Thai woman who is 28 years old and is married and the mother of two small children. She lives with her in-laws, her husband and her children in a traditional Thai house. They mainly rely on agricultural production for a living. They cultivate rice, corn, cassava, edible canna, and raise buffalo, pigs, chickens, and ducks. Mrs. Sang wants to support her family by expanding the animal breeding. She has recently taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program to buy goats. She hopes that her investment will bring good income to her family so that they can gradually improve their living conditions. Mrs. Sang dreams of a more abundant life for her family and a brighter future for her children. In the picture, she stands to the far right.

loans.use: to buy goats and expand the animal breeding.

loans.name: Norine

texts.fr:
Norine est mère, veuve de 39 ans. Elle a trois enfants dont l'ainé l'appui dans l'exercice de son activité, et les deux autres sont scolarisés. Le second (17 ans) est en 2ème année en sage-femme (PARAMED) tandis que le dernier (15 ans) est en classe de seconde en enseignement général.
Elle vend depuis long temps des pailles de fer. Ce sont des outils très nécessaires dans le pays car 90% de la population utilisent des charbons de bois pour la cuisson. Elle emploi trois jeunes gens à part son ainé pour faire de la vente ambulante partout dans le ville. 
C'est une femme courageuse, travailleuse et débrouillarde, son travail acharné c'est pour le bien-être de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Norine is a mother, a 39 year old widow. She has three children of whom the oldest helps her with her business, and the two others go to school. The second (17) is in her second year of studying to be a midwife (Paramed) and the last child (15) is in the second year of general studies.
She has been selling steel wool scouring pads for a long time. These kitchen tools are indispensable in a country where 90% of the population uses charcoal for cooking. She employs three young men as well as her oldest child to make itinerant sales in the town.
She is a plucky woman, hard-working and resourceful. Her tireless work is for the good of her children.

loans.use: to buy steel wool scouring pads, zex, sponges.

loans.name: Sunavhar

texts.ru:
Сунавхар 64 летняя дехканка района Джоми. Дехканку в таком возрасте мало встретишь. Сунавхар сильная женщина. Она более 30 лет занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Сунавхар больше времени проводит на земле. Она каждый год собирает богатый и здоровый урожай. Сунавхар хочет, чтобы жители района принимали здоровый и свежий урожай. Она любить зарабатывать честно нажитым трудом. 
У Сунавхар есть 30 и 25 летные сыновья.  Сыновья тоже занимаются сельскохозяйственной деятельности, в свободное время они помогает маме. Сунавхар готовится к обработке земельный участок. Он хочет обработать земельный участок с минеральными удобрениями. Минеральные удобрения поможет дать качественный и здоровый урожай. Сунавхару нужно денег для приобретения минеральных удобрений. По этой причине она обратилась за кредитом.
texts.en:
Sunavhar is a 64 years old farmer from the Jomi region. You seldom meet farmers of her age. Sunavhar is a strong woman. She has worked with field crop cultivation for more than 30 years. Se spends most of her time in the field.

Every year Sunavhar collects a rich and healthy harvest. She would like the residents of her region to get a healthy and fresh harvest. She loves to earn money through honest work. Sunavhar has two sons of 30 and 25 years. Her sons also work with farming. In their spare time they help their mother.

Sunavhar is preparing to process the land. She would like to use mineral fertilizers. They help give a healthy, good quality harvest. Sunavhar needs money to purchase mineral fertilizers. For this reason she applied for a loan.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Gulchehra

texts.ru: Гулчхера 44 летняя жительница района Хуросон. Она замужем и мать четверых детей. Ее муж занимается мастером по ремонту домов. У нее не большая семья. Гулчехра имеет большой двор. Она выращивает скота. Гулчехра 18 лет выращивает домашних животных. Она покупает скота и выращивает их несколько месяцев, потом продает на скотном рынке. Ей в этом помогает ее дети. Гулчехра хочет приобрести себе еще полу голов коров и увеличить их численность. Для покупки скота у нее нет такая сумма денег. Ваша помощь поможет ей приобрести скота.
texts.en:
Gulchera is a 44 years old resident of the Khuroson region. She is married and the mother of four children. Her husband works as a master builder. The family is small.

Gulchehra has a large yard. She breeds cattle. She has bred household animals for 18 years. She purchases livestock and breeds them for a few months, and then she sells them at the livestock market. Her children help her with this.

Gulchehra would like to purchase some more cows and increase the size of her herd. She does not have enough money for this purchase. Your support will help her purchase livestock.

loans.use: to purchase livestock and increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Concolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like recycled materials and tricycle passenger businesses.

Consolacion dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 39 years old and married with five children, four of whom in school, Liza works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc..

Liza has been in this business for 6 years.

In the future Liza would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Afrime

texts.en:
Afrime wants to thank all of the lenders for supporting her to add an annex to her home. She has now extra space and comfort needed area for school study for her children. Afrime has started to work together with her husband by performing music during wedding celebrations and other events. Usually the summer months are their busiest times and they have to save money then for the winters when they have don't have as much business. Afrime is fortunate that her family's business does well and is very well known in their area, receiving many requests for their performances.

Now, Afrime is requesting a loan in order to purchase new musical equipment. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve their performances and increase their client base. She appreciates the help from the lenders to improve her family's lives.

loans.use: to purchase new musical equipment for her and her husband to perform at weddings.

loans.name: Bardhe

texts.en:
Bardhe or 'white' in English is a villager and a widowed mother of three, 11, 13 and 16 and they live in the rural north. "My husband died ten years ago when our kids were very small and I was struggling in all ways. I started a rural activity to raise the kids and life became so very tough on me..." said Bardhe to the branch assistant.

Currently, Bardhe has two dairy cows and sells two calves a year in addition to 9 liters of raw milk a day for a total monthly earning of $120 for about nine months a year. She also has two sows that she is intending to sell in December of this year. In the two dynym agricultural land that her family owns, she has planted nectarine orchards and by selling the fruits she makes roughly $325/season. All of her kids receive a compensation in a total of $70/month and Bardhe receives a disability in an amount of $80/month. "My kids are young and schooling is expensive. Books, clothing and other items. However, they are doing good and they want to continue the studies in university and I have to make sure to put some money aside for their education," continued Bardhe the conversation.

She would like to buy a television as they live in a very rural area with little exposure to the outside world.

loans.use: this widowed mother of three wants to buy a TV, so that her kids connect to the outside world since they live in a rural area

loans.name: Soklim's Group

texts.en:
Soklim, 31 years old, lives in Cheung Prey district, Kampong Cham province. She has two dependent children, one of whom is in school while the other is too young to attend school. Soklim has been growing rice for three years. Moreover, she has worked at a garment factory to complement her family’s needs. Soklim's crop has been destroyed by insects.

This is Soklim’s first loan with VisionFund to support her business. As group leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and rice seed to grow her crop, which is expected to produce good outputs. She hopes to earn more income so that she can send her child to school and be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and rice seed to grow her crop, which is expected to produce good outputs so that she could earn more income to spend on her children's studies.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Surajo

texts.en:
Surajo is maize farmer from Saddi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Surajo is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Surajo would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Surajo can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Surajo is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to purchase a motorbike and do business with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Rany's Group

texts.en:
Rany’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Rany makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a tailor to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for the family.

loans.name: Thuy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuy, is a Kinh ethnic majority woman, has been joining in the program of M7 Microfinance Institution Limited (M7-MFI) since January 2013. She currently lives with her husband and her two daughters in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from the civil servant salary of her and her husband, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and saved a small amount. She wants to repair her house because it is not safe to live but she does not have enough money to buy materials and pay for the builder. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family have good condition to repair their house to make it more spacious and clean. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay for the builder

loans.name: Ravaosolo

texts.fr:
Ravaosolo est une femme travailleuse et dynamique de 44 ans. Elle est avant tout agriculteur, elle l'est depuis son enfance et son mari aussi. Le couple exploite ensemble l'activité agricole depuis leur union. Mais pour améliorer le revenu familial, elle décidait (avec son mari évidemment) de se lancer dans d'autre secteur d'activité. Elle choisissait le commerce, elle démarrait un magasin général avec très peu de marchandises en 2002. Et le commerce s'est développé petit à petit depuis. Son souhait est de pouvoir continuer à développer encore plus et que ceci deviendra un très "grand magasin".
Elle est mère de quatre enfants, âgés de 11 à 22 ans. L'ainée est déjà mariée; le second 19 ans, suit une formation professionnelle en mécanique auto. L'avant dernier (17 ans) ne va plus à l'école et l'appui dans l'exercice de son activité et le dernier est en classe de 6ème.
texts.en:
Ravaosolo is a hard-working and energetic woman of 44. She is above all a farmer, she has been in this profession since her childhood, and this is also the case for her husband. They have been running their agricultural exploitation together since they married. However, to improve the family income, she has decided (in accordance with her husband of course), to start up another sector of activity. She has chosen commerce; she started up a grocery store with very little merchandise in 2002. The business has developed little by little since then. Her wish is to continue to develop the business until it becomes a very “big shop”.
She has four children, aged from 11 to 22 years old. The oldest is already married; the second is 19, and is training to become a car mechanic. The second to last (17) does not attend school any more and helps her with her business and the last is in the sixth year.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise: rice, flour, sugar, oil, salt, soap, candles, diapers etc...

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is a 36-year-old woman who makes furnitures with her carpenter husband. They live in Valencia, Bohol. Aside from this business, she also raise hogs for an income. She is asking a loan to buy hardwood from molave tree and feed to keep her hogs healthy. Evelyn is inspired to work hard and keep on improving in order to give their five school-aged children a good life. In the future, she hope to make her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy hardwood from the molave tree and feed for her pigs

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.en:
Raymundo is a 32-year-old single man. He owns a barn that house pigs as his source of income. He also engages in selling cooked food like sauteed vegetables and noodles as a supplementary income. He has been in his business for six years and yet he still wants continuous improvement.

To make his goal possible, he is asking a loan to buy feed, more piglets and vegetables. He hopes that his loan will make a difference in his business in terms of sustainability and profitability. His income will be for savings and in helping his parents meet their daily household expenses.

loans.use: to buy feed, piglets and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Agustinho

texts.en:
Agustinho is a 27-year-old, married father of two children who works hard to support his family. He is working in hospital and his wife is housewife. Although the family works very hard, it is not enough for them to support the cost of their cousin's education.

This loan of $800 USD will allow Agustinho to help his cousin to register in University. He will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies. In the future, Agustinho hopes that his children are all well educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Kosal's Group

texts.en:
Kosal, 32, is a farmer who resides in a bedroom house located in Tbaung Khmum province. He has a daughter who is in school. His primary income sources for a year have been growing cassava and rice. His cassava did not grow well because of weeds, so he earned a very low income to support his whole family.

This is the first loan for both members of this group. As group leader, Kosal is willing to spend his entire portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticide and to pay for labor fees to increase the productivity of his crop yield. He hopes that his first loan will help him to get more yields to earn more income so he has the ability to renovate his old house to improve his family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to increase the productivity of his crop yield and his income to save for future needs.

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong, 51 years old, is from Banteay Chmar, a village in the northwest of Cambodia. She lives in a wooden house with her husband (who is also a weaver) and her son, who is still studying. Her three other children are already working and/or married. Kong's family owns 1.5 hectares of cassava field.

In 2001, Kong was trained by Soieries du Mékong, a social enterprise which fights against rural exodus and for the empowerment of women by training them and offering them sustainable work in the village. Kong makes scarves, which are sold in Cambodia and Europe. She uses her weaving income to pay for the family expenses, to buy diesel and fertilizer for the field and to extend her lending business.

Thanks to the loan, Kong will buy silk and pay for dyeing and preparation of the loom. Please support her so she can keep making beautiful, traditional hand-woven scarves!

loans.use: to buy silk and to pay for loom preparation related fees.

loans.name: Noel

texts.en:
Noel, 44 years of age, operates a machine shop, providing repair services for motorcycle parts, washing machines and other household appliances. He lives in his own home with his two children, 15 and 2 years. Noel has been engaged in his motorcycle repair shop business for a long time. His customers are mostly locals in his area.

Noel has successfully repaid his previous loan, and he is now requesting a new loan to further rebuild his business. He needs capital to purchase equipment that is useful in the operation of his livelihood. Noel is asking for a loan to purchase a water pump, which would provide ease in his daily livelihood routine.

Noel is doing his best to continue improving the quality of life he must provide for his family. In that way, his income will augment and enable him to pay his obligation.

loans.use: to purchase a water pump.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El Señor Carlos tiene 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, tiene casa propia y vive en la comunidad de Trojes al oriente de Honduras, su actividad principal es la caficultura.
Don Carlos se dedica a esta actividad desde hace 10 años y cuenta con muy buena experiencia en su negocio,  actualmente cuenta con   tierras para  el cultivo de  café 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes para su finca,  y así obtener una mejor producción y poder seguir teniendo los ingresos para seguir mejorando su calidad de vida.

su sueño es poder mejorar su casa.

Trojes, Honduras - Septiembre 2015.
texts.en:
Carlos is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two children. He has his own house and lives in the community of Trojes in the west of Honduras. His main job is growing coffee.

Carlos has been doing this job for 10 years and has good experience with his business. Currently, he has land to grow coffee.

He's seeking a loan to buy fertilizers for his farm and thus produce more, continuing to earn income to improve his quality of life. His dream is to be able to improve his house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his business.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José con 37 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive en casa propia de material rustico, junto a su cónyuge y sus cuatro menores hijos en el distrito de Callayuc,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.

José se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café ,variedad Catimor,con experiencia en el rubro hace 35 años. Adicionalmente se dedicada al cultivo de caña, destilación de aguardiente, a criar y comercializar ganado vacuno. Solicita préstamo para deshierbos y compra de fertilizantes.De esta manera incrementará sus rendimientos y podrá mejorar sus ingresos.

José es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Jose is thirty-seven years old, is married, and lives in his own home made with rustic materials. He lives with his spouse and their four small children in Callayuc District, Cutervo Province, in Cajamarca Department, Peru.

Jose works in agriculture, specifically in growing the catimor variety of coffee. He has thirty-five years of experience in the field. Additionally, he works growing sugarcane, distilling alcohol, and raising and selling cattle.

He’s asking for the loan for weed killers and to buy fertilizers. In this way, he will increase his yield and will be able to improve his income.

Jose is a recurrent Edpyme Alternative member.

loans.use: to buy weed killers and fertilizers

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en: Epifania, 51 years old, is married and has four children to provide for. She and her husband are engaged in a fishing business, which helps her family in their daily needs. Epifania aims to increase her income because of the increasing prices of commodities. She decided to borrow a loan to pay the labor cost for fishing boat repairs so that they can continue their fishing activities to get more fish and generate more income. Epifania's plan for the future is to buy an additional fishing boat to expand her business.

loans.use: to  pay the labor cost for fishing boat repairs.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Marcos

texts.en: Marcos is a 39-year-old married father of four children who works hard to support his family. He is a police officer. Even though the family works very hard, it is not enough for them to afford the cost of Marcos' education. This loan of $1,000 will allow Marcos to continue his university studies. He will use the loan to pay for registration and materials. He hopes that further education will help him to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for registration and materials at university.

loans.name: Jempiring Group

texts.en:
The Jempiring group made their payment. The meeting was attended by all members. During the meeting, they shared their experiences. They can manage the pigs well because they give them nutritious feed and vitamins. The FO controlling the pigs every month, they also make voluntary savings and give it to the FO to keep at MUK. Ni Wayan, as the head, resigned from the group because she had to move to another city to work. She was replaced by a new head, Gusti Ayu.

Gusti Ayu is a widow with one child. Her child works at the city. Gusti Ayu was one of the members of Jempiring group. With the last loan, she had a satisfactory result. Her pigs grew healthy and big. She sold them all to a big buyer. Now she has enough money to renovate her kitchen. She said many thanks to MUK, Kiva and lenders for supporting her business. She plans to take another loan to increase her business.

To increase the population of pigs, the Jempiring group has decided to have another loan from MUK. This loan will be used to buy superior or local piglets, feed and also to renovate the cage. Gusti Ayu will use her loan to purchase only feed. She already has a pregnant sow. She will keep the piglets for six months until they reach the maximum weight. Now the price for 1kg of pig is between 15,000 IDR and 18,000 IDR depending on the quality of the meat.

Gusti Ayu hopes this period she will earn enough profits. This time she will save all the profits. One member also decided to resign because of several reasons and she was replaced by a new member.

loans.use: to purchase only feed.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en: Farmers are the most hard-working people having to endure the bone-breaking work under the heat of the sun. Arsenia is just one of the women who is relying on this to earn a living. She is 65 years old from Duero, Bohol. She grows both vegetables and ornamental plants. She plants pechay (bokchoy) sweet potatoes, spring onion, daisies and anthuriums. Arsenia is asking a loan to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her garden. Arsenia's goal is to make the most of her business so she can enjoy life. She is 65 years old.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She earns a living by pig fattening in the Philippines. and is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy feeds, food vending and other supplies to raise her pigs.

She supplements this income with earnings from her fishing and buy and sell ready to wear.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mary Grace dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, food vending and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is a Babban Gona farmer.  Saidu is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday. Traditionally, Saidu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs.

 With this loan Saidu can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Saidu has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2000/ha. 

Saidu is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to provide healthcare for his family and children and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa deals in produce buying and selling alongside farming of maize to get additional income. He is doing well in business, and hopes to expand it in future by owning a fully stocked produce store that does not run out of stock through out the year. He would love to add maize and beans in his produce business. Them being on season the fact that they sell like hot cake. However he lacks some money to meet his full budget. Mustafa thus seeks for a credit facility to enable him buy maize and beans for selling

loans.use: to buy maize and beans for selling.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.en: Luisa has build her house a few years ago, with his own working capital, and until now her house has been completed, and now she has plan to paint and to put ceramics for her house. But her  money is not enough to buy more materials. So now she is requesting a loan of $ 1,000.00 from the Tuba Rai Metin to add with her capital and than with her husband, they will use this loan to buy materials like paint, brushes, rollers, ceramic, cement sand. Luisa is happy, because Tuba Rai Metin can help her to make her house complete.

loans.use: to buy paint, brushes, rollers, ceramic, cement sand.

loans.name: Chamnan

texts.en:
Chamnan is 25 years old and single. He is a security guard at a financial institution in the city. He is from Prey Veng Province of Cambodia. Chamnan has worked as a security guard since 2015, making an income of $4.83 each day.

He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in Finance and Banking at a university in the city. Chamnan is requesting a loan because he needs finances to pay his first-year tuition fees. The loan will help him to get through the first year at university successfully. After graduation, he is going to find a better job with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay his first-year university tuition fees in Banking and Finance

loans.name: Loan

texts.en:
Mrs Loan is 26 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising poultry for 3 years. Loan lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. And the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to comfort her life.


One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

This is Loan first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan could make her little dream come true.
In the future, Loan hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities such as coffee, eggs, cooking oil, sugar, noodles, shampoo, toothpaste, fabric conditioner, and a variety of canned goods.

She is a 43-year-old married woman with five children. Her oldest is 22 and the youngest is 9. Her husband is a carpenter. Her income mainly goes for food and school expenses.

She is asking for a loan to buy assorted stock for the store like beverages, toiletries, and assorted dry goods. With these, she can maintain her inventory and also attract potential customers to her shop.

She wants to improve her quality of life, and she is doing her best to provide for the needs of her family. Her children are her greatest joy and she wants all of them to finish their studies. Alma is determined to become more productive in order to improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy assorted stock for the store like beverages, toiletries, and assorted dry goods.

loans.name: Alena

texts.en:
Alena is already 44 years old, and she lives in Poblacion, Sinacaban Mis. Occ. She got married and is blessed with three children. She is a hardworking woman. She wants her children to continue to go to school, and that’s why she is looking for an extra income. The last four years she has been swine fattening and to her surprise she got a profit of 3,000 in two months.

For this, she wishes to continue what she started. She went to GDMPC to borrow an amount of PHP 20,000 that will be used to buy piglets and feed (food for the piglets). She plans to buy more piglets in order to earn more and save little by little from a portion of her income for the future education of her children.

loans.use: to buy more piglets and food for the pigs.

loans.name: Urbano

texts.es:
Urbano con 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge y sus dos menores hijos, en le distrito de Pucará,provincia de Jaén,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.Urbano cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio.

Urbano se dedica al cultivo de café, cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en este rubro. Solicita préstamo para la compra de abonos y fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo de café. De esta manera espera ofrecer un café de mejor calidad. Así mismo mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Urbano es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa. Canceló un crédito de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Urbano, 37, is partnered and lives with his spouse and their two minor children in the Pucará district, Jaén province, Cajamarca department in Peru.

Urbano has very good personal and work references from residents of the region. The locals in this area mostly earn a living in agriculture, raising livestock and commerce.

Urbano earns a living growing coffee and has 10 years of work experience. He's seeking a loan to buy compost and fertilizers to care for his crop. In this way, he hopes to offer better-quality coffee. Also, he will improve his and his family's quality of life.

Urbano is a reactivated member of Edpyme Alternativa. He cancelled a loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilizers to maintain his coffee crop.

loans.name: Maria Del Pilar

texts.es:
María, de 68 años de edad, no pudo asistir a la escuela porque sus padres eran demasiado pobres y ella tenía que ayudarles en los cultivos de maíz y frijol; actualmente está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a la agricultura y juntos tuvieron 6 hijos, todos son mayores de edad y están acompañados, solo vive con su esposo y sus nietos.

María, se dedica a la agricultura y a la ganadería desde pequeño y fue con sus padres que aprendió a cultivar granos básicos, las parcelas donde van a dejar las vacas y a sembrar están a 2 kilómetros y le ayudan sus hijos y sus nietos a cultivar y cuidar las vacas. 

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar un par de novillas de repasto, para que puedan procrear más ganado y generar ganancias.

María, sueña con poder tener varios vacas y poder ayudar a sus nietos para que puedan estudiar y superarse.
texts.en:
María, 68 years of age, was not able to attend school because her parents were too poor and she had to help them cultivate corn and beans. Presently she has a partner who works in agriculture, and together they had 6 children. All are grown up and have partners. María lives only with her husband and their grandchildren.

Since she was little, María has worked in agriculture and livestock farming, and it was with her parents that she learned to cultivate basic staple crops. The plots of land where she will leave the cows and plant crops are 2 kilometers away, and her children and grandchildren help her cultivate crops and care for the cows.

María needs the loan to purchase a pair of grazing heifers, so they can breed more cattle and generate income.

María dreams of having various cows and being able to help her grandchildren so they can study and better themselves.

loans.use: to buy a pair of grazing heifers.

loans.name: Edita Emelda

texts.es:
Edita, de 57 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, por motivos de escasos recursos económicos no pudo seguir estudiando, está acompañada y su pareja es comerciante.

Edita, trabaja en una casa como empleada doméstica desde hace 8 años y este trabajo lo aprendió en su casa con su madre; pero aparte de eso también tiene venta de curtidos y vinagres, su esposo le ayuda en el negocio y su horario de trabajo es desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m.

Edita, necesita el préstamo para comprar más mercadería como especias y vinagres para seguir preparando curtido y vinagre para vender y mejorar su situación económica.

Edita, sueña con que su negocio sea más productivo y que poco a poco vaya creciendo.
texts.en:
Edita, fifty-seven years old, was in school until the sixth grade. Because of a lack of economic resources, she wasn’t able to continue studying. She’s married, and her spouse is a merchant.

Edita has worked in a house as a housemaid for eight years, a job that she learned from her mother in her home. But apart from that, she also sells curtidos (El Salvadorian pickled cabbage) and vinegars. Her spouse helps her in the business, and she works from 7 A.M. to 5 P.M.

Edita needs the loan to buy more merchandise like spices and vinegars to continue making curtido and vinegar to sell and improve her economic situation.

Edita dreams of making her business more productive and growing it little by little.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise like spices and vinegars to continue making curtido (El Salvadorian pickled cabbage) and vinegar to sell and improve her economic situation.

loans.name: Haxhere

texts.en:
Haxhere is the mother of three children between the ages of 11 and 22 years old. Her husband works in construction and she is involved in agriculture, planting wheat and corn in order to sell.
Their 11 year old daughter had a high temperature and now seems to have a lot of delays and problems in her development and significant health problems. They have spent a lot of money at different hospitals and want to see their daughter better, so they work hard to be able to save money.

Haxhere is in need of a loan in order to purchase a machine to work on their land. This investment will make it easier and quicker for them to work, increasing their income and also allow them to work on the land of others for a fee. They are hopeful that this will be able to bring them money they need to find their daughter appropriate treatment and help her to improve. She promises to pay on time.

loans.use: to purchase a machine to work her land, to increase income to help her sick daughter

loans.name: Kaem's Group

texts.en:
Kaem’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Kaem makes a living cultivating rice and he also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support his family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women and man to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as save time by not needing to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Heidi Yohana

texts.es:
Heidi, de 21 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera y vive con su madre y sus hermanos.

Heidi, trabaja como cajera en una tienda desde hace un año y medio, en donde ha tenido la oportunidad de ver el proceso de venta y aprender de eso, ella viaja todos los días en bus y recorre una distancia de 20 kilómetros para llegar a su trabajo y su horario es de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar arroz, azúcar, pan, café, entre otros productos para colocar su propia tienda. 

El sueño de Heidi, es seguir estudiando en la universidad y ayudar a su familia para que tengan una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Heidi, 21, studied until high school. She's single and lives with her mother and siblings.

For a year and a half, Heidi has worked as a cashier in a store, where she's had the opportunity to see and learn about the sales process. She travels every day on the bus and covers a distance of 20 kilometers to get to work. Her schedule is from 7 a.m. to 4 p.m.

She needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, bread and coffee, among other products, to stock her own shop. Heidi's dream is to continue her studies at university and help her family so they have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bread and coffee, among other products, to stock her own shop.

loans.name: Agustinho

texts.en: Agustinho is a 47-year-old married father of four children who works hard to support his family. He works in a hospital as a chef. Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for him to afford the cost of his daughter's education. This loan of USD 1,000 will allow Agustinho to help his daughter continue her studies at the university. He will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies. In the future, Agustinho hopes that his children will be all well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Sokla's Group

texts.en:
Sokla’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Sokla makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as save time by not having to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
Pov’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Pov makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as factory laborer and construction worker to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these woman and men to safeguard the health of their families and save money on medical expenses, as well as save time by not needing to collect fuel and boil water.

loans.use: To buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

loans.name: Gelasia

texts.en:
Gelasia hails from the town of Panglao, Bohol. She owns a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, soap, shampoo, cooking oil, insect repellent and assorted canned goods. She is a married woman with twelve grown children. She was tired of doing nothing, so she is managing the store and seeking ways to become successful. Her store is situated near her home and serves mostly neighbors and nearby residents.

Gelasia decided to use the loan to fill her store with a variety of items. She wants to buy supplies for the store such as grocery items, soft drinks and liquor. With these, she can serve her customers well and be able to meet the high demands.

Gelasia's previous loan has been successfully repaid, and now she is requesting another loan to invest in goods to sell, for which she is grateful.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her store such as grocery items, soft drinks and liquor.

loans.name: Severino Simon

texts.es:
Severino con 52 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Severino se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero,con una experiencia en el rubro de más de 10 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de ganado lechero.De esta manera le facilitará seguir trabajando y obtener sus propios ingresos.

Severino si cuenta con experiencia crediticia, es socio reactivado para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Severino is fifty-two years old, is married, and lives with his spouse in Zaña District, Chiclayo Province, in Cajamarca Department, Peru. The majority of people living there work in agriculture, trade, and livestock.

Severino works raising dairy cows and has more than ten years of experience in the field. He’s asking for a loan to buy dairy cows. This way, he will be able to continue working and earning his own income.

Severino does have credit experience. He’s a re-activated Edpyme Alternative member.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen is a married man. He has 5 children. He describes himself as determined. He operates a retail business where he sells auto spare parts. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Stephen now wants to start a poultry business. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy poultry for rearing. He hopes that in the future he will have increased income. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy poultry for rearing

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.en:
Feliciana is a married woman. She is 60 years old and her husband is a retired family driver. They have four children. In order to provide for the needs of her family, she needs to strive hard. She buys and sells dried fish and processes meat. She found that the income she earned from the business is not enough for their daily needs. So she bought a motorcycle to be used in a transportation service to the community. From this business she earns a monthly income of PHP 5,000. The returns from the motorcycle help her a lot. They help her to continue sending her children to school and can provide food on the table.

Two years have passed and the motorcycle needs to be repaired. She went to GDMPC to borrow money for the maintenance of her motorcycle, and the rest of the proceeds will be used to pay the balance of the tuition fee for one of her children. Feliciana’s future plan is to have a new motorcycle to be used for business.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her motorcycle and to pay the tuition fee for her child.

loans.name: Senia Guadalupe

texts.es:
Senia, de 25 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera y no tiene hijos, vive junto a su madre y un hermano.

Senia, trabaja como mesera en un restaurante desde hace dos años, sus turnos de trabajo son de 10:00 a.m. a 9:00 p.m. y labora cinco días a la semana, para llegar a su lugar de trabaja tiene que recorrer 10 kilómetros desde su casa en bus y es de este trabajo que dependen todos sus ingresos, para salir adelante junto con su familia.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar arroz, azúcar, pan, café, entre otros productos para colocar una pequeña tienda en su casa.

El sueño de Senia, es tener un negocio de venta de ropa y tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Senia, 25, studied until high school. She's single, doesn't have children, and lives with her mother and one brother.

For two years, Senia has worked as a waitress in a restaurant. Her shifts are from 10 a.m. to 9 p.m. and she works five days a week. To get to work, she has to travel 10 kilometers from her house on the bus. To get ahead together with her family, all of her income depends on this job.

She needs the loan to buy rice, sugar, bread and coffee, among other products, to stock a small store in her home. Senia's dream is to have a business selling clothing and to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, bread and coffee, among other products, to stock a small store in her home.

loans.name: María Del Carmen

texts.es: María es una ama de casa de 28 años, madre de dos hijos menores de edad que decidió emprender en compañía de su comadre su propio negocio en el año 2013, ellas iniciaron con la comercialización de minutos a todos los operadores de celular y con el trascurrir del tiempo, decidieron independizarse.  En la actualidad María desde su vivienda amplió su oferta de productos y servicios; recargas y minutos a todos los operadores,  y venta de cervezas, los cuales comercializa entre personas del sector donde reside al sur de Barranquilla.  Para aprovechar la temporada de fin de año ofreciendo un mayor surtido de productos, está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en canastas de cervezas y planes de celulares. La meta de negocio de María es comercializar nuevos productos y en lo personal adquirir su casa.
texts.en:
Maria is a 28-year-old housewife and the mother of two minor children. Together with her godmother, she decided to launch her own business in 2013. They began selling minutes for all the cell phone operators. With the passage of time, they decided to become independent.

Currently, Maria has expanded her offering of products and services from her home - recharges and minutes for all operators, and the sale of beer, which she sells to the people in the area to the south of Barranquilla where she lives.

To take advantage of the end of the year by offering a better stock of products, she's taking out her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest in crates of beer and cellular plans. The goal of Maria's business is to sell new products and acquire her house.

loans.use: to invest in crates of beer and cellular plans.

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en: Him’s group live in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Him makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these people to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Him's Group

texts.en: Him’s group lives in a rural village in Kandal province in Cambodia. Him makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a factory laborer to support her family. In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, to save money on medical expenses, and to save time collecting fuel and boiling water.

loans.use: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

loans.name: Farzana

texts.en:
Farzana is a 36-year-old woman, residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her brother is an electrician and he has been running his electric store for past 13 years. He is responsible to feed his entire family and fulfill their needs. He has to purchase electric merchandise e.g wires, tube lights, plug shoes, and other electric devices, but due to insufficient financial means he cannot afford to purchase these items for business purpose.

Therefore Farzana has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan, so that she can help her brother to purchase this merchandise as per his business needs. This loan will also help her brother to increase the size of his business and earn maximum profits. Farzana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy electrician parts for her brother to increase his business.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma has multiple businesses. She is operating a Sari-sari store, raise hogs, offers manicure and pedicure services and also invest in farming rice. These businesses she managed to juggle with the help of her husband and three children ages 15, 17 and 20. With the challenges that comes with having these businesses, Alma is requesting a loan to maintain it. She will use her loan to buy feed, fertilizer, toiletries, seasoning and canned food. Eventually, she wish that all her business will do well so she can uplift the living condition of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, fertilizer, toiletries, seasoning and canned food

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: For eleven years now Arlene of Duero, Bohol has been engaged in vegetable gardening for an income. Aside from earning from her harvest, she can also be assured of food for her family from her farm. She is asking a loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides so her pechay (bokchoy) will not be infested with insects and worms. Her profit will then be used to buy for the family and pay for the schooling of her five-year-old child.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Vision Group Rubaga

texts.en:
Adolf is a 32 years old member of the Vision group rubaga. Adolf looks after his brothers and sisters in his village. Adolf is a boda boda cyclist in Kampala and he has a small retail shop that he has just started six months because he has plans of leaving his job of being a boda boda cyclist, since he can no longer ride his motor cycle as he used to do because of not feeling well.

Adolf loves his family and his willing to work harder each day to provide the best life for them.
He will use the loan to buy assorted items such as cooking oil, beverages, corn, rice, toiletries among other items to boost his retail trade sales. He is resilient and hard working.

Vision group is proud to partner with UGAFODE and Kiva lenders and wants to pay on time to uphold their support.

loans.use: to boost his general store's retail trade business.

loans.name: Ravina

texts.en:
Ravina is a 33 year-old married mother of five children. who works hard to support her family. She is a policewomen and her husband is a farmer. Even though the family works very hard, it can be not enough for them to afford the cost of their daughter's education.

This loan of $ 1000 will allow Ravina to help her daughter continue her studies in university. She will use the loan to pay for registration, school materials and other things. because her daughter study far from them. She loves her daughter very much and hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's registration, materials for university and other things.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria has been involved in business activities since 2013. She started her business with her own working capital of $200. Maria has a small kiosk in her house. She is requesting a loan of $1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin because she wants to buy additional supplies according to what people like, including shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, kerosene, cigarettes, candles, milk, sardines, soft drinks, hard drinks and other things to sell. She is happy because, with the loan from Tuba Rai Metin, she can build her business so big in the future and her income can be increased.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, toothpaste, soap, lighters, noodles, biscuits, sugar, slippers, kerosene, cigarettes, candles, milk, sardines, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
A Newark native, Kevin says that when he was younger, his father and uncle taught him the landscaping trade, and today, he still enjoys farming, pruning, and being in nature.

After working for a time at Toyota, Kevin started his own landscaping business in the fall of 1994. Along with two other employees, Kevin services businesses, churches, and schools throughout the state of New Jersey. His business will rake winter debris to prepare for spring, prune shrubs and trees, and cut grass to provide lawn care during warmer months. In the winter, Kevin's business offers residential snow removal and ice control services.

Starting next spring, Kevin plans for his business to “go green,” and he will start using organic fertilization, mosquito spray, and seeding.

Kevin travels to serve clients all throughout the state. His job, Kevin says, is to serve the community. The company offers competitive prices and quality service, which has led to Kevin's biggest success in maintaining a strong customer base. Over 200 clients, obtained through word of mouth, are "the reason I go to work everyday," according to Kevin.

A Kiva loan from you will make a big difference for Kevin's small business. In preparation for the upcoming winter season, he is currently seeking a loan to pay for repair and maintenance of his snow-plowing equipment.

loans.use: to repair and maintain the snow-plowing equipment.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.en:
Moussa is a 22-year-old single young man. Due to the low financial situation of his family, he left school at early age and started five years ago managing his father's grocery shop. He succeeded in adding vegetables and fruits section to the shop which helped him in attracting more customers.

Moussa is well-known among his region and has his loyal customers. He took this shop's responsibility and he is working hard to develop and enlarge it. Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy a car to transport goods easily.
Moussa hopes to expand his business more in the future to increase his income and become able to build his own family and life.

loans.use: to buy a car to transport goods easily

loans.name: Assept

texts.en:
Sophia is a young lady who has been selling beauty products. She is part of a rural group that is involved in different small economic activities.

Sophia lives in an area where many people are living with less than $1 per day. The gathering of the people in groups allows them to save a very small amount of money for about six months and to give credit to the members for three months.

On behalf of that, Sophia is seeking a loan to not only support people in her group but also to buy more products and sell them. Sophia's profits will help her pay for a vocational school and afford personal expenses on a daily basis.

Sophia (middle) is pictured with Montana (left) and Rose-Marie (right).

loans.use: to buy dozens of cosmetics products to retail.

loans.name: Gwoup Peyizan Monfort

texts.en:
Derisna is a mother of seven children. Two of them died a few years ago.

In an attempt to fight against poverty, she launched a gathering inside her community. As a result, she regrouped 30 people of which a committee board was elected.

Like many Zafen borrowers, Derisna retails cooked food in flea markets. She needs a loan to increase her business as well as the others, as more than 10 women are street food vendors.

Derisna is timid but determined to get her familiy out of absolute poverty. In the picture from left to right: Maxo (member), Buteau (treasurer), Valery (advisor), Derisna (secretary) and Louise (member).

loans.use: to buy sacks of food to retail in the flea market.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses, a Kiva borrower, describes himself as focused. He operates a butcher shop. He has been in this business for ten years. His business is strategically located, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more meat to sell. His business goal is to open more business outlets within five years. He hopes that in the future, he can buy land. This is his first loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more meat for his butcher shop.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn is a single parent with four children. She runs their banana farm to make a supplementary income for her children. She took a loan from GDMPC to buy seedlings and fertilizer to expand her farm and increase the yield. She sells her banana in the local market and a portion will be use for their consumption. She saves some of her generated revenue for the future education her children.

loans.use: to purchase banana plant seedlings.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.en: Artemio supports his family through vegetable farming. He sells his vegetables in neighboring communities, in the town of Garcia Hernandez, Bohol. He has been operating this business for 15 years, despite the many obstacles. Artemio is determined to do things right to provide for the needs of his family. He has four children to support: ages 14, 12 and 10 years, and 7 months. His wife stays home and takes good care of the children.  Artemio is applying for a loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer to enhance his vegetable production. Artemio, 47, aims to improve his business and improve its profitability, so he can have enough money to send his children to school to enter professions some day.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be humble. Saumu operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are regular. Saumu describes her biggest business challenge to be the rainy season which affects business.

She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal to resell.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
Francisca con 66 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, vive junto a su cónyuge, en el distrito de Zaña,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú, en una zona rural. Francisca cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Francisca se dedica a la actividad de crianza y venta de animales menores, en el corral de su domicilio con más de 05 años de experiencia en el rubro.Solicita préstamo para la compra de animales y alimento para estos, así como para pequeños arreglos de su corral por las lluvias que se avecinan. De esta manera incrementarán sus ventas, y por ende sus ingresos. Francisca está incrementando el número de animales y arreglando sus corrales para de esta manera mejorar en su negocio.

Francisca es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa, con 10 créditos anteriores los cuáles viene cancelando de manera puntal y correcta.
texts.en:
Francisca is 66 years old and lives with her common law husband in a rural area of Zaña district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque department, Peru. Francisca has very good personal and work references from the inhabitants of the area, the majority of whom work in farming, business, or livestock.

Francisca raises and sells small animals. Her corral is at her home, and she has had this business for 5 years. She seeks a loan to buy animals and animal feed as well as make small repairs to her corral as the rainy season is approaching. In this way she will increase her sales and thus her income. Francisca is increasing the number of animals and repairing her corrals in order to improve her business.

Francisca is a member of Edpyme Alternative, with 10 prior loans which she has repaid punctually and correctly.

loans.use: to buy animals and animal feed as well as make small repairs to her corral.

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a single woman with one child. She operates a retail business where she sells clothing. She has been engaged in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to increase her stock of clothes. She hopes that, in the future, she will become financially stable. This is her third loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Beenish

texts.en:
Beenish is a 26 year old lady and a responsible mother of one daughter. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been running his own auto repair shop for the past four years. Beenish's husband needs to purchase tools, machinery and spare parts for business purposes, but due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase this merchandise.

To fulfill the need of her husband Beenish has applied for a Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her husband to buy this merchandise for his business's purposes. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him in fulfilling his family's needs.

Beenish is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts for her husband's auto repair business.

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en:
Sherlita is married, 56 years of age, and lives in Malibangcao, Clarin, Misamis Occidental together with her seven kids. She is operating a sari-sari store for additional earning, aside from her farming activities. She has been in this business for ten years and she earns 30,000 PHP every month.

She is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase supplementary goods for her general store. She joined GDMPC in 2004. In the future, Sherlita will use her income to support her seven kids in their studies until they finish college and in their daily needs. Sherlita wishes that her business would be more progressive.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.name: Cornelia

texts.en:
Cornelia is 41 years old and married with five children. With three children in school, Cornelia works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Cornelia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Cornelia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: Raquel, 64, is married and has two children. She works very hard to provide for them. Raquel runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has applied for a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as spices, personal care products, and other groceries. Raquel has been in this business for 10 years, and she sells a variety of items, including feeds. In the future, Raquel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as spices, personal care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Cheang's Group

texts.en: A widow who lives in a small house in Tbaung Khmum province, Cheang is 31 years old and the mother of a child who is in school. She earns income by growing rice and cassava on two hectares of farmland. Her cassava is not growing well, because of a drought, so she is not earning as much as she did before. This is the first time for her and her group’s fellow member to borrow from VisionFund. Her loan will make it possible for her to buy fertilizer and pesticides, to improve her crop. She hopes she will have better harvests, to earn more income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide, to improve her crops and produce more returns to cover her future needs.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 56-year-old married mother with five children. Three years ago, she started selling clothes to help her husband to meet the needs and expenses of their children. She is an ambitious lady and a sacrificing mother.

Hanan is trying desperately to develop her business and requests a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her inventory with a new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' needs.

Hanan hopes to expand her business, increase her income, and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of winter clothes.

loans.name: Zeinab

texts.en:
Zeinab is a 33-year-old, married woman living with her husband. She is a mother of three children. Her husband represents the main source of income for the family; he works as a soldier in the Lebanese army.

Today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to be able to pay her children’s educational fees. She is very eager to make use of the loan for their professional careers. This is her fourth loan, but she said that she will be a permanent client and eager to borrow additional loans in the future.

loans.use: to pay her children's educational fees.

loans.name: Sviltana

texts.en:
Sviltana is a 37-year-old married woman with two children. She is really attached to her family and her husband works very hard to provide a respectable living.

She will use the loan to pay to purchase her children's school books. One of her greatest dreams is for her children to achieve higher positions. Sviltana’s husband wishes to develop his work and better support his family.

loans.use: to purchase her children's school books.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia de 37 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hijo, ella se dedica a la elaboracion y venta de tamales de elotes desde hace 16 años su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, anteriormente habia solicitando un credito para mejorar su vivienda y gracias a esa inversion tiene una vivienda digna, hoy solicita nuevamente otro credito pero en esta ocasion es para la compra de elotes por mayor, leche, azucar, entre otros ingredientes para continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Virginia is 37 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and son. She has had a business making and selling corn tamales for 16 years. Her business is located in her home and she has many customers. Previously she sought a loan to improve her home and thanks to that investment she has a dignified home. Today she seeks a new loan but it is to buy corn at wholesale, milk, sugar, and other ingredients in order to continue her sales and thus be able to have better income.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale, milk, sugar, and other ingredients.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself to be understanding. He operates a transport business using his motorcycle. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be motorcycle breakdowns.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. His business goal is to own more motorcycles within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a house. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to improve his living standards.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Amado

texts.es:
Amado con 39 años de edad,de estado civil conviviente,vive junto a su cónyuge e hijos, en el distrito de Callayuc,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Amado se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de café, con una experiencia en el rubro hace 08 años.Solicita préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes y pago a sus peones para realizar buenas prácticas agrícolas.De esta manera podrá obtener mejores rendimientos en su cultivo de café.

Amado es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.Ha manejado dos créditos los cuáles los canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Amado is 39 years old and lives with his partner and children in the Callayuc district, Cutervo province, Cajamarca department in Peru. The residents of this area mostly earn a living in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Amado earns a living in agriculture, specifically growing coffee. He has eight years of work experience. He's seeking the loan to buy fertilizers and pay his workers to achieve good agricultural practices. In this way, he'll get better returns on his coffee crop.

Amado is a recurring member for Edpyme Alternativa. He's taken out two loans which he paid back punctually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pay his workers.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Alicia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell fish and general store.  Alicia is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy additional bundle of fishing net, bamboo to make fish cages for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Alicia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional bundle of fishing net, bamboo to make fish cages

loans.name: Leili Jeaneth

texts.es:
Leili, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, se dedica a la agricultura oficio que le enseñaron sus padres; se levanta muy temprano junto a su esposo para realizar las actividades diarias, que son principalmente la agricultura y la ganadería.

Leili, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en la mañana y su esposo le ayuda en la parcela que alquilan y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas y a elaborar quesos para vender entre sus vecinos además, pero también elaboran pan artesanal que también ofrecen.

Leili, necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla, para producir más leche e incrementar sus ingresos para el sustento de su familia.

Leili, sueña con obtener mejores ingresos de la venta de la leche y de la siembra de granos básicos; pero también quiere comprar un terreno donde sembrar y poder tener sus animales.
texts.en:
Leili, 45, studied until 9th grade. She's married and earns a living through agricultural activities her parents taught her. She and her husband get up very early to do their daily work, which is mostly agriculture and livestock.

Leili works in agriculture in the morning and her husband helps her with the parcel they rent. In the course of the afternoon, they herd the cows and make cheese to sell to their neighbors. They also make and provide artisanal bread.

Leili needs the loan to buy a heifer to produce more milk and increase her earnings to support her family. She dreams of earning better money from selling milk and growing staple goods, but also wants to buy land where she can grow crops and be able to have her animals.

loans.use: to buy a heifer to produce more milk and increase her earnings.

loans.name: Nuhu

texts.en:
Nuhu is maize farmer from Kurungofi village. As a member of Babban Gona, Nuhu is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the oppotrtunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Nuhu would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs. With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Nuhu can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Nuhu is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is a single woman with 2 children. She describes herself to be friendly. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to have many businesses within 5 years. This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Godfrey

texts.en:
Godfrey is a married man. He has 3 children. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will be financially stable. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to open a new business.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Herminia

texts.en:
Herminia is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Herminia is 54 years old now.

Herminia has a food vending business in the Philippines. Herminia requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Herminia has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Herminia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Joselda

texts.en:
Joselda is 45 years old, married with one kid who is in school. She has a general store business in the Philippines.

Joselda requested a PHP 10,400 loan through NWTF in order to buy a solar lamp.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to have backup light in case of emergency.

Joselda is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Reina De La Paz

texts.es:
Reina, de 49 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casada, se dedica a la agricultura, pues fue el oficio que le enseñaron sus padres; ella se levanta temprano junto a su esposo e hijos para realizar sus actividades diarias en la agricultura y la ganadería.

Reina, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura en la mañana junto a sus hijos y esposo, en la parcela que alquila y en el transcurso de la tarde se dedican a ordeñar las vacas y a elaborar quesos para vender entre sus vecinos y en los alrededores de su comunidad.

Reina, necesita el préstamo para comprar una novilla, la cual en un futuro le ayudara a producir más leche e incrementar sus ingresos. 

Reina, sueña con comprar un terreno para sembrar y tener más ganado.
texts.en:
Reina, 49, went to school until 9th grade. She's married and earns a living in agriculture, which was the profession her parents taught her. She gets up early with her husband and children to do her daily work in agriculture and livestock.

Reina works in agriculture in the morning with her husband and children on a parcel they rent. In the course of the afternoon, she herds the cows and makes cheese to sell to her neighbors in the area around her community.

Reina needs the loan to buy a heifer, which will help her produce more milk in the future and improve her income. Reina dreams of buying land to cultivate and have more livestock.

loans.use: to buy a heifer.

loans.name: Gabino

texts.es: Gabino, quien es soltero, tiene 58 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos y vive en una aldea del sector de Iguala, Lempira. Toda su vida la ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz, frijol, arroz y café. Maneja su propio cultivo y producción de café en la zona agrícola de la comunidad donde vende su café despulpado y lavado. El ha solicitado cuatro préstamos anteriores a la institución para mantener su finca y actualmente solicita la cantidad de 15,000.00 Lempiras para la compra de abono para fertilizar su finca de café y así conseguir una mejor calidad y obtener una mayor producción. Su sueño es seguir creciendo como productor de café y seguir cultivando y ampliando su terreno.
texts.en:
Gabino, who is single, is 58 years old and has four children. He lives in a village in the area of Iguala, Lempira.

All his life, he's earned a living in agriculture, growing corn, beans, rice and coffee. He manages his own crop and coffee production in the agricultural region of the community where he sells his coffee de-pulped and washed.

He has taken out four earlier loans from the institution to maintain his farm and is currently seeking a loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy compost to fertilize his coffee farm, ensuring a better quality and boosting production. His dream is to continue growing as a coffee producer and continue cultivating and growing his land.

loans.use: to buy compost to fertilize his coffee farm.

loans.name: Sinat's Group

texts.en:
