Sinat, 46, is living in Dambae district of Tbaung Khmum province and she has two dependent children who are all in school. She has been growing rice to support her family’s living for more than five years. Moreover, she is a teacher as well. She could earn income around 10USD per day and save about 5USD each day. Recently, her crop was threatened by insects, which is the main challenge for her in earning income to support her family.

She has been with VisionFund for seven cycles already and repaid her past loans completely. Through those previous loans, she can afford to buy enough household supplies to use. As the group leader of this new loan, she is going to manage her loan to buy pesticide to protect her crop from insects. She hopes to get higher yields in order to upgrade her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy pesticide to protect her crop from insects so as to get a good yield.

loans.name: Santiago Argentina

texts.es: Doña Santiago, de 60 años de edad, vive con su esposo, tiene 3 hijos y vive junto a uno de sus hijos y dos nietos en una de las colonias de Cofradía, Cortes. Ella tiene desde hace 18 años su propio negocio de venta de mercadería y siempre se ha dedicado a  él, entre los productos que ofrece se encuentran: Pulseras, aretes, Cadenas, y ropa como Pantalones, Blusas, Sandalias, zapatillas y otros accesorios. Ella ofrece sus productos de manera ambulante y cuenta con su clientela. Ha solicitado ya varios préstamos a la institución para mantener su negocio. Actualmente solicita la cantidad de 21,000.00 Lempiras para más blusas, pantalones, sandalias, aretes, pulseras y otras joyas, para ampliar su inventario y aumentar más su clientela. Su plan es crecer más como empresaria y seguir esforzándose para hacer crecer su negocio ya que es una fuente de ingresos para su núcleo familiar y así apoyar a la familia a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Santiago is 60 years old, lives with her husband, and has three children. She lives with one of her children and two grand children in the Cofradía, Cortes neighborhood. She has had her own business for 18 years selling merchandise and she has always worked in her business. Among the products she sells are: bracelets, earrings, necklaces, and clothing such as pants, blouses, sandals, slippers, and other accessories.  She sells her items as a street vendor and has steady customers. She has asked for various loans to support her business. Today she seeks 21,000.00 Lempiras to buy more blouses, pants, sandals, earrings, bracelets, and other jewelry in order to expand her inventory and increase her customers. Her plan is to grow more as a businesswoman and continue strengthening herself to grow her business as it is the source of income for her family and in this way she supports her family having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy blouses, sandals, earrings, bracelets, and other jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Nourhane

texts.en:
Nourhane is a 20 year old single Lebanese woman. She lives with her parents and four siblings. All family members cooperate together to satisfy their family needs and enhance their way of living. She requests a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to pay her school fees.

In the future, she plans to take additional loans from Kiva and continue her education.

loans.use: to pay her school fees.

loans.name: Leonisa

texts.en:
Leonora is a 41-year-old married woman with two children.

Leonora works hard to provide for her family and has run a general store for 14 years. She requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, beverages, rice, snack foods, and other groceries.

Leonora has previously borrowed 7 times from NWTF before this loan. She earns additional income from a bicycle transportation business.

Leonora aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, rice, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Usaini

texts.en:
Usaini is maize farmer from Liman village. As a member of Babban Gona, Usaini is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support he has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Usaini would have had to sell his maize at Harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest to meet his immediate cash needs.

With this loan and Babban Gona’s support, Usaini can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Usaini is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end hopes to use his increased earnings to ensure that all his children get a university education

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest .

loans.name: Thomson

texts.en:
The past few years have been difficult for 27-year-old Thomson, he has been trying to find a way to help his family financially. He comes from a family of 4 brothers and 3 sisters. None of his brothers is working and his young sisters are constantly being sent back from school, because they are struggling to pay for school fees. He has been trying to help by working as a ground labourer at a local church, but this is not sufficient to meet his needs. Today, Thomson is hopeful for a better life.

Thomson has completed training with Zoona to start running his own business as a Zoona mobile money transfer agent. This means that he will be providing the service of mobile money transfers to people in his community and earning a weekly profit. This prospect is exciting to Thomson. He says his community will benefit from his business as it will provide an easy, quick and safe way for them to send and receive money.

When Thomson gets this Kiva loan, he will be able to serve customers by providing the float needed for him to make transactions. The loan will also enable him to purchase a trading kiosk, a mobile phone and cashbox. All these are necessary items for him to successfully get his business off the ground. Thomson will use the profit from his business to support his sisters through school and provide for his basic needs. “It has been a big struggle to get by but now I can see my life improving with this opportunity. For the first time I can see a future that is bright. And I am thankful for this opportunity” says Thomson.

loans.use: to serve customers by providing the Zoona float needed for him to make transactions. The loan will also enable him to purchase a trading kiosk, a mobile phone and cashbox.

loans.name: Vothtey

texts.en: Vothtey is a 20-year-old single cashier. She is working for a company in the city. She resides in Phnom Penh City in Cambodia. She has been working as a cashier since 2015, earning around $5 per day. She is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in finance and banking at the university. Due to the fact that she is short of the finances to pay her tuition fees for the fourth year, she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to cover her university fees and earn a bachelor’s degree successfully. For her dream, Vothtey wants to find a better job with a reasonable salary so she will be able to build her own house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees for the fourth year

loans.name: Zahraa

texts.en:
Zahraa is a 23 year-old married woman with one child. She works with her husband to satisfy the family's needs. Her husband is a driver and she is a nurse in a local hospital.

She requests a loan from Kiva partner, Vitas s.a.l, to pay for her nursing courses. This loan will help her to strengthen her nursing expertise.

loans.use: to pay for her nursing courses.

loans.name: Joel

texts.en: Joel is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself as business oriented. He operates a farm to grow rice. His business is located in a fertile place and his primary customers are local people. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. He will use the 100,000 KES loan to buy fertilizer, seedling, and pay labor costs. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He also intends to buy a water pump in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seedling, and laborers.

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita is a 38-year-oldmarried woman with seven children, four attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Pacita has had a fishing business for 10 years and requests 6, 000 loan PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and fishing supplies.

In the future, Pacita would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and fishing supplies.

loans.name: Sreymom's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area of Kandal province, Sreymom is a 36-year-old married mother of three children, two of whom are dependent children. Rice farming has been the primary source of her family’s income for 18 years. She can earn more income by working at a garment factory. The daily income she earns is about 10 USD per day and she can save about 5 USD each day after expenses.

Sreymom is new to VisionFund and she is leading a two-member group to apply for a loan to support her farmland. She will use her portion of the loan to buy organic fertilizer to increase crop productivity. She hopes to get good yields to sell for a good price so that she can improve her lifestyle and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to increase crop productivity so that she can improve her lifestyle and send her children to school.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 48 years old and has five children who are in school.

Rowena has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as vegetables, spices, etc.

Rowena has been in this business for 23 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
A committed woman who previously repaid her loan with hardworking capabilities is seeking to acquire a loan of GHS 1500.
Giffy is a single parent with three children, two of her kids are at the elementary level and one at the senior high level. With her diligence in repayment of loans, Giffy wishes to expand her business in order to render the quality of food for the attracting and well nourishment of her customers for her business development. She sells tea and bread and other items to her customers.
She will be very much grateful for the love and help of Kiva and ID-Ghana.

loans.use: to produce the quality of food for attracting and nourishment of her customers for her business development.

loans.name: Raghida

texts.en: Raghida is a 33-year-old  married woman with four children, all attend school. Her husband's income  is the main source in the family. She requests a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to pay for her children’s educational fees and books. She is pleased that the loan will  help her to register them for  the coming school year.

loans.use: to pay for her children’s educational fees and  books.

loans.name: Antonina

texts.en:
Antonina earns a living through selling basic commodities like sugar, edible oil, noodles, powdered milk, chips, candies, canned goods, biscuits, shampoo, toothpaste, and soap.
She is 58-year old married woman with three grown children. She lives in the town of Pilar, Bohol. Her husband's occupation is a farmer.

Antonia would like to enhance the content of her store. She has requested a loan to buy assorted groceries, soft drinks, mineral water and toiletries. With these, she could able to cope with demands and improve her financial income. Slowly, she could be able to set aside some of the profits for future use.

With her previous loan, Antonia managed to invest in goods to sell, for which she is very grateful.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries, soft drinks, mineral water and toiletries

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila, 23, is married. She lives with her husband and does not have children. She has worked from her house as hairdresser since 2012, and she has a total of five years of experience working in this occupation. Her husband is a soldier in the Lebanese army, and they cooperate to face  the high cost of living. Today, she is applying for a youth loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l to buy hairdressing and beauty equiment. She is very sure that this loan will help her to satisfy her customers' demands. In the future, she hopes to open her own beauty salon, where she will receive her customers properly.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing and beauty equipment.

loans.name: Minh

texts.en: Mrs. Minh, 28, is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and other goods for more than ten years. Minh lives in Thanh Hoa city, a town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and market demand is low in this region. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is applying for a loan to buy sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet. This is Minh's first loan with the Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan can make her little dream come true. In the future, Minh hopes that her business will do well, that her family will be healthy and happy, and that she will be able to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement, bricks and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is married and has four children. She has helped her husband to run a fishing business for 5 years.

She requests a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase a fishing net. She wants to improve the business and provide a better living for the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase a fishing net.

loans.name: Greta

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Greta works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from tricycle passenger. Greta is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF in order to buy more dried fish to sell to customers.

Greta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 32 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josefina is 62 years old now.

She has a nipa weaving business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy items to sell, like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc.

Josefina has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like nipa leaves, bamboo sticks, etc.

loans.name: Isadora

texts.en:
Isadora is a 36 year-old married mother with three children, who works hard to support her family. She is a nurse.

Although the family works very hard, it can be difficult for them to support the cost of her husband's education. This loan of $ 1000 will allow Isadora to help Patricio to continue his studies. She will use the loan to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies. Isadora loves her family very much and In the future, Isadora hopes that further education will help them to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to pay for tuition, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Nazek

texts.en: Nazek, 24, is married and has one child. In 2010, she decided to start working from her home selling homemade food, to help her family to meet their needs and to improve their lifestyle. She is applying for a loan from Kiva's partner Vitas s.a.l. to add variety to her business and to buy food ingredients so she can give the best products to her clients. She has a very good reputation in her hometown by giving the best possible products to her clients. She is certain that she will sell all her products. She hopes that, in the near future, she can open her own store, and she insists that she will always work to develop her business.

loans.use: to add variety to her home-based business and to buy ingredients for her food products.

loans.name: Nawal

texts.en:
Nawal is a 41-year-old married mother of four. Nineteen years ago, she started tailoring to help her husband cover the increasing needs and expenses of their children. She is a hard worker and sacrificing mother who is trying desperately, despite her limited income, to provide her family with decent living conditions.

Nawal is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to renovate her house to make it a better and healthier place for her family; she also wants to buy vegetables and fruits for her husband to start a new business.

Nawal hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and stay capable of improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate her house and buy vegetables and fruits for her husband to start a new business

loans.name: Benvenida

texts.en:
Benvenida owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling merchandise like cooking oil, seasonings, coffee, powdered milk, pouch vinegar, soap, shampoo, eggs, and toiletries.
Aside from running a sari-sari (variety) store she also operates a passenger vehicle, her husband is the one who handles this business.

Benvenida is a 33-year-old married woman with three children ages 6, 8 and 16 years old respectively. All of them are still attending school.
Most of her expenses comes from food and school fees.

Benvenida would like to improve her earnings by purchasing tires, engine fuel and assorted groceries for the store. These will help the inventory of her store and possibly attract more customers to come and shop.

She is hoping she can make her store sustainable for the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase tires, engine fuel and assorted groceries for her store.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself as faithful. She operates a food stall where she sells fish. She has been engaged in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes that, in the future, she will be the main fish supplier in the area. This is her fourth loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en: Arlene, 35, is married and works very hard to provide for her family. Arlene runs a general store in the Philippines, and she has applied for a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as bread, canned goods, snack food, home care products and other groceries. Arlene has been in this business for 20 years, and she sells a variety of items. In the future, Arlene would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as bread, canned goods, snack food, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Sisters Group

texts.en:
Mrs Mến, a 35-year-old married mother of three, has had a business sewing curtains for six years. She lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, and her family is a low-income household in the village. Her main hardship is lack of capital. She is the group leader of "Sisters," which consists of four members.

In 2012, Mến joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. She has repaid four previous loans and is requesting a new one to purchase more cloth and a machine to sew more curtains to sell in order to increase her income.

in the future, Mến hopes for her enterprise to do well and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth and a machine to sew more curtains to sell

loans.name: Muong Phang 38 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Tham is 23-year-old Thai ethnic lady who is married and the mother of a 2-year-old daughter. She lives with her in-laws, her husband and her child in a Thai ethnic traditional house in a remote village where agriculture is the main source of income of villagers. To support her family, she works very hard at cultivation and animal husbandry with several activities such as growing rice, breeding pig, buffalo, chicken, ducks and fish while her husband works as a teacher in a primary school.

This is the first time that Mrs. Tham has taken out a loan from the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use the loan to buy baby fish and food to feed them. She hopes that the fish will grow fast, healthily then help her reap a good income. Mrs. Tham dreams of a more sufficient life for her family and a bright future for her child. In the picture, she stands at the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy baby fish and food to feed them

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a 47-year-old woman with four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who has operated a food vending business in the Philippines for 10 years.

Lucia has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production enterprise. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Justin

texts.fr:
34 ans, Justin est mariée et son épouse est une brodeuse. Le couple a quatre enfants à leurs charge dont trois leurs propre enfants de 5, 7, et 10 ans et leur neveu de 12 ans qui est orphelin . Ils sont tous scolarisés. A part les activités agricoles que le couple exploitent ensemble et la broderie de madame, Justin aussi exerce une autre activité, il dirige un magasin d'alimentation de "kafe sy mofo" depuis 2006. Il ne cesse pas de chercher des  bonnes idées pour améliorer le niveau de vie de sa famille. C'est un père travailleur. Le prêt va être utilisé pour renforcer le capital d'abord et pour réhabiliter et réaménager le magasin ensuite.
Il a déjà acquit un terrain avec ses épargnes et envisage d'y construire sa propre maison l'année prochaine.
texts.en:
Justin, aged 34, is married, and his wife is an embroiderer. The couple support four children, of whom three are their own children, aged 5, 7, and 10. Their 12-year-old nephew is an orphan. They are all in school. Aside from farmwork the couple do together and the wife’s embroidery, Justin has also had another business managing a grocery store selling "kafe sy mofo" since 2006. He keeps looking for good ideas to improve his family’s living conditions. He is a hard-working father.

The loan will be used first to bolster his capital and then to renovate the store. He has already acquired a plot of land with his savings and envisions building on it a house of his own, next year.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, coffee, cement, and paint and to pay the mason's wages

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena  hails  from  the town of Panglao, Bohol. She operates a sari-sari (variety) store, selling  commodities like noodles, milk, sugar, seasonings, eggs, insect repellent, matches, soap, shampoo and assorted canned goods. She is married woman with two children ages 19 and 21.
 
Her sari-sari (variety}  store situated near her home and serving customers mostly neighbors and nearby residents. 
Filomena would like to improve her main source  of living to become more productive and improve the family’s living condition. She also like to continue send her child to college education. She works hard to provide her family with proper nutrition and better shelter too.

She would like  to buy assorted groceries, liquors and soft drinks.

Filomena is thankful to KIVA and CEVI for the unwavering support.

loans.use: to buy assorted groceries, liquors and soft drinks

loans.name: Rabije

texts.en:
Rabije, the mother of six children, is a seamstress who works from her home alongside her daughter. (In the picture Rabije is shown with her husband.) Very hardworking, she has also been teaching her oldest daughter the trade. Although they come from one of the vulnerable populations, she is very famous and well known for her work in the area and has many clients and much work.

Rabije is in need of a loan to purchase some simple materials for her business. She is very proud of the fact that she can generate income for her family through her own work since her husband is employed as a cleaner with a low income. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, she appreciates the lenders' support and help.

loans.use: to purchase some simple materials for her seamstress business

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
For the past 15 years, Claudia engaged in dried fish retailing business. She sells to neighbors and locals. She is 46 years old with one grown child. Her husband's occupation is a carpenter.
Her income would go for food, and other household expenses.

Claudia has requested a loan to buy more stocks of dried fish and cellophane (for storage). These could help her purchase in bulk supply and to deliver to her customers. In that way, her earnings will improve and she would be able to invest other source of income to become sustainable.

She is thankful to Kiva for the continued support to continue to increase her family's living in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of dried fish and cellophane (for storage)

loans.name: Joselita

texts.en:
Joselita is a 54-year-old married woman and has five children. Three of her children are still attending school. Five years ago, she started raising hogs to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their children. Together with her family, she lives in the town of Loon, Bohol.

She is a hard worker who is trying desperately to develop her business, but she is also a sacrificing mother who deprives herself for the sake of her children. She has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner CEVI, to buy piglets. In that way, she could able to raise more hogs and slowly alleviate her present financial condition.

Joselita hopes to expand her business more in the future through investing other sources of income to improve her family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Ohriyah

texts.en:
Ohriyah is 24 years old and dreams of owning and running her own business to support her family. Ohriyah’s father died, leaving her the responsibility of being the breadwinner in her family. She is currently unemployed and this makes it difficult to provide for basic needs.

A Kiva loan would enable Ohriyah to purchase a Zoona mobile money transfer trolley and a mobile phone and provide the funds needed for her to serve people who need to access financial services. On a broader spectrum, Ohriyah would like to be able to give back to her community by creating employment opportunities and thus helping others achieve peace of mind. This would not only save her community member’s time, but it would also lower their expenses as this would reduce the need to travel long distances in order to send and receive money.

Ohriyah thanks the Kiva lenders for helping her start running her own business.

loans.use: to procure a Zoona branded trolley and an internet enabled phone as well as the funds needed to make the actual transactions so that she can start running her own business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 51 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Adelaida is borrowing PHP 7,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Adelaida has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Theng's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in a rural village of Tbaung Khmum province’s Dambae district, Theng is 33 years old and she has two children who are both in school. The main sources of her income are from growing cassava and rice. Destruction by insects on her farm is the main challenge for her business.

This is her fourth loan with VisionFund for supporting her business. She can afford to buy enough consumption for her family. As the group leader of two, she will spend her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer and seeds to produce good yields. She hopes that the fourth loan will help her to earn more income so that she can support her children’s studies until their graduation and have a good job.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds to produce good yields so that she could earn more income to keep supporting her children's studying.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en: Maria is requesting a loan of $ 1000 to improve her business. She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies such as slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, rice, oil, wheat, detergent, and other things to sell in her kiosk including soft drinks and hard drinks. Maria started her kiosk in 2008 with her own working capital of $ 1500. She is happy with the loan offered from Tuba Rai Metin for her to have more working capital to buy more goods to bring to the market to sell.

loans.use: to buy  slippers, candies, sugar, coffee, rice, oil, wheat, detergent, soft drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Sokhey's Group

texts.en: A young man who lives in a a one-bedroom house located in Tbaung Khmum province, Sokhey is 24 years old and a father of a young son. He has been growing cassava to support his family’s living for 2 years. His cassava has grown unhealthy which enables him to earn only about 11USD per day. After deducting daily expenses, he can save around 5USD each day. This is his first time with VisionFund, and he is leading a group to ask for loan support. In his group of two members, he is the leader and he is going to spend his loan portion on covering fees for laborers removing weeds from his farmland. He hopes that he will earn more income to support his family’s living, to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow cassava and to send his son to school.

loans.use: to pay for laborer fees and consequently buy an additional plot of farmland to grow cassava and send his son to school.

loans.name: Selman

texts.en: Selman is the father of three and is involved in agricultural work, along with his wife. They have a greenhouse for planting vegetables to sell and his wife also works selling the products in a market every day. They have a lot of customers and often find it difficult to keep up with the sales and demand. Selman is requesting a loan so that he can build another two greenhouses to continue planting vegetables and add new types, increasing their variety. He is very positive that he will be able to increase his income significantly after this loan and appreciates the help of the lenders.

loans.use: build another two greenhouses to continue planting vegetables and add new types.

loans.name: Overcome Challenges Group

texts.en:
Mrs Mơ is 22 years old and is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for 2 years. Mơ lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village and the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Mơ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to expand her business by purchasing more items such as milk, cake and sweets to resell. This is Mơs first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She hopes that this loan will improve her living standard.

She is the group leader of "Overcome challenges", which consists of four members. With her business profit, Mơ hopes for her business to do well, to make enough money to provide for her kids, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

loans.use: to expand her business by purchasing more items such as milk, cake, and sweets to resell.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 65-years-old and married with seven children. Erlinda works very hard to provide for them.

Erlinda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Erlinda has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sadrech

texts.en:
Sadrech is 27 years old, he sees himself as a natural entrepreneur and has already gotten an advanced diploma in business management. He is certain that he will thoroughly enjoy running his own business, but lacks the necessary capital needed in order to make his dream a reality.
Currently, the economy in Malawi makes it difficult for young people to access capital loans. This makes it difficult for Sadrech to start running his own business so that he can support himself and his family. He believes that becoming a Zoona agent and running his own business will turn his situation around.
Sadrech would like to make a success of running a mobile money transfer business in Blantyre and eventually using the revenue generated to further his education and plough all that knowledge back into his business and his community.
One of Sadrech’s objectives is to provide safe money transfer facilities to the community, so that clients no longer have to spend money on travel to access financial services. His dream is to grow his business and help increase Zoona's footprint in Malawi.
When Sadrech receives this loan, he will be able to start running his own business by purchasing a trading trolley, a mobile phone and having the funds needed to serve customers. Sadrech thanks the Kiva lenders for supporting and believing in him.

loans.use: to procure a branded trolley and an internet enabled phone as well as the funds needed to make the actual transactions so that he can start running his own business.

loans.name: Aamal

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Aamal is a 54-year-old married woman with five kids who lives in Yata in Hebron city. She has a small poultry farm in front of her house. Her main business is chickens, chicks, eggs, etc. Aamal needs the loan to buy chickens in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits. The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity, which limits her ability to expand her project, and the other challenge is the political risk and the unstable situation, which is difficult to navigate.

For the future, Aamal hopes to expand her project by increasing the poultry farm.

Aamal thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy chickens in order to raise them and after that sell them and make some profits.

loans.name: Betty Elizabeth

texts.es:
Betty, de 46 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de asistir a la escuela, está casada, tiene 3 hijos y su esposo es agricultor.

Betty, desde que tenía 12 años de edad le ayudaba a su padre en la agricultura, es por eso que hoy en día conoce muy bien esta actividad y actualmente tiene sembrada una área de 6,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz, la cual es trabajada junto a su esposo.- Además de eso, desde hace 5 años trabaja como empleada doméstica en casa de su vecina, en donde su horario de trabajo es desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m. y de esta forma obtiene ingresos para salir adelante.

Betty, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar maíz.

Betty, sueña con tener ganado y de esta forma invertir en una nueva actividad productiva.
texts.en:
Betty is 46 years old and did not have the opportunity to attend school. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a farmer.

From the age of 12, Betty helped her father with the farming duties and now she is very knowledgeable about this type of work. Currently, she has sown an area of 6000 square metres with maize, which she cultivates together with her husband. Apart from this, for the past five years she has been working as a domestic helper in her neighbour's house, where her working hours are from 7:00a.m. to 4:00p.m. This way, she earns income to get ahead.

Betty needs the loan to buy agricultural inputs to plant maize. Betty dreams of having livestock and in this way invest in a new type of production.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to plant maize.

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en: Nelie is 63 years of age and separated with four children. She has been working on their own farm for a living. To improve the farm, she borrowed a new loan to purchase fertilizer. She sells some vegetables in town and some will be for family consumption. In the future, she wants to cultivate her farm to ensure an improved and better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Voahangilalao

texts.fr:
Voahangilalao vous remercie beaucoup pour le crédit. Avec lequel, elle a pu renouveler ses marchandises et les diversifier. Grâce à vous, malgré la dureté de ses luttes, elle est très motivée à continuer à avancer. Elle ne perd pas espoir. C'est une femme exemple de courage et de force.
Elle espère que vous continuerez à lui accorder un autre crédit qui va lui permettre encore de renforcer son fonds de roulement, il y a toujours dans le marché des nouveautés (nouveaux arrivages de marchandises).
Son objectif est de construire sa propre maison un jour et d'ouvrir deux points de vente pour ses deux filles qui l'appuient dans cette activité car ne peuvent plus suivre leurs études faute de moyens.
texts.en:
Voahangilalao thanks you very much for the loan, with which she was able to renew and diversify her merchandise. Thanks to you, and despite the harshness of her struggles, she is very motivated to keep going. She has lost no hope. This is a woman who sets an example with her courage and strength.

She hopes that you will continue to make another loan to her enabling her to bolster her working capital even more. In the market, there are always novelties (new arrivals of merchandise).

Her goal is to build a house of her own one day and to open two sales outlets for her two daughters, who support her in this work, since they can no longer afford to continue their studies.

loans.use: to purchase brooms, clothes pins, laundry baskets, trash cans, and accessories.

loans.name: Abda

texts.en: Abda is a 49-year-old Lebanese married woman and the mother of eleven children, eight of whom are still studying. Her husband is the main income source in the family. He is a retired soldier in the Lebanese army and works also as a farmer for extra money. Today, with the fact that the new school year started, Abda is in need of borrowing a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. to purchase school supplies for her children. She is very happy that she will be able to ensure a good education for them, which makes her very happy and thankful for Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies for her children

loans.name: Lesbia

texts.es:
La joven Lesbia  de 24  años de edad, es madre soltera y  vive con su mama en su  casa propia,  se dedica desde hace 03  años al negocio de venta de ropa americana nueva y  usada, ella vende pantalones, camisas, chores, bóxer, licras, camisetas, vestidos, faldas, bresieres, biquinis,  y otros  más, también venden productos como, juego de sillones, cómodas de madera, gaveteros, y otros mas, vive  en San Lorenzo, Valle, al sur de Honduras, es una mujer  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de tres  fardos  de ropa clasificada  con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y aumentar su clientela  y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.
San Lorenzo  Honduras - Septiembre  2015.
texts.en:
Lesbia is a young, 24-year-old woman and single mother who lives with her mother in their own home. She lives in San Lorenzo, Valle, in southern Honduras. She is a woman who wants to get ahead and strives every day to improve her quality of life.

She has been selling new and used clothing from the U.S. for 3 years now. She sells pants, shirts, shorts, boxer shorts, leggings, tee shirts, dresses, skirts, bras, bikinis, etc. She also sells items such as living room sets, wooden dressers, chests of drawers and other things.

She is requesting the loan to buy three bales of classified clothing. With the help of the loan, she intends to improve her income and also her quality of life. She is a client who hopes to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a good business and increase her clientele, and at the same time, improve her future with her family.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - September 2015.

loans.use: to buy blouses, dresses, shirts and pants to have plenty of merchandise to sell at Christmas.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Ella es una señora de 52 años de edad, es divorciada y trabaja como obrera. Presenta una proliferación en su ojo izquierdo la cual volvió aparecer después de siete años, el ambiente donde trabaja es muy caliente y esto hace que su ojo este irritado todo el día, requiere someterse a cirugía ya que es la única opción para poder extirpala.
Sus recursos económicos no le alcanzan para solventar la cirugía y por medio del seguridad social esta en una larga lista de espera, lo que le preocupa ya que su vista se ve afectada.
texts.en:
She is a 52-year-old lady. She is divorced and works as a laborer. A growth has appeared in her left eye, which came back after seven years. Her work environment is very hot and this irritates her eye all day. She needs to undergo a surgery, as that is the only option to remove it.

Her financial resources are not enough to pay for the surgery, and there is a long waiting list through social security; this worries her because her eyesight appears to be affected.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment

loans.name: Clara Sandra

texts.fr:
Clara a 38 ans, son mari (36 ans) est sérigraphiste. Les activités du couple sont complémentaires. Leurs enfants (11-10-04-03 ans) suivent tous leurs études dans des écoles privées.
Clara  a 11 années d’expérience dans l’activité de confection de vêtements (robe, pantacourt, ensemble, body). Avant, elle travaillait dans une entreprise de zone franche de confection. Elle n’a pas cessé d’investir dans son activité pour être autonome, elle est actuellement à son cinquième prêt. Son atout réside dans la qualité des articles confectionnés : travaux de finition et d’impression. Le prêt sert a permis d’acheter une machine sur jeteuse et col routeuse nécessaire pour assurer une bonne qualité des produits (travaux de finition).  A cela s’ajoute les tissus et un lot de petits matériels.
Le couple prévoit de commencer la construction d’une maison à la fin de l’été. Leur rêve est de pouvoir acquérir un véhicule.
texts.en:
Clara is 38 years old, and her husband (aged 36) is a silk-screen printer. The couple’s businesses are complementary. Their children (aged 11, 10, 4, and 3) are still in private schools.

Clara has eleven years of experience in the business of making clothing (dresses, capri shorts, outfits, bodysuits). Before, she used to work in a free-zone manufacturing enterprise. She kept investing in her business to be autonomous. She is currently on her 5th loan. Her advantage resides in the quality of the articles she makes: refinished and printed products.

The loan will be used to purchase a machine for overlocking stitches which is also “col routeuse” necessary for ensuring good product quality (refinished work). Plus, she is including fabrics and sundry supplies.

The couple plan on starting to build a house at summer’s end. Their dream is to acquire a vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase a used overlock stitch machine, fabrics, etc.

loans.name: Macdonald

texts.en:
Macdonald is a bright, eager man who resides in a town called Nkhata Bay in Malawi. Nkhata Bay is scenically situated on the shore of Lake Malawi and is thus a huge tourist attraction. Nkhata bay is also situated between the two biggest cities in Malawi which makes it an ideal location for an emerging entrepreneur.

Macdonald is looking to set up his own business here, this will make the sending and receiving of money much easier and safer for locals.
At 34 years old, Macdonald is the breadwinner in a family of two. Macdonald’s dream is to run his own business, but lack of capital is a huge obstacle in making this dream a reality
Currently, the economy in Malawi makes it difficult for young people to find gainful employment. This makes it difficult for Macdonald to support himself and his family. He believes that becoming a Zoona agent and running his own business will turn his situation around.

Macdonald has a certificate in Accounting and he would like to make a success of running a mobile money transfer business in Nkhata Bay. Macdonald will use the revenue generated to further his education. He is excited at the prospect of employing people. With this loan, Macdonald will be able to purchase a branded Zoona trading trolley which he needs in order to serve customers. He will also purchase a mobile phone and have the funds needed to serve people who need to access financial services in Nkhata Bay.
Macdonald thanks Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: to procure a Zoona branded trolley and an internet enabled phone as well as the funds needed to make the actual transactions so that he can start running his own business.

loans.name: Silpha

texts.en:
Silpha is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells shoes. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her primary customers are individuals.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of shoes.

Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be a successful business lady.

loans.use: to buy more stock of shoes.

loans.name: Segundo Francisco

texts.es:
Segundo con 24 años de edad, de estado civil soltero,vive en casa familiar, junto a sus padres, en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque,país Perú.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Segundo se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales (patos,cerdos).Así mismo brinda servicio de transporte urbano, desde hace 05 años. Eventualmente percibe ingresos por servicios de construcción. Solicita préstamo para dar mantenimiento a su mototaxi y para otros gastos familiares. Así ofrecerá una mejor atención y a la vez solucionará problemas de deuda en casa, otorgándole una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Segundo con experiencia crediticia con Edpyme Alternativa.Socio exclusivo.
texts.en:
Segundo is 24 years old and unmarried. He lives in the family home, together with his parents, in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo Province, Lambayeque Department, Peru. The inhabitants of this area work mostly in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Segundo rears and sells animals for a living (ducks and pigs). He has also provided an urban transport service for the last five years. Occasionally, he receives income for construction work. He is asking for a loan for maintenance of his motorbike taxi and for other family expenses. This will allow him to offer a better service and at the same time solve debt problems at home, providing a better quality of life for his family.

Segundo has previous loan experience with Edpyme Alternativa. Exclusive member.

loans.use: for maintenance of his motorbike taxi and for other family expenses

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jennifer is 23 years old now.

Jennifer has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jennifer requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy variety of fish to sell.

Jennifer has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Jennifer would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
Ella es una joven madre soltera de 25 de edad, es una joven trabajadora con un hijo de 4 años. Desde hace 3 años padece de una enfermedad crónico degenerativa, por lo que comenzó a tener disminución visual.
Recibió un tratamiento quirúrgico con el cual obtuvo malos resultados. Actualmente la joven presenta sangrado activo en la retina de ambos ojos que merma su calidad de vida. Desgraciadamente no cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja quien la dejo sola con su hijo. Sus recursos son limitados por lo que no puede solventar el tratamiento.
texts.en:
She is a 25-year-old single mother, a hardworking young woman with a 4-year-old son. For three years, she has suffered from a chronic degenerative illness that has caused her to begin to lose her vision.

She underwent a surgical treatment with bad results. She currently has active retinal bleeding in both eyes that is reducing her quality of life. Sadly, she does not have the support of her spouse, who left her alone with her son. Her resources are limited, so she cannot pay for treatment.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment

loans.name: Kanha

texts.en:
A local resident living in a rural village of Kandal province, Kanha is 30 years old. She has two children who need her to support their education.

Growing rice is the primary source of her income, and she has been in this business for 12 years. She can add more income via working at a garment factory. Her farming business does not grow well, and she cannot get high yields.

Kanha is new to VisionFund. She is requesting a loan to buy a motorcycle to commute to work on time. She hopes this loan will help her improve her lifestyle and keep her children in school until they graduate.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to commute to work on time.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un señor mayor de edad y padece de una enfermedad crónica degenerativa, por lo que presenta problemas de desgaste en sus piezas dentales y sangrado en sus encías. Desafortunadamente no cuenta con los suficientes recursos para llevar a cabo su tratamiento.
texts.en: He is a senior citizen and suffers from a chronic degenerative illness that causes dental erosion and bleeding gums. Unfortunately, he does not have sufficient resources to have the treatment done.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment

loans.name: Louisette

texts.fr: Louisette constate une augmentation considérable des quantités de produits qu'elle vend dans son épicerie. Elle voit encore un potentiel d’extension dans son activité. Si elle arrive à diversifier les produits à vendre, elle aura beaucoup plus de clients. Avec ce prochain prêt, elle compte acheter 200 Kg de riz, 100 Kg de maïs, 50 Kg de sucre et 100 Kg de haricot. Elle a assuré sans difficulté les dépenses pour la rentrée scolaire et elle compte réhabiliter sa maison avec les bénéfices du prêt.
texts.en:
Louisette noticed a considerable increase in the quantities of products she sells in her grocery store. She still sees a potential to expand in her business. If she manages to diversify the products sold, she will have a much large customer base.

With this next loan, she intends to purchase 200 kg of rice, 100 kg of corn, 50 kg of sugar, and 100 kg of beans. She has easily made sure to cover return-to-school expenses, and she intends to renovate her house with the profits from the loan.

loans.use: to purchase 200 kg of rice, 100 kg of corn, 50 kg of sugar, and 100 kg of beans to increase and diversify local products to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: Mbeyu

texts.en:
Mbeyu is married with three kids, all of whom attend school, which is the reason for her hard work. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Mbeyu has operated a kiosk business from home for the past six years, selling to passersby and neighbors. She cited seasonality and theft as her challenges.

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase cement for construction of her house. Her dream is to see her children get a better education and become important people in the society.

loans.use: to purchase cement for construction of her house.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is a 23-year-old single woman who studied beauty care in an institute and who has eight years of experience. She loves this industry and believes that taking care of one's physical appearance is very important for health, and ultimately has a soothing effect on the mind and body.

A few months ago, she opened a beauty salon and she is working hard to develop it, gain loyal customers, and attract new ones. Today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy the necessary tools for her salon and to satisfy her customers' special requests.

Rita hopes to expand her business and increase her income to build a better future for herself.

loans.use: to buy the necessary tools for her beauty salon business.

loans.name: Sana

texts.en:
Greetings from Palestine. Sana is 31 years old. She is a married woman with three kids, and lives in Yabad in Jenin city.

Sana has a small poultry farm in front of her house. Her main business is chickens, chicks, eggs, etc. Sana needs the loan to buy chickens in order to raise them, and after that, sell them and make some profits.

The business faces two main challenges. The first one is the lack of liquidity, which limits her ability to expand her project, and the other challenge is the political risk, a situation that is unstable and difficult to navigate.

For the future, Sana hopes to expand her project by increasing the poultry farm.

Sana thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy chickens in order to raise them, and after that, sell them and make some profits.

loans.name: Rosal

texts.en:
Rosal is a 37-year-old woman. She earns a living through raising and selling of hogs. She has been in the hog raising livelihood for almost three years now.

She is married and has three children. Her eldest child is 13, while the youngest is 5. Her husband's occupation was a farmer.

She is asking for a loan to buy piglets. With these, she is aiming to increase the number of livestock that she is going to raise. In that way, her financial income will improve. She could also start to expand and invest in other sources of living to become sustainable.

In the future, Rosal is hoping that she will be able to continue to finance the schooling of her children in preparation ahead of what life may bring.

loans.use: to buy piglets.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells potatoes and fish. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good place for business, and her primary customers are individuals.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of potatoes. She hopes that in the future, she will be the best supplier of potatoes. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

She will use the anticipated profits to open other business branches.

loans.use: to buy more stock of potatoes.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells cabbage and onions. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are individuals. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of cabbage and onions. Her business goal is to have a large-scale business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cabbage and onions.

loans.name: Miriam Rosario

texts.es:
Miriam es una joven mujer de 22 años de edad, soltera, sin hijos, y estudia contaduría pública. 
Ella es alegre, divertida y muy estudiosa. Sus estudios los realiza en la universidad pública ubicada en el centro de la ciudad.
Miriam es de tez morena, cabello negro largo  baja estatura, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español. Su vida la realiza en casa de sus padres que trabajan, viven en una casa alquilada construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. Ella estudia contabilidad y esta cursando el 2 año de 5 que dura la carrera, su actitud es emprendedora, tiene Iniciativa, cuenta con un fuerte deseo de superación, “estudio y trabajo, el tiempo que tengo es muy reducido…” comenta. Paralelamente a sus estudios también trabaja como ayudante de costura en un taller de confección de polleras (ropa tradicional). La ventaja de sus actividades es que los horarios no se cruzan entre sí, la desventaja es la falta de una computadora portátil. Sus seño es terminar de estudiar para trabajar en su rubro, ella desea comprar una computadora portátil para continuar con sus estudios. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 año que estudia y trabaja.
Es por esos motivos que Miriam solicita un préstamo para comprar una computadora portátil para continuar estudiando contabilidad.
texts.en:
Miriam is a 22-year-old young woman. She is single, has no children, and is studying public accounting. She is cheerful, fun, and very studious. She goes to school at the public university located in the center of the city.

Miriam is brown-skinned, with long black hair and short stature. Her native language is Aymará, and she speaks Spanish. She lives in the home of her parents, who work. They live in a rented house built of brick that has all the basic utilities. She is studying accounting and is in the second year of her five-year degree program. She has initiative, an enterprising attitude, and a strong desire to better herself. "I study and work. I don't have much time," she comments.

Along with her studies, Miriam also works as an sewing assistant in a traditional skirt workshop. The advantage of her activities is that there are no scheduling conflicts, and her disadvantage is the lack of a laptop computer. Her dream is to finish her education in order to work in her field. She would like to buy a laptop computer to continue with her studies. This is her first lending cycle with the institution in the year that she has been working and studying.

For these reasons, Miriam is requesting a loan to buy a laptop computer in order to finish studying accounting.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer to continue studying accounting

loans.name: Victorina

texts.en: Victorina is 61 years old and married with 4 children. She helps provide for their daily needs by helping her husband work on their farm. To improve the farm, she requested a loan to purchase fertilizer and pesticide. She sells some bananas in town and keeps some for family consumption. In the future, she wants to cultivate her adjacent farm to ensure a better source of income for the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en:
Joy is a 37-year-old-woman. She is married and is blessed with two sons, ages 13 and 8 years old.

She and her husband raised their children by selling barbecue to the community of Calape, Bohol. They have been doing this for 14 years, since they started their married life. Joy is asking for a loan to buy chicken wings, legs, liver, intestines, pork, and hotdogs. She will also buy charcoal and barbecue sticks.

Joy wishes to improve her business to have enough money to send her children to school and have better lives in the future.

loans.use: to buy chicken wings, legs, liver, intestines, pork, and hotdogs; charcoal and barbecue sticks.

loans.name: Herine

texts.en:
Herine is a married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells beverages. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good place for business, and her primary customers are individuals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of soda. Her business goal is to own a motorcycle for distribution within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land.

This is her sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of soda.

loans.name: Resma

texts.en:
Resma is 41 years old and has three children. She lives in Lupagan, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She grows and harvests rice, work that she has done since she was married. Her husband works in heavy activities on the farm, since it is the only way they have to provide for the family needs. Resma and her husband get up early and have to go to the fields, where they have to oversee the crops.

Resma is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizer, since she needs farm improvement.

In the future, she wants to have a better house than she has now, and to be able to give her children the education she did not have, since today people who are better prepared academically are able to get better jobs. She is sure that she can achieve her goals with the help of these loans.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una señora casada de 60 años de edad, se encuentra muy preocupada por su esposo ya que sufre de cataratas en ambos ojos por lo que ha perdido la vista en un 80 por ciento. Necesita urgentemente ser operado para poder recuperar su vista. Ellos se encuentran solos ya que nunca pudieron tener hijos. Su esposo recibe una pensión y es el único sustento económico con el que cuentan, mismo que no les alcanza para solventar el tratamiento.
texts.en: She is a 60-year-old married woman. She is very worried about her husband, as he suffers from cataracts in both eyes, which have caused him to lose eighty percent of his vision. He urgently needs surgery to recover his eyesight. They are alone, as they were never able to have children. Her husband receives a pension; it is the only financial income that they have, and it is not enough to pay for the treatment.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment

loans.name: Jenny Rose

texts.en:
Jenny Rose is 24 years old and married with three children.

Jenny Rose works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries.

Jenny Rose has borrowed and paid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Jenny Rose aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, canned goods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Annabel

texts.en:
Annabel is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Annabel is 40 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Annabel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Annabel requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, bananas, etc. for her food production business.

Annabel has been in this business for 7 years. Annabel would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like cooking oil, sugar, bananas, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en:
Everlyne is a widowed woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be focused and determined.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, soap, and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a fast-growing area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap, and other items.

Her business goal is to open a wholesale shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en:
Gerald is starting up a fish-selling business to provide for the needs of his family. He is a 24-year-old man who lives in the town of Tubigon, Bohol. He is the father of a one-year-old son. His partner stays at home and takes good care of their child.

That means Gerald is working alone. So, this is the reason why he needs to work hard every day. Thus, he is asking for a loan to buy more fresh fish to sell to uplift their earnings and their livelihood.

He dreams to improve their business in the future to have better means of living.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish.

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose : Tiene 48 años de edad, convive con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, tiene casa propia, habita en la comunidad de  Trojes, El Paraíso, al Oriente de Honduras  es un Sr.  Caficultor y ganadero, su actividad principal es la caficultura, el se dedica a esta actividad desde hace muchos años, de la cual cuenta con muy buena experiencia por su excelente desempeño, actualmente cuenta con  de café de la variedad de cafe

Don Jose tanbien  se dedica a la ganederia, actualmente el cuenta con 8 vacas productoras de leche las cuales le generan ingresos a diario, con el credito que nos ha solicitado podra comprar los fertilizantes necesarios para la fertilizar su finca y asi obtener una mejor produccion y asi seguir octeniendo mejores ingresos y enfrentar l lucha dia con dia.

su sueño es poder mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y su familia. 

Trojes, Honduras- Septiembre 2015.
texts.en:
Señor Jose is 48 years old. He lives with his wife and their four children. He has his own house and lives in the community of Trojes, El Paraíso, in the eastern part of Honduras. He is a coffee grower and rancher, but his principal activity is growing coffee. He has worked at that activity for many years and has very good experience because of his excellent work. He currently has coffee of the coffee variety.

Jose also works in ranching; he currently has eight milk cows, which generate daily income. With the loan that he has requested from us, he will be able to buy the necessary fertilizers to fertilize his farm and obtain greater production, thereby continuing to earn better income and face his daily struggle. His dream is to be able to improve his and his family's living conditions.

Trojes, Honduras. September, 2015.

loans.use: to buy the fertilizers necessary to fertilize his farm in order to obtain better production.

loans.name: Milena

texts.en:
Milena is very thankful to all lenders for the previous loan. The loan has helped her to improve her living conditions and make life easier.

Her husband is continuing taxi-driving work. He has much work, and when he is needing a break or pause, Milena helps out. Normally she stays home to take care of the house and children while he works, and is very busy between all of her responsibilities.

Milena is requesting a loan in order to register the taxi and change the tires for the upcoming winter season. They are very satisfied with their work and the income that it provides, giving the support they need to meet their children's and family's needs.

Her goal is to open a small taxi company in the future.

loans.use: to register the taxi and change the tires for the upcoming winter season.

loans.name: Titphalla

texts.en:
Titphalla, 40, is a farmer living in a one-bedroom house located in Kandal province. She is a married mother of four dependent children, two of whom are in school; the other two are under school age.

She has been growing rice as the main source of income for 22 years. She can earn more income via working at a garment factory. Unfortunately, because of drought and the high cost of fertilizer, she cannot afford to support her crop well.

This time, she is applying for a loan from VisionFund, which will be her first-cycle loan. She will use her loan to buy organic fertilizer to increase crop productivity. She hopes to get higher yields, thereby letting her upgrade her standard of living and keep sending her children to school.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to increase crop productivity, so as to upgrade her standard of living and keep sending her children to school.

loans.name: Ma. Milagrosa

texts.en:
Ma. Milagrosa is a 61-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and has four adult children.

She and her husband are working together to improve their charcoal business. They have been doing this to earn a living for almost 16 years. Aside from selling charcoal, Ma. Milagrosa also does “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) weaving. She works hard to save money for their future needs.

Ma. Milagrosa is asking for a loan to buy coconut shells for charcoal production. She will also buy buri leaves for weaving.

In the future, Ma. Milagrosa wishes to improve their livelihood for sustainability.

loans.use: to buy coconut shells for charcoal production and “buri” leaves for weaving.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a widowed woman. She has six children. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, and fruits.

She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits.

She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. She will use the anticipated profits to open a new shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Shirley Janneth

texts.es:
Shirley continúa con su negocio de venta de juguetes. El crédito que obtuvo lo invirtió comprando juguetes por mayor, el pago de sus cuotas fue puntual porque pudo vender bien la mercadería. Actualmente su negocio es bastante visitado, la gente pregunta el precio del juguete y a los pocos días regresa para comprarlo, “los papás compran todo para sus hijos…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que puede visitar varias ferias y captar nuevos clientes, la desventaja es el transporte de la mercadería, su sueño es tener un puesto fijo de venta, ella desea comprar juguetes de temporada de navidad para ofertarlos en las ferias venideras. Esta es la 3 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que desarrolla esta actividad. 
Es por esos motivos que Shirley solicita un préstamo para comprar juguetes de temporada de navidad para ofertarlos en las ferias que vienen.
texts.en:
Shirley continues in her business selling toys. She invested her prior loan in buying toys wholesale. She was punctual in making her payments because she was able to sell the merchandise well. Currently her business is visited a lot. People ask the price of a toy and a few days later return to buy it. "The parents buy everything for their children," she says.

The advantage of her business is that she's able to visit several fairs and attract new customers. The disadvantage is transporting the merchandise. Her dream is to have a fixed place to sell. She wants to buy toys for the Christmas season to offer in the upcoming fairs. This is the third round of loans with the institution in the 2 years she has in this business. For these reasons, Shirley seeks a loan to buy toys for the Christmas season to offer in the the upcoming fairs.

loans.use: to buy toys for the Christmas season to offer them in the upcoming fairs.

loans.name: Romulo

texts.en:
Romulo is 45 years old, married and has three children.

To make a living, Romulo farms and manages a machine shop at the nearby community. Romulo has been in the machine shop for over a year and wants to continue operating his business extending good services to all his customers.

Romulo is now asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy a lathe machine to use in his repair shop. This will help improve the accuracy of his work.

Someday he hopes to earn good profits to further expand his business.

loans.use: to buy a lathe machine to use in his repair shop.

loans.name: Carlos Arturo

texts.es: Carlos es un emprendedor comerciante de 45 años que encontró en esta profesión, la oportunidad de aumentar los ingresos de su hogar y ofrecer a sus seres queridos una mejor calidad de vida.  Su negocio inició cuando su cónyuge se incorporó a una empresa de ventas por catálogos y posteriormente el compró unas vitrinas exhibidoras que surtió con la oferta de productos de la revista, adicionalmente adquirió un enfriador para conservar cervezas que vende a sus vecinos del barrio. También ofrece servicio de transporte en su motocicleta que a su vez utiliza para entregar pedidos a clientes que no residen en los alrededores. Carlos trabaja de la mano de su cónyuge y ambos están comprometidos a con la crianza y bienestar de sus seis hijos, y desea incrementar sus ingresos, para ello está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en ropa, calzado y cervezas, para aprovechar la temporada decembrina. Su meta familiar es tener casa propia y continuar en el negocio.
texts.en:
Carlos is an entrepreneurial 45-year-old merchant who found in his profession an opportunity to increase his household income and offer his loved ones a better quality of life. His business started when his spouse joined a catalog-sales company. Later, he bought some display cases that he stocked with an assortment of products from the catalog. In addition, he acquired a cooler to hold the beer that he sells to his neighbors in the area. He also offers transportation service on his motorcycle, which he also uses to deliver orders to customers who don't live nearby.

Carlos works hand-in-hand with his spouse, and both are committed to the upbringing and wellbeing of their six children. They would like to increase their income, so they applied for their first Kiva loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. They will invest in clothing, footwear, and beer in order to take advantage of the holiday season. His goal for his family is to have their own house and to continue with their business.

loans.use: to invest in clothing, footwear, and beer to take advantage of the holiday season.
